original: dran pa nyams par byas pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa nyams par byas pa ste /
translated: They have impaired mindfulness.

original: gang dag las su bya ba'i dus su dran pa'i rigs cung zad skye bar mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dag las su bya ba'i dus su dran pa'i rigs cung zad skye bar mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When it is time to do their work, they do not have the slightest mindfulness.

original: gang dag gis skyes par gyur kyang nyam chung bar gyur pa de dag ni dran pa zhan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gis skyes par gyur kyang nyam chung bar gyur pa de dag ni dran pa zhan pa yin no //
translated: Even when they do have mindfulness, it is weak.

original: grong khyer chen po drug ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: grong khyer chen po drug ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are six great cities:

original: grong khyer tsam pa dang / grong khyer b'a r'a na s'i dang / rgyal po'i khab dang / yangs pa can dang / mnyan yod dang / ser skya dag yin no //
analyzed: grong khyer tsam pa dang / grong khyer b'a r'a na s'i dang / rgyal po'i khab dang / yangs pa can dang / mnyan yod dang / ser skya dag yin no //
translated: Campā, Vārāṇasī, Rājagṛha, Śrāvastī, Kapilavastu, and Vaiśālī.

original: sems kyis chen po nyid du 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir bkur stir byas pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis chen po nyid du 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir bkur stir byas pa'o //
translated: They are revered because they are considered to be great cities.

original: bla mar byas pa zhes bya ba ni lung 'bogs pa'i sgo nas bla ma'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bla mar byas pa zhes bya ba ni lung 'bogs pa'i sgo nas bla ma'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
translated: They are honored because they are the abodes of the learned.

original: ri mor byas zhes bya ba ni skye bo thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas su gzhag par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ri mor byas zhes bya ba ni skye bo thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas su gzhag par gyur pa yin no //
translated: They are respected because they are the abodes of the most distinguished people.

original: mchod par byas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod par byas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are worshipped because

original: lus btud pas phyag byas pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lus btud pas phyag byas pa la sogs pas so //
translated: He prostrates by bowing his body.

original: gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: gang dag gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: He says, “kings” and so on.

original: rgyal po ni dbang bskur bar gyur pa'o //🔽gang gi tshad rgyal po dang 'dra ba tsam du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni rgyal po dang 'dra ba tsam mo //
analyzed: rgyal po ni dbang bskur bar gyur pa'o // gang gi tshad rgyal po dang 'dra ba tsam du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni rgyal po dang 'dra ba tsam mo //
translated: Kings are those who have been consecrated.🔽Those who are like kings are “like kings.”

original: rgyal po'i blon po dam pa'am rgyal tshab yin no //🔽khyim bdag ni gang zhig rtag tu mgon med pa dag @118a * //
analyzed: rgyal po'i blon po dam pa'am rgyal tshab yin no // khyim bdag ni gang zhig rtag tu mgon med pa dag @118a * //
translated: They are the best ministers of the king or the king’s viceroys.

original: la zas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: la zas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa ste /
translated: Householders are those who always give food to the helpless.

original: dper na khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the householder Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: grong rdal gyi gtso bo la 'dir grong rdal gyi mi dang / ljongs kyi mi gtso bo la ljongs kyi mir 'dod do //
analyzed: grong rdal gyi gtso bo la 'dir grong rdal gyi mi dang / ljongs kyi mi gtso bo la ljongs kyi mir 'dod do //
translated: Here, the head of a village is considered to be the head of the people of the village, and the head of a region is considered to be the head of the people of the region.

original: bye ba phrag brgya'i dbang phyug yin pas na nor can no //
analyzed: bye ba phrag brgya'i dbang phyug yin pas na nor can no //
translated: Because he is the lord of a billion, he is a wealthy man.

original: tshong dpon ni tshong pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshong dpon ni tshong pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: A guild master is the head of merchants.

original: ded dpon ni gang gi yul nas yul gzhan du don mthun ded par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ded dpon ni gang gi yul nas yul gzhan du don mthun ded par byed pa'o //
translated: The caravan leader is the one who leads the caravan from one country to another.

original: brnyes pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gos la sogs pa brnyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brnyes pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gos la sogs pa brnyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: The acquisition is the acquisition of the Dharma robes and so on by the Blessed One.

original: yun ring po shig las zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid du goms pa rtsom pa la sogs pa nas so //
analyzed: yun ring po shig las zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid du goms pa rtsom pa la sogs pa nas so //
translated: For a long time means from the beginning of the practice of the path to buddhahood.

original: rdzogs byed la sogs pa ston pa drug ces bya ba la rdzogs byed ces bya ba ni ming yin la /
analyzed: rdzogs byed la sogs pa ston pa drug ces bya ba la rdzogs byed ces bya ba ni ming yin la /
translated: The six teachers such as Pūraṇa are mentioned. Pūraṇa is a name.

original: 'od srungs zhes bya ba ni rgyud yin no //
analyzed: 'od srungs zhes bya ba ni rgyud yin no //
translated: Kāśyapa is a lineage.

original: kun du rgyu zhes bya ba ni ming yin la /
analyzed: kun du rgyu zhes bya ba ni ming yin la /
translated: The wandering mendicant is a name.

original: gnag lhas kyi bu zhes bya ba ni rgyud yin no //
analyzed: gnag lhas kyi bu zhes bya ba ni rgyud yin no //
translated: The son of the sage Kapila is a lineage.

original: yang dag rgyal ba can zhes bya ba yang ming tsam yin la /
analyzed: yang dag rgyal ba can zhes bya ba yang ming tsam yin la /
translated: The one with the correct banner is a mere name.

original: smra 'dod kyi bu mo'i bu zhes bya ba ni rgyud yin no //
analyzed: smra 'dod kyi bu mo'i bu zhes bya ba ni rgyud yin no //
translated: The son of Mākandika is a lineage.

original: mi pham zhes bya ba ni ming yin la /
analyzed: mi pham zhes bya ba ni ming yin la /
translated: Ajita is a name.

original: skra'i la ba'i cha lugs 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir skra'i la ba can no //
analyzed: skra'i la ba'i cha lugs 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir skra'i la ba can no //
translated: He is called Jaṭila because he has matted hair.

original: nog can zhes bya ba ni ming yin la /
analyzed: nog can zhes bya ba ni ming yin la /
translated: The word “bull” is a name,

original: ka tya ya'i bu zhes bya ba ni rigs yin no //
analyzed: ka tya ya'i bu zhes bya ba ni rigs yin no //
translated: and “son of Kātyāyana” is a clan name.

original: gcer bu ba zhes bya ba ni dka' thub kyi rigs can 'ga' zhig gi ming yin la /
analyzed: gcer bu ba zhes bya ba ni dka' thub kyi rigs can 'ga' zhig gi ming yin la /
translated: The word “naked ascetic” is the name of a certain class of ascetics,

original: gnyen gyi bu zhes bya ba ni rigs yin no //
analyzed: gnyen gyi bu zhes bya ba ni rigs yin no //
translated: and “son of a friend” is a clan name.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis log pa'i nga rgyal yod pa'i phyir bdag thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes de ltar rlom sems pa dag yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis log pa'i nga rgyal yod pa'i phyir bdag thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes de ltar rlom sems pa dag yin no //
translated: They are those who, because of the innate pride of being not omniscient, think “I am omniscient.”

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de nas bsod snyoms la sogs pa tshol bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de nas bsod snyoms la sogs pa tshol bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Dwelling” means that they go out to seek alms, etc.

original: mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mi'i chos tha mal pa las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ni mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mi'i chos tha mal pa las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ni mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa yin no //
translated: “Superior to human qualities” means that they are superior to ordinary human qualities, and the superknowledges, etc., are superior to human qualities.

original: gang zhig mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul des bdag gis dgug pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul des bdag gis dgug pa ste /
translated: I will summon him with that,

original: bdag gis mngon par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis mngon par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: I will engage him with that.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: One who possesses magical power is one who has accomplished meditative attainment.

original: shes pa smra ba zhes bya ba ni bdag la shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa 'di lta bu yod do zhes smra ba'i ngang tshul can yin no //
analyzed: shes pa smra ba zhes bya ba ni bdag la shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa 'di lta bu yod do zhes smra ba'i ngang tshul can yin no //
translated: One who speaks of knowledge is one who has the nature of speaking, “I have this kind of special knowledge.”

original: bdag nyid @118b sems pa zhes bya ba ni mngon pa'i rgyal gyis shes pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag nyid @118b sems pa zhes bya ba ni mngon pa'i rgyal gyis shes pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One who thinks about himself is one who knows the Abhidharma, but not the ultimate, is what is meant.

original: lam gyi phyed ces bya ba la sogs pa la bdag nyid kyis gtsug lag khang las de lam phyed du shog shig / bdag nyid kyang rang gi gnas khang las lam phyed du mchi'o //
analyzed: lam gyi phyed ces bya ba la sogs pa la bdag nyid kyis gtsug lag khang las de lam phyed du shog shig / bdag nyid kyang rang gi gnas khang las lam phyed du mchi'o //
translated: In the passage beginning with “half the path,” he says, “Come half the path from the monastery,” and “I will come half the path from my own house.”

original: de'i gan du bdag dang de'i gtsug lag khang dang bdag gi gnas khang du yang mi 'ong ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gan du bdag dang de'i gtsug lag khang dang bdag gi gnas khang du yang mi 'ong ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: I will not come to him, nor will he come to my monastery or to my dwelling.

original: ro dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ro dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is like a corpse,

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'tsho ba'i thabs dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi 'tsho ba'i thabs dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro yin pa'am /
translated: because he is devoid of the life of the noble path.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad las khyod ro dang 'dra ba yon tan med pa'i phyir ro dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad las khyod ro dang 'dra ba yon tan med pa'i phyir ro dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Or, he is like a corpse because he is devoid of good qualities, in the presence of the Blessed One.🔽He is one-sided,

original: gcig tu zhes bya ba ni gcig tu mngon par dad pa 'khrul pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu zhes bya ba ni gcig tu mngon par dad pa 'khrul pa med pa'o //
translated: because he is one-sidedly faithful and without error.🔽For the sake of refuting,

original: tshar gcad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mnan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshar gcad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mnan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: for the sake of subduing.🔽For the sake of delight,

original: kun dga'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mtshog tu dka' ba dang ldan par bya bar ro //
analyzed: kun dga'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mtshog tu dka' ba dang ldan par bya bar ro //
translated: for the sake of possessing the highest joy.

original: skye bo dam pa ni 'dir thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa la phan pa yod pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: skye bo dam pa ni 'dir thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa la phan pa yod pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: The holy person here is one who possesses the aids to liberation.🔽For the sake of pleasing,

original: mgu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun du mgu ba dang ldan par mdzad par ro //
analyzed: mgu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun du mgu ba dang ldan par mdzad par ro //
translated: for the sake of possessing complete satisfaction.

original: dge ba rnams ni bcab par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba rnams ni bcab par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should conceal one's virtues.

original: dge ba'i yon tan gyi rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i yon tan gyi rnam grangs yin no //
translated: This is a synonym for virtue.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te thams cad du yon tan bcab par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te thams cad du yon tan bcab par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The meaning is this: One should not conceal one's virtues everywhere.

original: gang gi phyir da sha dang ka pa la dag gi lta ba rnam par dpyad par bya ba'i phyir cho 'phrul bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gro ba rdzas su gnang ba dang nyes pa thams cad du bsgrag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir da sha dang ka pa la dag gi lta ba rnam par dpyad par bya ba'i phyir cho 'phrul bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gro ba rdzas su gnang ba dang nyes pa thams cad du bsgrag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that one should not proclaim one's virtues at all, for it is said that one should display miracles in order to analyze the views of the Carakas and the Parivrajakas, and that one should not proclaim all one's faults.

original: 'jig rten ma dad pa rnyed par 'gyur na mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten ma dad pa rnyed par 'gyur na mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not right to give rise to lack of faith in the world.

original: gang du yon tan bsgrags par byas par gyur na phan pa chen po 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i tshe gdon mi za bar dge ba bcab par bya ba yin pa dang / gang gi tshe nyes pa bsgrags pa na pha rol po ma dad pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe bsgrags par bya ba yin la /🔽pha rol ma dad pa skye bar 'gyur na bsgrag par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: gang du yon tan bsgrags par byas par gyur na phan pa chen po 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i tshe gdon mi za bar dge ba bcab par bya ba yin pa dang / gang gi tshe nyes pa bsgrags pa na pha rol po ma dad pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe bsgrags par bya ba yin la / pha rol ma dad pa skye bar 'gyur na bsgrag par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: When it is not helpful to proclaim faults, then one should proclaim them.

original: sngon dang tha ma ma yin pa'i sems can la zhes bya ba ni gang byang chub kyi sems skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ma gtogs pa gzhan 'ga' zhig bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa de lta bu la 'dir sngon dang tha ma ma yin pa'i sems can du 'dod do //
analyzed: sngon dang tha ma ma yin pa'i sems can la zhes bya ba ni gang byang chub kyi sems skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ma gtogs pa gzhan 'ga' zhig bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa de lta bu la 'dir sngon dang tha ma ma yin pa'i sems can du 'dod do //
translated: A sentient being who is neither a beginning nor an ultimate bodhisattva is one in whom the thought of awakening has arisen, and who, other than the Lord, is incapable of generating it. Such a one is considered here to be a sentient being who is neither a beginning nor an ultimate bodhisattva.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa zhes bya ba ni gang la bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du goms pa yongs su rdzogs pa yod pa de la @119a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa zhes bya ba ni gang la bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du goms pa yongs su rdzogs pa yod pa de la @119a * //
translated: The expression “he has accumulated the roots of good” means that he has completed the practice of the roots of good over three incalculable eons.

original: 'dir dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: Here, the roots of good are the wholesome roots.

original: ji ltar rigs par rjes su sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni khyod ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du mdzes par gyis shig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par rjes su sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni khyod ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du mdzes par gyis shig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: “Act as you wish” means “act as you like.”

original: skra dkar dang stobs med pa'i phyir rgas pa yin no //
analyzed: skra dkar dang stobs med pa'i phyir rgas pa yin no //
translated: Old age is the state of having white hair and being without strength.

original: dbang po yongs su nyams pa'i phyir 'khogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su nyams pa'i phyir 'khogs pa yin no //
translated: Frailty is the state of having deteriorated faculties.

original: yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad lhod par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir gtugs pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad lhod par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir gtugs pa yin no //
translated: Bent over is the state of having all the major and minor limbs slack.

original: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin no zhes skye bo mang po blo mthun par gyur pa ni dgra bcom par blo mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dgra bcom pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin no zhes skye bo mang po blo mthun par gyur pa ni dgra bcom par blo mthun pa yin no //
translated: The expression “he is endowed with the qualities of an arhat” means that many people agree that he is an arhat.

original: mthun par tshangs pa'i rgyu mtshan la spyod pa yin pa'i phyir tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: mthun par tshangs pa'i rgyu mtshan la spyod pa yin pa'i phyir tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yin no //
translated: They are of the same conduct as Brahma because they practice the same cause of Brahma.

original: shin tu mi 'thad pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu mi 'thad pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are not very reasonable, i.e., they are not reasonable.

original: g-yos kun du spyod pas zhes bya ba ni 'dis bdag cag gi bsam pa shes par ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i bcos pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: g-yos kun du spyod pas zhes bya ba ni 'dis bdag cag gi bsam pa shes par ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i bcos pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: They are of deceitful conduct because they have the deceitful thought, “May they not know our thoughts.”

original: zag pa zad pa ma gtogs par mngon par shes pa lnga gang la yod pa de ni mngon par shes pa lda dang ldan pa dag yin te /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa ma gtogs par mngon par shes pa lnga gang la yod pa de ni mngon par shes pa lda dang ldan pa dag yin te /
translated: Those who possess the five superknowledges, except for the superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers, are called those who possess the five superknowledges.

original: de yang lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi yul dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de yang lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi yul dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dag yin no //
translated: They are the superknowledges of the divine eye, the divine ear, the knowledge of others’ minds, the recollection of past lives, and the knowledge of the extinction of the cankers.

original: ri'i phrag ni ri'i skyabs can no //
analyzed: ri'i phrag ni ri'i skyabs can no //
translated: The mountain ranges are the mountain shelters.

original: de dag gis ji ltar na nyi ma bdun gyis sa 'di tsam bskor bar nus she na /
analyzed: de dag gis ji ltar na nyi ma bdun gyis sa 'di tsam bskor bar nus she na /
translated: How can the seven suns burn this much of the earth?

original: 'dir kha cig ni bdud kyi stobs la zhes rjod par byed la /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig ni bdud kyi stobs la zhes rjod par byed la /
translated: Some say: by the power of Mara.

original: gzhan dag ni rkang mgyogs kyi sman gyi stobs la zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rkang mgyogs kyi sman gyi stobs la zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: Others say that it is by the power of the medicine of the winged feet.

original: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang tha mal pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang tha mal pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase the friendly, the hostile, and those who are neutral means

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad la phyogs gsum yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad la phyogs gsum yod pa yin te /
translated: that all worldly beings are of three types.

original: 'di ltar mdza' bo'i phyogs dang / mi mdza' ba'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdza' bo'i phyogs dang / mi mdza' ba'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is to say, there are those who are friendly, those who are hostile, and those who are neutral.

original: bden pa'i tshig gsol cig ces bya ba ni bden pa sngon du song ba can gsol ba ste don du gnyer bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig gsol cig ces bya ba ni bden pa sngon du song ba can gsol ba ste don du gnyer bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase speak words of truth means that one should make a request that is preceded by truthfulness.

original: dbugs phyung ba zhes bya ba ni de dag yid ches pa skyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs phyung ba zhes bya ba ni de dag yid ches pa skyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase they will be comforted means that they will be caused to generate confidence.

original: bden pa'i tshig gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase by whatever words of truth and so on means

original: bden pa smos pas bcad ma thag pa'i tshig dngos po la gnas pa'i bden pa nyid bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: bden pa smos pas bcad ma thag pa'i tshig dngos po la gnas pa'i bden pa nyid bstan pa yin la /
translated: that the very truth that is expressed by the words of truth is taught to be the truth that is based upon entities.

original: bden pa'i tshig smos pas ni mi las bden pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig smos pas ni mi las bden pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase words of truth teaches that this is the truth for humans.

original: gzugs med pa ni gzugs med pa gsum las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa ni gzugs med pa gsum las skyes pa yin no //
translated: The formless realm is born from the three formless realms.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa yin no //
translated: The state of neither perception nor non-perception is born in the peak of existence.

original: 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog @119b pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas 'du shes yang dag pa gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog @119b pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas 'du shes yang dag pa gsal ba yin no //
translated: The state of neither perception nor non-perception is the clear and correct perception through the attainment of cessation and the attainment of non-perception.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Freedom from attachment is ultimate nirvana.

original: thar pa'i thabs khas blangs pa sngon du song ba can gyi mthun pas 'dus pa ni dge 'dun dag yin no //
analyzed: thar pa'i thabs khas blangs pa sngon du song ba can gyi mthun pas 'dus pa ni dge 'dun dag yin no //
translated: The harmonious assembly is the Sangha, which is preceded by the acceptance of the means of liberation.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig tu blo mi brtan pas 'dus pa ni tshogs dag yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig tu blo mi brtan pas 'dus pa ni tshogs dag yin no //
translated: Thus, in some cases, the assembly is the gathering, because the minds are not stable.

original: rigs mthun pas bsdus pa ni 'dus pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pas bsdus pa ni 'dus pa dag yin no //
translated: The assembly is the gathering, because they are gathered by the common lineage.

original: mang po dag gi nang nas 'ga' zhig shes pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir slob ma nyid du 'dus pa ni 'khor yin no //
analyzed: mang po dag gi nang nas 'ga' zhig shes pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir slob ma nyid du 'dus pa ni 'khor yin no //
translated: The retinue is the assembly, because they are gathered as disciples in order to understand something from among the many.

original: tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the passage beginning “morality,”

original: tshul khrims ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: morality is the nature of turning away from natural offenses.

original: brtul zhugs ni dus ma yin pa'i zas la sogs pa bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni dus ma yin pa'i zas la sogs pa bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa las ldog pa yin no //
translated: Asceticism is turning away from offenses that are proscribed.

original: de dag gis lus gdung bar byed cing me lnga sten pa la sogs pa lus gdung bar byed pa'i phyir dka' thub yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis lus gdung bar byed cing me lnga sten pa la sogs pa lus gdung bar byed pa'i phyir dka' thub yin no //
translated: They are austerities because they torment the body, such as the practice of the five fires.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ni mi changs par spyod pa 'ga' zhig las ldog par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ni mi changs par spyod pa 'ga' zhig las ldog par gyur pa'o //
translated: Abiding in pure conduct is turning away from some forms of pure conduct.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: Pure conduct that delights the noble ones is undefiled.

original: bden pa'i tshig gsol ba de'i yan lag dang nying lag ji ltar sngon gyi bzhin du grub par gyur to zhes bya ba de ji ltar rigs te /
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig gsol ba de'i yan lag dang nying lag ji ltar sngon gyi bzhin du grub par gyur to zhes bya ba de ji ltar rigs te /
translated: How can it be correct to say that the limbs and minor parts of his body were restored to their former condition by the power of the words of truth of the one who spoke this truthful statement?

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus zhig nas yang skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus zhig nas yang skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is impossible for one to be born again after the body that arises from karmic maturation has been destroyed.

original: 'di la kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i bden pa'i tshig gi stobs dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag gi lus kyi dbang po de yan lag dang nyid lag rab tu bskyed pa yin no zhes brjod la /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i bden pa'i tshig gi stobs dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag gi lus kyi dbang po de yan lag dang nyid lag rab tu bskyed pa yin no zhes brjod la /
translated: Some say: The power of the words of truth spoken by the Bhagavān generates the body sense faculty of the four great elements that are the natural outflow of the words of truth.

original: kha cig ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi dmigs pa'i khyad par ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul gyis byas pa 'di la ngo mtshar med do zhes rjod par byed do //🔽ca co'i sgra ni dgod pa'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi dmigs pa'i khyad par ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul gyis byas pa 'di la ngo mtshar med do zhes rjod par byed do // ca co'i sgra ni dgod pa'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: Some say: The special object field of buddhas is inconceivable. Therefore it is not surprising that the Bhagavān created this miracle.🔽The sound of babbling is the sound of laughter.

original: ca co'i sgra dbyug sgra zhes bya ba sgra cher bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: ca co'i sgra dbyug sgra zhes bya ba sgra cher bsgrags pa'o //
translated: The sound of babbling is the sound of a stick.

original: 'di nas thos ma thag tu bden pa mngon par rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni bden pa khong du chud ma thag tu shin tu dbang po rno ba nyid kyi phyir phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nas thos ma thag tu bden pa mngon par rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni bden pa khong du chud ma thag tu shin tu dbang po rno ba nyid kyi phyir phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas pa yin no //
translated: Immediately upon hearing this, he realized the truth means that, because of his extremely sharp faculties, he manifested the fruit of non-returner immediately upon understanding the truth.

original: bar du zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang dang thag nye bar ka ba bzhi bsgreng ste /
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang dang thag nye bar ka ba bzhi bsgreng ste /
translated: In the middle means that, near the monastery, four pillars were erected,

original: steng bla res phub pa ni gos kyis bla gang can du byas pa yin no //🔽rdo rje la sogs @120a * //
analyzed: steng bla res phub pa ni gos kyis bla gang can du byas pa yin no // rdo rje la sogs @120a * //
translated: and above them, a canopy was spread, which was covered with cloth.

original: pa la gser las byas pa'i seng ge'i khri rdo rje dang / bee d'urya dang / rin po che la sogs pas brgyan pa bshams so //
analyzed: pa la gser las byas pa'i seng ge'i khri rdo rje dang / bee d'urya dang / rin po che la sogs pas brgyan pa bshams so //
translated: The vajra and so on means that a golden lion throne was set up, adorned with vajras, lapis lazuli, jewels, and so on.

original: gnod pa chung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnod pa ni phyi rol gyi rnam par 'tshe bas gzir ba yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa chung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnod pa ni phyi rol gyi rnam par 'tshe bas gzir ba yin no //
translated: As for are you free from harm? and so on, harm is being oppressed by external violence.

original: kha na ma tho ba ni lus las skyes pa'i nad kyis gzir ba'o ;
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ni lus las skyes pa'i nad kyis gzir ba'o ;
translated: Reproach is being oppressed by illness arising from the body.

original: / nyam nga ba ni yid skyo ba'i nad yin no //
analyzed: / nyam nga ba ni yid skyo ba'i nad yin no //
translated: Anxiety is the illness of mental distress.

original: bskyod pa yang ba ni lus kyi bya ba le lo med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ba ni lus kyi bya ba le lo med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Lightness of movement is the absence of laziness in physical action.

original: 'tsho ba ni bsod snyoms kyis gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ni bsod snyoms kyis gnas pa yin no //
translated: Living on alms is the means of livelihood.

original: stobs dang ldan pa ni 'tsho ba'i 'bras bu nus pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa ni 'tsho ba'i 'bras bu nus pa nyid yin no //
translated: Having strength is the ability to produce the results of livelihood.

original: bde ba ni lus kyi yin no //
analyzed: bde ba ni lus kyi yin no //
translated: Happiness is physical.

original: bde ba la reg par gnas pa ni mngon par dgyes pa dang bcas pas gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas pa ni mngon par dgyes pa dang bcas pas gnas pa yin no //
translated: The experience of happiness is the experience of delight.

original: gal te ji ste yang rnam pa de dag gis khyim pa dag so sor kun dga' bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te ji ste yang rnam pa de dag gis khyim pa dag so sor kun dga' bar 'gyur la /
translated: If householders are pleased with these qualities,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang ri mor byas pa des dgyes par 'gyur ba kho na yin no //🔽yal ga ni sdong po las gyes pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang ri mor byas pa des dgyes par 'gyur ba kho na yin no // yal ga ni sdong po las gyes pa yin la /
translated: the Blessed One is pleased with their veneration.🔽A branch is a part of a tree that grows out from the trunk.

original: yal ga phra mo yang yal ga las gyes pa yin no //
analyzed: yal ga phra mo yang yal ga las gyes pa yin no //
translated: A twig is a part of a branch.

original: des rgyas pa ni yangs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des rgyas pa ni yangs par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is said to be extensive because it is large.

original: mngon par 'dus byas pa zhes bya ba ni byas pa dang bcas par ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus byas pa zhes bya ba ni byas pa dang bcas par ro //
translated: It is said to be well-constructed because it is well-made.

original: g-yos zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen por g-yos bstan pa yin no //🔽gnod pa'i gtam ni ha ha'i sgra 'don pa'am /
analyzed: g-yos zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen por g-yos bstan pa yin no // gnod pa'i gtam ni ha ha'i sgra 'don pa'am /
translated: By “cooking” and so on, the cooking of the small, medium, and great is taught.

original: sgrog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The talk of harm is the utterance or proclamation of the sound “ha ha.”

original: 'di la yang chung du la sogs pa'i dbye ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang chung du la sogs pa'i dbye ba shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, too, the divisions of small and so on should be understood.

original: drang srong de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: drang srong de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Those sages saw the Blessed Buddha, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa zhe na /🔽nyi ma shar ma thag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa zhe na / nyi ma shar ma thag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: What kind of Blessed One?🔽The text says “just as soon as the sun rose,” and so on.

original: 'phral du shar ma thag pa ni nyi ma shar ma thag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'phral du shar ma thag pa ni nyi ma shar ma thag pa yin la /
translated: “Just as soon as” means immediately after rising.

original: de'i 'od kyis mdzes pa'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa dang / gser btso ma'i mdog ni gser btul ba ste dri ma med pa de gtubs pa'i dum bu spungs shing phung por byas pa gang yin pa de dang 'dra bar dmar ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'od kyis mdzes pa'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa dang / gser btso ma'i mdog ni gser btul ba ste dri ma med pa de gtubs pa'i dum bu spungs shing phung por byas pa gang yin pa de dang 'dra bar dmar ba dag yin no //
translated: It is red like a heap of pieces of that gold that has been cut up and piled up.

original: me tog ku ran da ka'i tshogs dang / aa sho ka'i phung po ltar dmar ba yin no //
analyzed: me tog ku ran da ka'i tshogs dang / aa sho ka'i phung po ltar dmar ba yin no //
translated: It is red like a heap of kuruvinda flowers or like a heap of asoka sprouts.

original: chu 'dzin chu bcas kyi zab pa'i sgra dang / rgya mtsho dang / ston ka'i khyu mchog dang / rnga bo che'i sgra ltar gsung zab pa yin no //
analyzed: chu 'dzin chu bcas kyi zab pa'i sgra dang / rgya mtsho dang / ston ka'i khyu mchog dang / rnga bo che'i sgra ltar gsung zab pa yin no //
translated: His speech is deep like the deep sound of rain clouds full of water, like the ocean, like the autumn bull, like the sound of a great drum.

original: shin tu gsal bas na rnam par gsal ba yin la thos na bde ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bde bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: shin tu gsal bas na rnam par gsal ba yin la thos na bde ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bde bskyed pa yin te /
translated: It is clear because it is very clear. It is pleasant to hear because it produces the pleasant consciousness of the ear.

original: rnam par gsal ba dang / thos na bde ba dang / snyan @120b pa'i gsung gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gsal ba dang / thos na bde ba dang / snyan @120b pa'i gsung gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He who has clear, pleasant and melodious speech is so called.

original: 'o ma'i mtsho ni 'o ma'i rgya mtsho yin la /
analyzed: 'o ma'i mtsho ni 'o ma'i rgya mtsho yin la /
translated: The ocean of milk is the ocean of milk.

original: de'i dbu ba ni dbu ba'i phreng ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i dbu ba ni dbu ba'i phreng ba yin te /
translated: His forehead is adorned with a tuft of hair, which is like a garland of foam.

original: 'o ma'i mtsho dbu ba'i phreng ba dang 'dra bar dkar ba'i mdzod spu des rnam par spras pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'o ma'i mtsho dbu ba'i phreng ba dang 'dra bar dkar ba'i mdzod spu des rnam par spras pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The tuft of hair on the forehead is white like a garland of foam on the ocean of milk.

original: grangs med pa ni bgrang ba'i phyir mi nus pa yin la /
analyzed: grangs med pa ni bgrang ba'i phyir mi nus pa yin la /
translated: Incalculable means that it cannot be counted.

original: gzhan la ma mthong ba'i phyir ngo mtshar yin zhing bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i nus pa mnga' ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ma mthong ba'i phyir ngo mtshar yin zhing bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i nus pa mnga' ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: It is amazing because it is not seen elsewhere. It is inconceivable because it has an inconceivable power.

original: gnas ni grangs med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rten yin no //
analyzed: gnas ni grangs med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rten yin no //
translated: The abode is the support of the qualities of being incalculable and so on.

original: srid par dga' ba ste zhen pa gang yin pa dang / bde ba gang yin pa dang / gzhan gyis bkur sti byas pa de dag la re ba ste /🔽de la mngon par 'dod cing chags pa gang yin pa de nyid dri ma'i 'dam dang nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: srid par dga' ba ste zhen pa gang yin pa dang / bde ba gang yin pa dang / gzhan gyis bkur sti byas pa de dag la re ba ste / de la mngon par 'dod cing chags pa gang yin pa de nyid dri ma'i 'dam dang nyes pa yin te /
translated: Craving for existence is attachment to existence, happiness is the joy of existence, and hope is the desire for honor from others.🔽That very craving for those is the mire of defilement and the fault.

original: nyes pa de dang bral ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa de dang bral ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He who is free from that fault is called the one who is free from the mire of defilement and the fault.

original: dpag tu med pa'i dus bsags pa zhes bya ba ni bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du bsags pa yin no //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i dus bsags pa zhes bya ba ni bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du bsags pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “accumulated over an immeasurable period of time” means that they were accumulated over the course of three “countless” aeons.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The word “etc.” refers to

original: tshogs des thob par gyur pa'i bla na med pa'i ye shes dam pa gang yin pa de kho na rgyan yin pa de'i phyir snyan pa'i rgyan gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs des thob par gyur pa'i bla na med pa'i ye shes dam pa gang yin pa de kho na rgyan yin pa de'i phyir snyan pa'i rgyan gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: the supreme, unsurpassed knowledge that is attained through that accumulation. Since that is the ornament, it is called “the ornament of fame.”

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin de'i cod pan te /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin de'i cod pan te /
translated: The crown of Śakra, Lord of the Gods,

original: cod pan la rin chen rgyan btags pa des zhabs gnyis la bris par gyur pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: cod pan la rin chen rgyan btags pa des zhabs gnyis la bris par gyur pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: is the crown of Śakra, Lord of the Gods. The jeweled ornament that is attached to the crown is placed on both of his feet.

original: cod pan mdzes par bya ba'i phyir mtha'i phyogs su gser gyi lcu gu dang / rin po che 'od gsal ba btags pa ni rin po che'i rgyan gyi sgras brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: cod pan mdzes par bya ba'i phyir mtha'i phyogs su gser gyi lcu gu dang / rin po che 'od gsal ba btags pa ni rin po che'i rgyan gyi sgras brjod pa yin no //
translated: In order to beautify the crown, a golden chain and a bright jewel are attached to the side. The jeweled ornament is expressed by the word “ornament.”

original: mchod par 'os pa ste /
analyzed: mchod par 'os pa ste /
translated: He is worthy of worship.

original: mchod par bya ba lha la sogs pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par mchod pa yin no //
analyzed: mchod par bya ba lha la sogs pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par mchod pa yin no //
translated: The gods and so on who are to be worshipped worship the Bhagavat Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la rgyal po chen po skul bar byed pa gang yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la rgyal po chen po skul bar byed pa gang yin /
translated: What is the great king who incites the Tathagata?

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das skul bar byed pa zhal gyis bzhes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das skul bar byed pa zhal gyis bzhes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why does the Bhagavat accept the inciter?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du nga ni rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul rab tu bstan pa'i phyir don du gnyer ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du nga ni rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul rab tu bstan pa'i phyir don du gnyer ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The Bhagavat has said, “I am not seeking to demonstrate miracles and supernatural powers.🔽If some great being incites me, then I will perform a great service to sentient beings and demonstrate the great miracle.”

original: gal te skyes bu gtso bo 'ga' zhig skul bar byed pa de'i tshe sems can la phan 'dogs pa chen po sngon du mdzad nas cho 'phrul chen po rnam par bstan par bya'o zhes bstan pa dang / skyes bu dam pa ni bskul nas bya ba @121a * //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu gtso bo 'ga' zhig skul bar byed pa de'i tshe sems can la phan 'dogs pa chen po sngon du mdzad nas cho 'phrul chen po rnam par bstan par bya'o zhes bstan pa dang / skyes bu dam pa ni bskul nas bya ba @121a * //
translated: A holy being acts after being incited.

original: chen po la 'jug par 'gyur ba ltar bcom ldan 'das sems can thams cad kyi dam par gyur pa de'i phyir gzhan gyis bskul ba zhal gyis bzhes pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po la 'jug par 'gyur ba ltar bcom ldan 'das sems can thams cad kyi dam par gyur pa de'i phyir gzhan gyis bskul ba zhal gyis bzhes pa yin no //
translated: Just as the great ones enter into the great, so the Blessed One, having become the highest of all beings, accepts the request of others.

original: don ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is for the sake of accomplishing the desired aim.

original: phan pa ni 'jig rten gnyis dang mi 'gal ba'i 'bras bu 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa ni 'jig rten gnyis dang mi 'gal ba'i 'bras bu 'byor par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The benefit is for the sake of the prosperity of the fruit that is not opposed to the two worlds.

original: bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i bde ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i bde ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of happiness is for the sake of generating the happiness of liberation.

original: ji ltar sems rtse gcig pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa thob pas nyid kyi gdan las mi snang bar gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sems rtse gcig pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa thob pas nyid kyi gdan las mi snang bar gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is said that he attained one-pointedness of mind and concentration, and disappeared from his seat, and so on, the explanation should be understood as before.

original: bla na med pa'i cho 'phrul chen po zhes bya ba ni cho 'phrul gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs pa 'jig rten thams cad kyis bskyed pa nyid du mi nus pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i cho 'phrul chen po zhes bya ba ni cho 'phrul gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs pa 'jig rten thams cad kyis bskyed pa nyid du mi nus pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
translated: The so-called “supreme great miracle” is the miracle that, except for the Tathāgata, all worlds are not able to produce. That is the Tathāgata’s uncommon [miracle].

original: shing rta'i 'khor lo tsam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shing rta'i 'khor lo tsam zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The size of a chariot wheel” means

original: shing rta'i 'khor lo tsam gyis ni padma'i ge sar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shing rta'i 'khor lo tsam gyis ni padma'i ge sar bstan pa yin no //
translated: the size of a chariot wheel is an indication of the lotus pericarp.

original: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni padma'i yu ba yin no //
analyzed: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni padma'i yu ba yin no //
translated: “Stem” means the lotus stalk.

original: dgongs pa'i sems kyis shes nas zhes bya ba ni dus de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi stobs kyis de dag thams cad kyis de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs yongs su shes pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i sems kyis shes nas zhes bya ba ni dus de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi stobs kyis de dag thams cad kyis de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs yongs su shes pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Understanding with a mind of intention” means that at that time, by the power of the Blessed One, all of them had a mind capable of fully understanding the Blessed One’s intention in that way.

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshogs ni mdzes pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshogs ni mdzes pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The assembly of Buddhas is the cause of beauty.

original: dper na rna ba la me tog la sogs pa'i tshogs btags pa bde ba dang mdzes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don yin ba de dang 'dra bar phyogs mtshams kyi sgo thams cad mdzes pa 'byor bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'og min gyi mthar thug
analyzed: dper na rna ba la me tog la sogs pa'i tshogs btags pa bde ba dang mdzes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don yin ba de dang 'dra bar phyogs mtshams kyi sgo thams cad mdzes pa 'byor bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'og min gyi mthar thug
translated: For example, it is like the case of the collection of flowers, etc.🔽attached to the ear, which is for the purpose of accomplishing happiness and beauty.

original: pa'i bar du sangs rgyas kyi tshogs sprul pa mdzad pa ni lha dang mi du ma mtho ris dang thar pa la blo 'dzeg par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i bar du sangs rgyas kyi tshogs sprul pa mdzad pa ni lha dang mi du ma mtho ris dang thar pa la blo 'dzeg par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One emanated the collection of Buddhas up to the end of Akaniṣṭha in order to beautify all the gates of the directions, for the purpose of causing many gods and humans to ascend to heaven and liberation.

original: bka' lung ston pa ni 'dir gzhan la yon tan khyad par can khong du chud pa brda sprod pa yin no //
analyzed: bka' lung ston pa ni 'dir gzhan la yon tan khyad par can khong du chud pa brda sprod pa yin no //
translated: Here, the prediction of the scriptures is the communication of the realization of special qualities to others.

original: mig mi 'dzums pa zhes bya ba ni 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa spangs pa'i mig gis lta bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mig mi 'dzums pa zhes bya ba ni 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa spangs pa'i mig gis lta bar byed pa'o //
translated: The unblinking eye is the gaze with an eye that abandons opening and closing.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par phyag 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med par sbyor ba la brtson pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par phyag 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med par sbyor ba la brtson pa yin no //
translated: The unceasing prostration is the effort in uninterrupted application.

original: sgra 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i sems kyis rang gi ris dang skal ba mnyam pa la rab tu grags pa'i yid du 'ong ba'i sgra sgrog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgra 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i sems kyis rang gi ris dang skal ba mnyam pa la rab tu grags pa'i yid du 'ong ba'i sgra sgrog par byed pa'o //
translated: The sound of speech is the pleasant sound that one makes with a joyful mind to one's own group, which is well known to them.

original: mchod pa lhag par zhen pa bya ba ni mchod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin @121b la ;
analyzed: mchod pa lhag par zhen pa bya ba ni mchod pa'i rgyu mtshan yin @121b la ;
translated: The excessive attachment to worship is the reason for worship.

original: / spro ba skyes pa ni las su bya ba la'o //🔽bskul bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhug par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: / spro ba skyes pa ni las su bya ba la'o // bskul bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhug par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: The arousing of enthusiasm is for the activity.

original: spro ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spro ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The exhortation is for the purpose of engaging in the activity, or for the purpose of arousing enthusiasm.

original: brtsam par bya zhing zhes bya ba ni spro ba'i ming can gyi yid la byed pa'i bya bas 'byung bar brtsam par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: brtsam par bya zhing zhes bya ba ni spro ba'i ming can gyi yid la byed pa'i bya bas 'byung bar brtsam par bya ba yin no //
translated: The undertaking is the activity of the mental attention called enthusiasm.

original: dbyung bar bya zhes bya ba ni sred pas sbyar ba'i phongs gzeb las dbyung bar gyis shig pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyung bar bya zhes bya ba ni sred pas sbyar ba'i phongs gzeb las dbyung bar gyis shig pa yin no //
translated: The emergence is the emergence from the cage of craving.

original: byung nas ji zhig bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: byung nas ji zhig bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is to be done after emerging?

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i mtshan nyid can la 'jug cing mngon par sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i mtshan nyid can la 'jug cing mngon par sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: He said: “It is the doctrine of the Blessed Buddha, which is to be entered and applied, having the nature of the noble eightfold path.

original: kho bo ste bdag gi 'chi ba'i dgra bo'i sde gzhom zhing bcom par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: kho bo ste bdag gi 'chi ba'i dgra bo'i sde gzhom zhing bcom par bya ba yin te /
translated: I am to be conquered, to be destroyed, by the army of the enemy, death.

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i ming can gyi nyon mongs pa'i sde'i dbang gis bdag 'chi bdag gi sdes yang dang yang du pham par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i ming can gyi nyon mongs pa'i sde'i dbang gis bdag 'chi bdag gi sdes yang dang yang du pham par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, under the power of the army of afflictions, which is named after the afflictions, I am repeatedly defeated by the army of the Lord of Death.

original: ci'i phyir 'chi bdag sde pham par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la mngon par sbyor bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'chi bdag sde pham par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la mngon par sbyor bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that one should apply oneself to the doctrine of the Buddha in order to defeat the army of the Lord of Death?

original: smras pa / gang gi phyir gang zhig rab tu bag yod pa ste bag med pa spangs pas chos 'dul ba 'di la spyod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi phyir gang zhig rab tu bag yod pa ste bag med pa spangs pas chos 'dul ba 'di la spyod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He said: “Because whoever practices this Dharma-Vinaya, through being very heedful, through abandoning heedlessness, will attain the highest human goal, and will also attain the highest goal of the gods.”

original: chos ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin la /
analyzed: chos ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin la /
translated: The Dharma is right view, right thought, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: 'dul ba ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dul ba ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba yin no //
translated: The Vinaya is right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba ste rgyun spangs nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal mthar byed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'jug par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba ste rgyun spangs nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal mthar byed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la 'jug par bya ba yin no //
translated: Having abandoned the cycle of birth, one will put an end to suffering, which is characterized by the five aggregates of clinging. Therefore, one should enter the teaching of the Buddha.🔽As long as the sun has not risen,

original: ji srid nyi ma ma shar ba zhes bya ba ni ji srid du nyi ma shar bar ma gyur par ro //
analyzed: ji srid nyi ma ma shar ba zhes bya ba ni ji srid du nyi ma shar bar ma gyur par ro //
translated: as long as the sun has not arisen,🔽for that long the fireflies shine.

original: de srid srin bu me khyer snang zhes bya ba ni de srid du phyogs 'ga' zhig gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de srid srin bu me khyer snang zhes bya ba ni de srid du phyogs 'ga' zhig gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: For that long, they illuminate some places.

original: mkha' la snang byed 'char na ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe yang mkha' ste nam mkha' la sprin la sogs ba'i sgrib pa med pa'i phyir snang byed shar zhing de gnas par gyur pa na srin bu me khyer sngon po nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya🔽bar sbyar ro //🔽snang bar byed pas na snang byed yin te /
analyzed: mkha' la snang byed 'char na ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe yang mkha' ste nam mkha' la sprin la sogs ba'i sgrib pa med pa'i phyir snang byed shar zhing de gnas par gyur pa na srin bu me khyer sngon po nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro // snang bar byed pas na snang byed yin te /
translated: The sun is called “illuminator” because it illuminates.

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa rab tu snang bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig gam /🔽gsal bar byed pa thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa yin @122a * //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa rab tu snang bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig gam / gsal bar byed pa thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa yin @122a * //
translated: It illuminates the equal and the unequal.

original: pas na snang byed yin no //
analyzed: pas na snang byed yin no //
translated: Or it illuminates by surpassing all that illuminates.

original: sngon po nyid du 'gyur ba ni nam mkha' la 'od zer stong dang ldan pa can gnas par gyur pa'i tshe srin bu me khyer 'od med par gyur te /
analyzed: sngon po nyid du 'gyur ba ni nam mkha' la 'od zer stong dang ldan pa can gnas par gyur pa'i tshe srin bu me khyer 'od med par gyur te /
translated: It becomes blue because when the sun, which has a thousand rays, rises in the sky, the firefly loses its light.

original: mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i kha dog tsam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i kha dog tsam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It abides only in the color that is not desired.

original: 'dir de'i rgyu ni gang gi phyir 'od med pa dang / de'i sngon bzhin du 'bar ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: 'dir de'i rgyu ni gang gi phyir 'od med pa dang / de'i sngon bzhin du 'bar ba ma yin pas so //
translated: Here, the reason is because it is not radiant and because it is not blazing forth as before.

original: dpe bstan nas de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /🔽snang bar gyur ces bya ba ni snang bar byed pas na snang byed de /
analyzed: dpe bstan nas de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir smras pa / snang bar gyur ces bya ba ni snang bar byed pas na snang byed de /
translated: Having taught the example, in order to establish that, he says:

original: dngos po'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Having become radiant” means having become radiant, because it is the condition of entities.

original: gyur pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' tsam gsal bar byas par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gyur pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' tsam gsal bar byas par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Having become” means having clarified one’s own tenets.

original: gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: gang dag gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: rdzogs byed la sogs pa 'jig rten 'dod gzhung rtog par byed pa'i rtog ge pa dag gis so //
analyzed: rdzogs byed la sogs pa 'jig rten 'dod gzhung rtog par byed pa'i rtog ge pa dag gis so //
translated: By the logicians who imagine the treatises of the world, such as the followers of Pūraṇa.

original: gang ji srid cig tu zhe na /
analyzed: gang ji srid cig tu zhe na /
translated: For how long?

original: smras pa / ji srid de bzhin gshegs pa ma shar ba ste dus ji srid du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'byung bar ma gyur par ro //
analyzed: smras pa / ji srid de bzhin gshegs pa ma shar ba ste dus ji srid du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'byung bar ma gyur par ro //
translated: He says: For as long as the Tathāgata has not arisen, for as long as the Bhagavān Buddha has not appeared.

original: 'jig rten rdzogs sangs rgyas shar ba //
analyzed: 'jig rten rdzogs sangs rgyas shar ba //
translated: “When the perfect Buddha arises in the world”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung bas gdul bya'i 'jig rten gyi padma dang ldan pa'i phyogs de nyid dri ma med par snang ba'i sgo nas rab tu gsal bar byas pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung bas gdul bya'i 'jig rten gyi padma dang ldan pa'i phyogs de nyid dri ma med par snang ba'i sgo nas rab tu gsal bar byas pa'am /
translated: When the Buddha, the Blessed One, appears in the world, that very quarter of the world of disciples, which is endowed with the lotus of disciples, is illuminated by the light of the stainless one,

original: rab tu sad par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu sad par byas pa yin no //
translated: or is awakened.

original: rtog ce na nyan thos bcas mi snang zhes bya ba ni mang po de dag las 'ga' zhig kyang mdzes par gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog ce na nyan thos bcas mi snang zhes bya ba ni mang po de dag las 'ga' zhig kyang mdzes par gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: If one thinks: “How is that?” it is said: “Without the disciples being visible.”

original: nyan thos 'di dang rtog ge pa 'di'i tshig gi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos 'di dang rtog ge pa 'di'i tshig gi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should follow the words of this disciple and this logician.

original: dge slong dag mtshan ma zung shig ces bya ba ni yang dang yang du bsgom par bya ba'i phyir mtshan ma yid la gyis shig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag mtshan ma zung shig ces bya ba ni yang dang yang du bsgom par bya ba'i phyir mtshan ma yid la gyis shig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: “Monks, take hold of the sign!” means: “Keep the sign in mind in order to meditate on it again and again.”

original: mi snang bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni bcab pa'i spang ba mdzad pa'i sgo nas bskyod pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi snang bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni bcab pa'i spang ba mdzad pa'i sgo nas bskyod pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: “They disappeared” means: they were shaken by the Blessed One through his concealment of the offense.

original: cang mi smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: cang mi smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Without saying anything” and so on.

original: shin tu zhum pa'i phyir cung zad zhig kyang smra ba'i nus pa med pa de bas na cang mi smra ba yin no //
analyzed: shin tu zhum pa'i phyir cung zad zhig kyang smra ba'i nus pa med pa de bas na cang mi smra ba yin no //
translated: Because of extreme timidity, they are incapable of saying anything at all.

original: ngo tsha dang ji ltar bya ba la rmongs par gyur pa'i phyir bag 'khums par gyur pa yin no //🔽phrag pa phab pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu ngo tsha bas phrag pa'i phyogs 'phyangs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo tsha dang ji ltar bya ba la rmongs par gyur pa'i phyir bag 'khums par gyur pa yin no // phrag pa phab pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu ngo tsha bas phrag pa'i phyogs 'phyangs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: They are embarrassed because they are ashamed and confused about what to do.🔽They hang their shoulders because they are extremely ashamed and their shoulders droop.

original: gdong smad pa zhes bya ba ni mgo thur du bltas pa yin no //
analyzed: gdong smad pa zhes bya ba ni mgo thur du bltas pa yin no //
translated: They hang their heads because they look down.

original: spobs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni lan ldon pa tsam gyis nus pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: spobs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni lan ldon pa tsam gyis nus pa med pa yin no //
translated: They are speechless because they are incapable of even a verbal response.

original: shin tu sems shing zhes bya ba ni @122b bros pa'i thabs sems par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu sems shing zhes bya ba ni @122b bros pa'i thabs sems par gyur pa yin no //
translated: They are utterly dejected because they think about how to escape.

original: kun du bskrad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni cher bskrad pas 'byer bar 'gyur bar bya bar ro //
analyzed: kun du bskrad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni cher bskrad pas 'byer bar 'gyur bar bya bar ro //
translated: They are driven away because they are scattered by being chased away.

original: skrag pa ni rnam par 'khrugs pa'i sgo nas 'jigs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skrag pa ni rnam par 'khrugs pa'i sgo nas 'jigs par byed pa yin no //
translated: They are terrified because they are frightened by being disturbed.

original: 'dun khang zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i lus kyi tshad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun khang zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i lus kyi tshad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “assembly hall” is the size of the body of a householder, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi cho 'phrul gyi 'dun khang dang skye bo chen po'i tshogs cung zhig kyang 'gyur ba med pa de ltar byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi cho 'phrul gyi 'dun khang dang skye bo chen po'i tshogs cung zhig kyang 'gyur ba med pa de ltar byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One blessed it so that it would not change at all, just as the Blessed One’s magical assembly hall and the great multitude were.

original: ri bo dang ni nags dag dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ri bo dang ni nags dag dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Mountains, forests, etc.”

original: skyabs kyi stobs las dri ma med pa'i yon tan rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid mang zhig ces smos pa yin no //
analyzed: skyabs kyi stobs las dri ma med pa'i yon tan rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid mang zhig ces smos pa yin no //
translated: Since the power of refuge is the cause of acquiring stainless qualities, it is said to be “the best.”

original: cho 'phrul chen po bstan pa las mu stegs byed 'ga' zhig ni ri bo dang / gzhan dag nags dang / kun dga' ra ba dang / lha'i khang pa dang / shing drung dag tu gnas pa de mthong nas tshigs su bcad pa lnga po de dag byung ba yin no //
analyzed: cho 'phrul chen po bstan pa las mu stegs byed 'ga' zhig ni ri bo dang / gzhan dag nags dang / kun dga' ra ba dang / lha'i khang pa dang / shing drung dag tu gnas pa de mthong nas tshigs su bcad pa lnga po de dag byung ba yin no //
translated: In the teaching of the great miracle, some of the tīrthikas saw the Blessed One in a mountain, others in a forest, others in a pleasure grove, others in a temple, and others at the foot of a tree. After seeing him, they uttered these five verses.

original: mang po ni du ma yin la skyabs su song bar gyur pa ni rten 'dzin par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: mang po ni du ma yin la skyabs su song bar gyur pa ni rten 'dzin par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Many means many.

original: ri bo ni kha ba can la sogs pas 'dzin no //
analyzed: ri bo ni kha ba can la sogs pas 'dzin no //
translated: A mountain is a snow mountain, etc.

original: nags ni shing thibs po dag yin no //
analyzed: nags ni shing thibs po dag yin no //
translated: A forest is a thick growth of trees.

original: kun dga' ra ba ni khyim dang nye ba'i nags la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba ni khyim dang nye ba'i nags la sogs pa yin no //
translated: A park is a garden near a house, etc.

original: mchod rten dang shing drung zhes bya ba la mchod rten ni lha'i khang pa so phag la sogs pa bsags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽shing ni shing gi dbyibs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: mchod rten dang shing drung zhes bya ba la mchod rten ni lha'i khang pa so phag la sogs pa bsags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // shing ni shing gi dbyibs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'am /
translated: A caitya is a temple, etc.🔽A tree is a tree trunk, etc.

original: so phag la sogs ba bsags pa'i gong bu'i tshul du gang gis rtsa ba'i phyogs shing gi dbyibs su yod pa de ni mchod rten shing zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: so phag la sogs ba bsags pa'i gong bu'i tshul du gang gis rtsa ba'i phyogs shing gi dbyibs su yod pa de ni mchod rten shing zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: A caitya tree is a tree trunk that is like a caitya, or a caitya that is like a tree trunk.

original: de dag la skyabs su 'gro ba gang dag yin zhe na ;
analyzed: de dag la skyabs su 'gro ba gang dag yin zhe na ;
translated: Who goes for refuge to them?🔽The verse says:

original: smras pa / mi dag 'jigs pas bsdigs pa ste //
analyzed: smras pa / mi dag 'jigs pas bsdigs pa ste //
translated: People who are threatened by fear.

original: mu stegs byed la sogs pa 'jigs pas bcom par gyur pa dag yin no //

original: dgos pa'i gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa'i gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dge 'dun ni nyan thos kyi rgyud la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yin no //

analyzed: de dag phan tshun tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir de tsam gyi skabs su song ba ni ma yin gyi /

original: 'on kyang rtogs nas dad pa rnyed pa las yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs nas dad pa rnyed pa las yin te /

original: de yang bden pa mthong ba las 'gyur ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po la smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang bden pa mthong ba las 'gyur ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po la smos pa yin no //
