analyzed: rnga chen gnas kyis bcings par gyur //
translated: The great drum is bound by its place.

original: ces bya ba ni rnga chen du brdar btags pa'i aug shud kyi cha byad des gnas de rten du bcings par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnga chen du brdar btags pa'i aug shud kyi cha byad des gnas de rten du bcings par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The great drum is the name given to a kind of lute; it is bound by its place, that is to say, by the support which is its place.

original: de'i zlos pa zhes bya ba ni rig byed klog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i zlos pa zhes bya ba ni rig byed klog pa yin no //
translated: The recitation is the reading of the Veda.

original: ma rungs pas mi tshugs par bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la khyed kyis brtse ba med pa nyid du mi bya zhing 'di la cung zad kyang mi snyan pa'i tshig brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma rungs pas mi tshugs par bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la khyed kyis brtse ba med pa nyid du mi bya zhing 'di la cung zad kyang mi snyan pa'i tshig brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: In order that he not be attacked by the wicked means: you should not be without affection for him; you should not say anything unpleasant to him.

original: sngags kyi stobs zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi nus pa dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig tu yang dkar ba la sogs pa rnam par 'tsher ba'i rgyu cung zad la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sngags kyi stobs zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi nus pa dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig tu yang dkar ba la sogs pa rnam par 'tsher ba'i rgyu cung zad la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The power of the spell is the power of the spell, which is the cause of a little good fortune, such as victory, etc.

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i gnas na lha mo bde sogs bzhin du zhes bya ba las rnam par rgyal ba'i khang bzangs kyi gnas na brgya byin lta bur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i gnas na lha mo bde sogs bzhin du zhes bya ba las rnam par rgyal ba'i khang bzangs kyi gnas na brgya byin lta bur ro //
translated: In the palace of victory, like the goddess Śacī in the palace of victory.

original: sngags kyis rengs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngags kyis nus pa phrogs pa ltar ro //
analyzed: sngags kyis rengs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngags kyis nus pa phrogs pa ltar ro //
translated: Like one paralyzed by a spell means like one whose power has been taken away by a spell.

original: thams cad la smad par bya ba'i bran mo chu chun ma yin no //🔽rgya cher brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis tshul dang @131a * //
analyzed: thams cad la smad par bya ba'i bran mo chu chun ma yin no // rgya cher brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis tshul dang @131a * //
translated: She is not a servant girl who should be despised by everyone.

original: mthun pa ma yin pa'i khang pa rgyas par byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa ma yin pa'i khang pa rgyas par byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: It should be extensively explained means that the house that is not in accordance with the method should be extensively described, as made and so on.

original: sprang po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sprang po zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for beggar,

original: zas kyi lhag ma ni gong bu yin la /
analyzed: zas kyi lhag ma ni gong bu yin la /
translated: the remainder of food is a lump.

original: de len par byed pa'am sdud par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de len par byed pa'am sdud par byed pa'am /
translated: One who takes that, or collects it,

original: phyed zos pa dang / bor ba yongs su len cing za bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni sprang po yin no //
analyzed: phyed zos pa dang / bor ba yongs su len cing za bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni sprang po yin no //
translated: or takes and eats what has been half-eaten and discarded, is a beggar.

original: brtson ra ni bcing bar byed pa'i khang pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson ra ni bcing bar byed pa'i khang pa yin no //
translated: A prison is a house for binding.

original: bshang bar byas so zhes bya ba ni lus kyi ngor byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bshang bar byas so zhes bya ba ni lus kyi ngor byas pa yin no //
translated: The phrase he has defecated is from the perspective of the body.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyud na 'dod pa'i yo byad yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyud na 'dod pa'i yo byad yin no //
translated: The phrase the objects of desire refers to the articles of desire.

original: stobs chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzi chung ba dang / spro ba chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzi chung ba dang / spro ba chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase he will be weak means that he will be feeble and lacking in enthusiasm.

original: gcig tu 'dus te zhes bya ba ni gcig tu tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu 'dus te zhes bya ba ni gcig tu tshogs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase they all gathered together means that they all assembled.

original: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa ni 'dir mi tshangs par spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa ni 'dir mi tshangs par spyod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase worldly conduct refers here to sexual intercourse.

original: blon po drug gis rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas gtsang gtam gsal por byas pa yin no //
analyzed: blon po drug gis rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas gtsang gtam gsal por byas pa yin no //
translated: The phrase the six ministers refers to the six types of ministers.

original: de'i mtshan ma mthong ste zhes bya ba ni the tshom med par khong du chud par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma mthong ste zhes bya ba ni the tshom med par khong du chud par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The phrase he saw the signs means that he understood them without any doubt.

original: gang na bdag mi gnas mi dbang ba zhes bya ba ni gang na bdag gi nus pa yod pa ma yin par ro //
analyzed: gang na bdag mi gnas mi dbang ba zhes bya ba ni gang na bdag gi nus pa yod pa ma yin par ro //
translated: The phrase where I have no power means where I have no ability.

original: 'tsho ba ni 'tsho ba'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ni 'tsho ba'i thabs yin no //
translated: The phrase means of livelihood refers to the means of subsistence.

original: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bzo'i rigs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bzo'i rigs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The phrase such as these refers to the various types of crafts.

original: de 'dra ba'i snod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i snod ces bya ba la /
translated: Such a vessel is called a vessel.

original: de'i bzo bos bsgrub tu rung ba'i snod yin no //
analyzed: de'i bzo bos bsgrub tu rung ba'i snod yin no //
translated: It is a vessel that can be made by its maker.

original: sen mo bcad pa zhes bya ba ni sen mo gcod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sen mo bcad pa zhes bya ba ni sen mo gcod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Cutting the nails means cutting the nails.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi aang mo nig lta bu'i rdo leb ni rab tu byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i bde ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi aang mo nig lta bu'i rdo leb ni rab tu byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i bde ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: A slab of stone like the palm of the Thirty-Three Gods is a place of happiness suitable for going forth.

original: dbyar tshul du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas pa nyid du khas blang bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyar tshul du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas pa nyid du khas blang bar byas pa yin no //
translated: Entering the rainy season retreat means accepting to stay during the rainy season.

original: 'khor bzhi zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang ; dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor yin no //
analyzed: 'khor bzhi zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang ; dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor yin no //
translated: The four assemblies are the assemblies of monks, nuns, male lay followers, and female lay followers.

original: shin tu sgom pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal mthong ba'i phyir bdag rab tu 'dod pas gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sgom pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal mthong ba'i phyir bdag rab tu 'dod pas gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: Very meditative means having a strong desire to stay by seeing the face of the Blessed One.

original: rigs shing legs pa zhes bya ba ni legs te bdag nyid kyi spobs pa la gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs shing legs pa zhes bya ba ni legs te bdag nyid kyi spobs pa la gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: Proper and good means good, not harming one's own eloquence.

original: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe bdag cag sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lhar 'gro bar 'gyur ba la'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe bdag cag sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lhar 'gro bar 'gyur ba la'o //
translated: “Miraculous power” is the ability to go to the Thirty-three gods.

original: mthu ni gang gnas 'di nyid nas bdag nyid mngon par sprul nas bcom ldan 'das la blta bar bgyi ba la'o //
analyzed: mthu ni gang gnas 'di nyid nas bdag nyid mngon par sprul nas bcom ldan 'das la blta bar bgyi ba la'o //
translated: “Power” is the ability to manifest oneself in this very place and see the Lord.

original: bsnyen bkur ni rjes su mthun pa'i sgo nas thag nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur ni rjes su mthun pa'i sgo nas thag nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: “Service” is the ability to remain near the Lord in a manner that is appropriate.

original: legs @131b so zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: legs @131b so zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: “Good” means “proper.”

original: bskum pa zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: bskum pa zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa yin la /
translated: “Contraction” means “to gather in.”

original: brkyang ba zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'am yangs par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: brkyang ba zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'am yangs par byas pa yin no //
translated: “Expansion” means “to spread out” or “to extend.”

original: rang gi 'dus byas pa ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi bya bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi 'dus byas pa ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi bya bas ni ma yin no //
translated: “Not by one’s own action” means “not by one’s own activity.”

original: lha rnam pa mang po 'dus pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs yin no //
analyzed: lha rnam pa mang po 'dus pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs yin no //
translated: “Various” means “many.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs par zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis shes shing khong du chud pa'i gcig tu dad pa rnyed pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas la shes shing dad pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs par zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis shes shing khong du chud pa'i gcig tu dad pa rnyed pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas la shes shing dad pa yin no //
translated: The faith that one acquires in the Buddha, by knowing and penetrating him through uncontaminated knowledge, is the faith that he is the one who has the knowledge of the destruction of the contaminations.

original: chos dang dge 'dun dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same for the Dharma and the Saṃgha.

original: zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims thob pa'i sgo nas zag pa med pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ba de'i tshe de tshul khrims yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims thob pa'i sgo nas zag pa med pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ba de'i tshe de tshul khrims yin no //
translated: The morality that one acquires through the acquisition of the uncontaminated restraint is the morality of the faith that acquires the Dharma.

original: gcig la dad pa gang yin pa de gdon mi za bar thams cad kho na la yang sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pas lhag par mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba la dgongs nas re re la smos pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig la dad pa gang yin pa de gdon mi za bar thams cad kho na la yang sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pas lhag par mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba la dgongs nas re re la smos pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The faith that one has in one of the Three Jewels is certainly also faith in the other two. But the Blessed One has declared that one should have a special adherence to each of them.

original: lha'i 'khor mi snang bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni lhas gtong ba yin no //
analyzed: lha'i 'khor mi snang bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni lhas gtong ba yin no //
translated: The assembly of gods disappeared: the gods withdrew.

original: ci'i phyir yang bcom ldan 'das 'og min gyi mthar thug pa'i bar du gshegs par mdzad can /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang bcom ldan 'das 'og min gyi mthar thug pa'i bar du gshegs par mdzad can /
translated: Why did the Blessed One go as far as Akaniṣṭha?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, some say:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to plant the root of virtue of the gods active in the desire and form realms.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i tshe lo bskal pa du mar gyur pa dge pa'i chos rnams las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i tshe lo bskal pa du mar gyur pa dge pa'i chos rnams las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Because the gods active in the form realm whose lifespan is many eons degenerate from virtuous phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal ma mthong ba dang / dam pa'i chos ma thos pa'i phyir dang / gang dag tshangs pa la sogs pa gong ma la chen po'i blo yod pa de dang de dag gi bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa la sogs pa mchod pa byed pa mthong ba des /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal ma mthong ba dang / dam pa'i chos ma thos pa'i phyir dang / gang dag tshangs pa la sogs pa gong ma la chen po'i blo yod pa de dang de dag gi bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa la sogs pa mchod pa byed pa mthong ba des /
translated: Because they do not see the face of the Bhagavan and do not hear the true Dharma, those who have the thought of greatness for Brahma and so on, when they see Brahma and so on making offerings to the Bhagavan,

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa chen po'i blo skyes pa gang yin pa des nyams par 'gyur ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la dad pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa chen po'i blo skyes pa gang yin pa des nyams par 'gyur ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la dad pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they degenerate from the thought of greatness for Brahma and so on and their faith in the Bhagavan increases.

original: dad pa skyes par gyur na 'phags pa'i lam gyi tshogs la 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i phyir de dag khyad par shin tu chen por 'gyur bas bcom ldan 'das 'og min gyi bar du gshegs pa ni don dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: dad pa skyes par gyur na 'phags pa'i lam gyi tshogs la 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i phyir de dag khyad par shin tu chen por 'gyur bas bcom ldan 'das 'og min gyi bar du gshegs pa ni don dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: When faith arises, one enters into the path of the noble ones. Therefore, since the difference is very great, the Blessed One's going to Akaniṣṭha is not meaningless.

original: lus kyi ni lus kyi dri yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi ni lus kyi dri yin no //
translated: The smell of the body is the smell of the body.

original: skad cig mas 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig mas 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: It is impermanent because it perishes moment by moment.

original: rgyun chad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mi brtan @132a * //🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mi brtan @132a * // pa yin no //
translated: It is unstable because its continuity is interrupted.

original: yid brtan du rung ba'i dngos po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir yid brtan du med pa yin no //
analyzed: yid brtan du rung ba'i dngos po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir yid brtan du med pa yin no //
translated: It is unreliable because it is not a reliable thing.

original: skad cig skad cig la rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du skyes pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no //🔽nyon mongs pa'i thob pa gcod pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig skad cig la rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du skyes pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no // nyon mongs pa'i thob pa gcod pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral pa yin no //
translated: It is subject to change because it is born in different forms moment by moment.🔽It is free from attachment because it cuts off the attainment of afflictions.

original: bral ba'i thob ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: bral ba'i thob ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: It is liberated because it produces the attainment of separation.

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
translated: “By the aspect of impermanence” means that the aspect of impermanence is predominant.

original: che zhing che ba zhes bya ba ni gtso bo gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: che zhing che ba zhes bya ba ni gtso bo gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
translated: “Great and great” means that the most important is predominant.

original: ston pa'i spyan sngar dge slong ma dag rdzu 'phrul ston pa bzlog par mdzad pa ni dge slong ma kun nas nyon mongs pa can dag gi nga rgyal spang bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ston pa'i spyan sngar dge slong ma dag rdzu 'phrul ston pa bzlog par mdzad pa ni dge slong ma kun nas nyon mongs pa can dag gi nga rgyal spang bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The Buddha stopped the nuns from displaying their supernatural powers in the presence of the Buddha in order to eliminate the pride of the afflicted nuns.

original: gal te zlog par ma gyur na de'i tshe gang gis bdag cag gi 'khor gyi nang du 'dus pa kho mo cag 'dra ba yang bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rdzu 'phrul ston par byed do zhes des nga rgyal skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te zlog par ma gyur na de'i tshe gang gis bdag cag gi 'khor gyi nang du 'dus pa kho mo cag 'dra ba yang bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rdzu 'phrul ston par byed do zhes des nga rgyal skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: If he had not stopped them, then they would have generated pride, thinking, “Even someone like us can display supernatural powers in the presence of the Buddha.”

original: nga rgyal las kyang tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bzlog pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bzlog pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: And because of pride, they would have engaged in improper actions.

original: sa rnams gcig gis thob pa smos pas ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid mngon par 'dod pa dag bzlog pa mdzad pa yin la /
analyzed: sa rnams gcig gis thob pa smos pas ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid mngon par 'dod pa dag bzlog pa mdzad pa yin la /
translated: By mentioning the attainment of the stages, he turns away those who desire the kingdom of a world-emperor.

original: lha rnams su yang 'gro ba zhes bya bas ni lha'i 'jig rten la mngon par dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: lha rnams su yang 'gro ba zhes bya bas ni lha'i 'jig rten la mngon par dga' ba yin no //
translated: By saying “they go even to the gods,” he turns away those who delight in the world of the gods.

original: yang ting nge 'dzin thob pa smos pas ni 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon par 'dod pas bzlog pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ting nge 'dzin thob pa smos pas ni 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon par 'dod pas bzlog pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: By mentioning the attainment of meditative concentration, he turns away those who desire mundane meditative attainments.

original: chu srin nya lta bu ni chu srin nya'i rigs yin no //
analyzed: chu srin nya lta bu ni chu srin nya'i rigs yin no //
translated: The makara-fish is a type of makara.

original: mthun pa'i rlung gis zhes bya ba ni sha ke ru'i gling du phyin par byed pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i rlung gis zhes bya ba ni sha ke ru'i gling du phyin par byed pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: The favorable wind is favorable for going to the island of Shaka.

original: tshul khrims 'chal bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gzhan la rab tu chags par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gzhan la rab tu chags par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The one who has become immoral is one who has become attached to another man.

original: legs kyis zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa'i kun du spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: legs kyis zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa'i kun du spyod pa yin no //
translated: The one who is well-behaved is one who has beautiful conduct.

original: mi 'jigs bzhin du skur bar byed do zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dab bzangs dang me tog yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs bzhin du skur bar byed do zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dab bzangs dang me tog yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'i tshe'o //
translated: He is a slanderer, even though he is fearless. This refers to the time when he enjoys the lotus and the flower.

original: sbyin sreg gi me 'bar bar byed pa'i rgyu mtshan shing pa la sha la sogs pa khru gang gi tshad du byas pa ni yam shing yin no //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi me 'bar bar byed pa'i rgyu mtshan shing pa la sha la sogs pa khru gang gi tshad du byas pa ni yam shing yin no //
translated: The sacrificial fire is the cause of burning. The wood, etc., made one cubit in size is the fuel.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni bu la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni bu la'o //
translated: There means to the son.

original: 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i thabs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i thabs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Livelihood means the means of livelihood.

original: bkres pa'i bdud kyis zhes bya ba ni shin tu bkres pa kho na bdud de 'chi bar byed pa des @132b so ;
analyzed: bkres pa'i bdud kyis zhes bya ba ni shin tu bkres pa kho na bdud de 'chi bar byed pa des @132b so ;
translated: The demon of hunger means that very hunger is a demon, since it causes death.

original: / mnyan gyis zhes bya ba ni sgra'i yul de la rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: / mnyan gyis zhes bya ba ni sgra'i yul de la rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Heard means that the ear consciousness is produced with respect to that object of sound.

original: mchong rgal ba zhes bya ba ni steng du mchong zhing rgal ba yin no //
analyzed: mchong rgal ba zhes bya ba ni steng du mchong zhing rgal ba yin no //
translated: Jumping means jumping up and jumping over.

original: 'phyis par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring du lon par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phyis par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring du lon par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Long delayed means having passed a long time.

original: sems bsang bar gyur pa ni sems dga' ba skyed par byed pa yin no ;
analyzed: sems bsang bar gyur pa ni sems dga' ba skyed par byed pa yin no ;
translated: The mind becomes clear means that it generates mental joy.

original: rdo'i sbyor ba byed pa rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni 'dab bzangs la mi pas lhag pa'i khur bskur bar khong du chud par bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: rdo'i sbyor ba byed pa rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni 'dab bzangs la mi pas lhag pa'i khur bskur bar khong du chud par bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The beginning of the composition of the treatise is understood to be the burden placed on the shoulders of the excellent bird.

original: mig zhar ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu drag tu 'gro bas de'i mig zhar bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: mig zhar ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu drag tu 'gro bas de'i mig zhar bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: The blind man means that he went very quickly, and his eyes became blind.

original: rdo'i sbyor ba byed pa'i glu zhes bya ba ni sha ke ru'i gling du nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i rab rib sel ba'i me tog dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo'i sbyor ba byed pa'i glu zhes bya ba ni sha ke ru'i gling du nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i rab rib sel ba'i me tog dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: The song of the treatise maker is the flower that removes cataracts, which was experienced on the island of Shakuru.

original: bskyod pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'phangs shing 'phangs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bskyod pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'phangs shing 'phangs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Shaken means that it was thrown and thrown.

original: sems dga' bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir gling dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: sems dga' bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir gling dga' ba yin no //
translated: Because it causes mental joy, the island is joyful.

original: 'di nas de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di nas de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: From here, beyond that, and so on.

original: sa dpag tshad brgya pa 'di las pha rol du tshad chen po'i rgya mtsho ni chu 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: sa dpag tshad brgya pa 'di las pha rol du tshad chen po'i rgya mtsho ni chu 'dzin yin te /
translated: From this island, which is one hundred yojanas, beyond that, the great ocean is the water holder.

original: de 'das pa'i ni sha ke ru'i gling yin no //
analyzed: de 'das pa'i ni sha ke ru'i gling yin no //
translated: The continent beyond that is Śāka.

original: yid 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi dga' ba 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir yid 'phrog pa yin no //
analyzed: yid 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi dga' ba 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir yid 'phrog pa yin no //
translated: Manoharā is so called because she captivates the mind.

original: brla ste brla gnyis la dpal gyi be'u zhes bya ba'i mtshan ma yod pa yin ne //
analyzed: brla ste brla gnyis la dpal gyi be'u zhes bya ba'i mtshan ma yod pa yin ne //
translated: On her thighs are the marks called śrīvatsa.

original: nu ma'i bar la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nu ma'i bar la zhes bya ba la /
translated: Between her breasts

original: ba spu phra mo 'khyil ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: ba spu phra mo 'khyil ba yod pa yin no //
translated: is a curl of fine hair.

original: grong khyer gyi gnas gang na yod pa ma yin pa de ni grong khyer med pa yin no //
analyzed: grong khyer gyi gnas gang na yod pa ma yin pa de ni grong khyer med pa yin no //
translated: The place where the city is not is the non-city.

original: dogs pa skyes pa ni dogs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dogs pa skyes pa ni dogs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The one who has given rise to doubt is the doubter.

original: bshes min khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bshes min khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the words “you, the unacquainted,”

original: bshes ni 'dres pa dang shin tu yid brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: bshes ni 'dres pa dang shin tu yid brtan pa yin no //
translated: an acquaintance is one with whom one has mixed and in whom one has great confidence.

original: bshes ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bshes ma yin pa ste /
translated: You are not an acquaintance.

original: bdag gis yun ring por kun nas brten par nus pa ma yin pa de'i phyir kho bo yang khyod las dngos su yid ches par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis yun ring por kun nas brten par nus pa ma yin pa de'i phyir kho bo yang khyod las dngos su yid ches par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Since I have not been able to rely on you for a long time, I am not able to trust you.

original: gnyis ka'i mtha' las nyams pa zhes bya ba ni sha'i mtha' dang nya'i mtha' las so //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i mtha' las nyams pa zhes bya ba ni sha'i mtha' dang nya'i mtha' las so //
translated: The phrase one who has fallen from both ends means one who has fallen from the end of meat and the end of fish.

original: rtsva'i nga na gnas pa gang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsva'i nga na gnas pa gang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase one who lives in a grass hut means

original: chu bo dang thag nye bar skyes pa'i rtsva'i rigs su'o //🔽spyar ma ni 'dir nyes pa spyod pa can yin no //
analyzed: chu bo dang thag nye bar skyes pa'i rtsva'i rigs su'o // spyar ma ni 'dir nyes pa spyod pa can yin no //
translated: one who lives in a hut made of grass that grows near a river.🔽The phrase one who lives in a straw hut means one who lives in a hut made of straw.

original: bdag po'i mtha' las nyams pa dang / byi po pa'i mtha' las nyams pa de'i phyir gnyi ga'i mtha' las nyams gyur pa zhes bya'o //🔽rigs sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gzhan la zhen pas rag lus @133a * //
analyzed: bdag po'i mtha' las nyams pa dang / byi po pa'i mtha' las nyams pa de'i phyir gnyi ga'i mtha' las nyams gyur pa zhes bya'o // rigs sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gzhan la zhen pas rag lus @133a * //
translated: The phrase one who has fallen from both ends means one who has fallen from the end of a master and the end of a servant.

original: pa can yin no //
analyzed: pa can yin no //
translated: The phrase one who is a disgrace to his family means one who is dependent on others because of his attachment to other men.

original: slar log cing zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu 'bab par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: slar log cing zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu 'bab par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The phrase one who has turned back means one who has turned back from the right path.

original: zho'i kha dog ces bya ba ni dkar po yin la /
analyzed: zho'i kha dog ces bya ba ni dkar po yin la /
translated: The phrase the color of curds means white.

original: shing 'dzam bu dang shing ta la gang gi tshe 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa de'i tshe khyod tshul khrims bzang bo dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing 'dzam bu dang shing ta la gang gi tshe 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa de'i tshe khyod tshul khrims bzang bo dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase when the jambu tree and the palm tree bear fruit means when you have good morality.

original: dgun gyi bgo bar gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni kha ba bab pa'i dus su nye bar mkho ba yin no //
analyzed: dgun gyi bgo bar gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni kha ba bab pa'i dus su nye bar mkho ba yin no //
translated: The winter garment is what is needed at the time of snowfall.

original: sdong bu ni myu gu yin no //
analyzed: sdong bu ni myu gu yin no //
translated: The stalk is the sprout.

original: legs par yang ni me 'bar la //
analyzed: legs par yang ni me 'bar la //
translated: And the fire burns well.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rgya mtsho'i dbus su du ba med pa'i me 'bar bar gyur pa na ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rgya mtsho'i dbus su du ba med pa'i me 'bar bar gyur pa na ste /
translated: When the fire burns without smoke in the middle of the ocean,

original: de ni dper na chu bo gang g'a bzlog phyogs su 'bab pa dang / rus sbal gyi sbu bgo bar byed pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag srid pa ma yin pa de bzhin du khyod kyi tshul khrims kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
analyzed: de ni dper na chu bo gang g'a bzlog phyogs su 'bab pa dang / rus sbal gyi sbu bgo bar byed pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag srid pa ma yin pa de bzhin du khyod kyi tshul khrims kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning is that just as it is impossible for the Ganges to flow upstream, for a tortoise to wear a bone through its nose, and so on, so too is your morality.

original: gsol pa zhes bya ba ni sgra cher bsgrags pa yin no //
analyzed: gsol pa zhes bya ba ni sgra cher bsgrags pa yin no //
translated: He said means he spoke loudly.

original: wa'i skad la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni wa'i ming can gnod sbyin mo'i bye brag gi tshig gi don yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: wa'i skad la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni wa'i ming can gnod sbyin mo'i bye brag gi tshig gi don yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: Skilled in the language of wolves means skilled in understanding the meaning of the words of a particular type of yakshini named 'wolf'.

original: btang ba ni yongs su dor ba yin no //
analyzed: btang ba ni yongs su dor ba yin no //
translated: Abandonment means complete rejection.

original: dmar skya zhes bya ba de ni bgo ba dang rjes su mthun pa de'i ming yin te /
analyzed: dmar skya zhes bya ba de ni bgo ba dang rjes su mthun pa de'i ming yin te /
translated: The name “tawny” is in accordance with the color of the garment.

original: skyur rtsi chung ngu'i mdog gi bye brag dang 'dra bar dmar skya yin no //
analyzed: skyur rtsi chung ngu'i mdog gi bye brag dang 'dra bar dmar skya yin no //
translated: It is tawny like the color of turmeric.

original: ched du zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'i bya ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bsams bzhin du lta bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ched du zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'i bya ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bsams bzhin du lta bar byed pa yin no //
translated: “Intentionally” means that he sees with the intention of that very action as the principal factor.

original: glang po che zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: glang po che zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: “Like an elephant, etc.”

original: glang po che la sogs pa dang 'dra bar phan tshun du g-yul 'gyed pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa dang 'dra bar phan tshun du g-yul 'gyed pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa yin no //
translated: He fights with others like an elephant, etc., or he causes others to fight.

original: bya brta ka ni sran ma sha la sogs pa'i zhing na phal cher 'dug pa lus shin tu chung ba ma yin pa'i bya yin no //
analyzed: bya brta ka ni sran ma sha la sogs pa'i zhing na phal cher 'dug pa lus shin tu chung ba ma yin pa'i bya yin no //
translated: The peacock is a bird that lives in fields of corn, etc., and is not very small in size.

original: de las lus shin tu chung ba ni bya la ba ka yin no //
analyzed: de las lus shin tu chung ba ni bya la ba ka yin no //
translated: The sparrow is smaller than that.

original: bsod snyoms sbyin par bya bar sems pa zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms sbyin par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bsod snyoms sbyin par bya bar sems pa zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms sbyin par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: “Thinking to give alms” means that he generates the thought in order to give alms.

original: bya ba sems pa zhes bya ba ni phyag la sogs pa'i bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir sems kyang bskyed par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba sems pa zhes bya ba ni phyag la sogs pa'i bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir sems kyang bskyed par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “the intention to act” refers to the mental state that is generated in order to perform acts of worship, such as prostration.

original: mi'i 'gro ba can legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i don yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du rung ba la 'dir bud med kyi yul du bzhed pa yin no //🔽dge sbyong ni 'phags pa'i lam yin la /
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba can legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i don yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du rung ba la 'dir bud med kyi yul du bzhed pa yin no // dge sbyong ni 'phags pa'i lam yin la /
translated: The phrase “in the human life-form” means that the bodhisattva is a human being. The phrase “skilled in the knowledge of the meaning of what is well-spoken and what is poorly spoken” means that he or she is skilled in the knowledge of the meaning of all the branches of science. The phrase “in every way” means that the bodhisattva is a male.

original: de'i 'bras @133b bu ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras @133b bu ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The phrase “the fruit of asceticism” means the fruit of the ārya path.

original: bzhi zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: bzhi zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid yin la /
translated: The phrase “the fourth” means the state of an arhat.

original: thob pa zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: thob pa zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “to attain” means to strive for.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba ni tshe'i mthar thug gi bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba ni tshe'i mthar thug gi bar du'o //
translated: The phrase “for as long as one lives” means until the end of one’s life.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i rgyu 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas ma bcom pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i rgyu 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas ma bcom pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “in its entirety” means that the morality is complete, because it is not destroyed by the causes of immorality, such as thoughts of desire.

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyis gnod par ma gyur pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyis gnod par ma gyur pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: It is pure because it is not harmed by immorality.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la sogs pa bsgom pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su byang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la sogs pa bsgom pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su byang ba yin no //
translated: It is purified because it is endowed with the cultivation of the foundations of mindfulness, etc., which are the counteragents to immorality.

original: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Brahma is nirvana.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa ni tshangs par spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa ni tshangs par spyod pa yin no //
translated: The cause of that is pure conduct, which is the avoidance of killing, etc.

original: gcig tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig yin no //
translated: It is alone because it is the sole means to nirvana.

original: don zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is beneficial because it accomplishes the desired aim.

original: phan pa ni 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol du mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa ni 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol du mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is helpful because it is not harmful in this world or the next.

original: bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the sake of happiness because it accomplishes the happiness of liberation.

original: sh'akya'i bu mo zhes bya ba ni sh'akya dag gi bu mo yin no //
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu mo zhes bya ba ni sh'akya dag gi bu mo yin no //
translated: The daughter of the Śākyas is the daughter of the Śākyas.

original: gnas par bya ba yin pas dgongs mal te bcom ldan 'das mnyel bso ba'i gnas yin no //🔽dgongs mal gyi rjes bzhin nam yongs su spangs pas na dgongs mal gyi rjes bzhin te /
analyzed: gnas par bya ba yin pas dgongs mal te bcom ldan 'das mnyel bso ba'i gnas yin no // dgongs mal gyi rjes bzhin nam yongs su spangs pas na dgongs mal gyi rjes bzhin te /
translated: The Blessed One is the place of rest, because he is the place of rest for those who are tired.🔽The Blessed One is the follower of the place of rest, because he follows the place of rest, or because he has completely abandoned it.

original: dgongs mal gyi rjes su 'gro pa'i bya ba gang la yod pa de ni 'dir dgongs mal gyi rjes bzhin 'brang ba yin te des so //
analyzed: dgongs mal gyi rjes su 'gro pa'i bya ba gang la yod pa de ni 'dir dgongs mal gyi rjes bzhin 'brang ba yin te des so //
translated: The Blessed One is the follower of the place of rest, because he has the activity of following the place of rest.

original: dgongs mal gcig gi dus phyis dong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dgongs mal gcig gi dus phyis dong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: He went to the place of rest after the time of the place of rest.

original: drang srong kunydzi kas byas pa'i gnas ni kunydzi ka'i gnas yin no //🔽ngal bskyes pa ni lus ngal ba yin la /🔽shin tu ngal ba las snyom par gyur pa ni lus dub pa yin no //
analyzed: drang srong kunydzi kas byas pa'i gnas ni kunydzi ka'i gnas yin no // ngal bskyes pa ni lus ngal ba yin la / shin tu ngal ba las snyom par gyur pa ni lus dub pa yin no //
translated: The place of the sage Kunjika is the place of Kunjika.🔽The body is tired when it is tired.🔽The body is exhausted when it is very tired and has become exhausted.

original: lus gug pa sngon du song ba can gyi cher dub pa ni lus bab pa yin no //
analyzed: lus gug pa sngon du song ba can gyi cher dub pa ni lus bab pa yin no //
translated: The body is bent when it is very exhausted after having been bent.

original: mchi ma phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni sgra med par du bar byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: mchi ma phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni sgra med par du bar byed pa dag yin no //
translated: They shed tears without making a sound.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'khor rnam bzhi mnga' ba ma yin nam //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'khor rnam bzhi mnga' ba ma yin nam //
translated: Do not all the Tathagatas have four assemblies?

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bud med kyi yul rab tu 'byung bar dka' bas gnang bar mdzad ce na /🔽'di la bla ma dag skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo la sogs pa sh'akya'i du mo lnga brgya dang bud med gzhan dag skyo ba skyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bud med kyi yul rab tu 'byung bar dka' bas gnang bar mdzad ce na / 'di la bla ma dag skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo la sogs pa sh'akya'i du mo lnga brgya dang bud med gzhan dag skyo ba skyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why did the Bhagavat allow women to go forth, since it is difficult for them?

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni 'di snyam du gal te @134a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni 'di snyam du gal te @134a * //
translated: The Gurus say: In order to generate disgust in the many Shakya women, such as Mahaprajapati and the five hundred women, and in other women.

original: kho bo cag shin tu smad par 'gyur pa ma yin na ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa sems can thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa de la rab tu byung ba ni shin tu nyam nga bas rnyed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir de dag 'gyod pa
analyzed: kho bo cag shin tu smad par 'gyur pa ma yin na ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa sems can thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa de la rab tu byung ba ni shin tu nyam nga bas rnyed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir de dag 'gyod pa
translated: For they think: If we were not so despised, why would going forth in that teaching of the Buddha, which is common to all beings, be so difficult to obtain?

original: skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, they generate regret.

original: 'gyod par gyur pa las kyang shin tu dka' bas rnyed par gyur pa'i rab tu byung ba'i 'bras bu don med par ma gyur cig ces lam gyi tshogs la khyad par du 'jug par 'gyur bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gsum gyi bar du yang ma gnang
analyzed: 'gyod par gyur pa las kyang shin tu dka' bas rnyed par gyur pa'i rab tu byung ba'i 'bras bu don med par ma gyur cig ces lam gyi tshogs la khyad par du 'jug par 'gyur bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gsum gyi bar du yang ma gnang
translated: and he would not want the fruit of his going forth to be wasted, which he obtained with such difficulty, after he had repented.

original: ba don dang bcas pa yin no zhes ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: ba don dang bcas pa yin no zhes ston par mdzad do //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One did not allow women to go forth for three reasons, but it was not without purpose.

original: rkun po ni tha mal pa'i rkun ma yin la /
analyzed: rkun po ni tha mal pa'i rkun ma yin la /
translated: A thief is an ordinary thief.

original: mi rku ba ni skyes bu rku bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rku ba ni skyes bu rku bar byed pa yin no //
translated: A man who steals is a man who commits theft.

original: kun du tshoms par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni legs par zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kun du tshoms par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni legs par zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will be completely overwhelmed means they will be completely overcome.

original: rab tu choms par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bya ba nyung ngus 'jig par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rab tu choms par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bya ba nyung ngus 'jig par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: They will be completely destroyed means they will be destroyed by a small action.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yang bud med kyi yul rab tu phyung ba las mi tshangs par spyod pa'i rkyen gyis bya ba nyung dus 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yang bud med kyi yul rab tu phyung ba las mi tshangs par spyod pa'i rkyen gyis bya ba nyung dus 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the teaching of the Buddha will be destroyed by a small action, due to the condition of sexual misconduct of women who have gone forth.

original: phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du 'byor pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du 'byor pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: “Abundant” means endowed with all aspects of prosperity.

original: 'khor lo mi bzad pa ni thog 'bab pa can no //
analyzed: 'khor lo mi bzad pa ni thog 'bab pa can no //
translated: The “unrelenting wheel” is the lightning bolt.

original: nyams pa ni 'jig pa'i rnam pa chung du yin te /
analyzed: nyams pa ni 'jig pa'i rnam pa chung du yin te /
translated: “Degeneration” is the lesser aspect of destruction,

original: lo ma la sogs pa dum bur lhags par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo ma la sogs pa dum bur lhags par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the leaves, etc., are destroyed in pieces.

original: rnam par nyams pa ni 'jig pa'i rnam pa 'bring yin te /
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa ni 'jig pa'i rnam pa 'bring yin te /
translated: “Deterioration” is the middling aspect of destruction,

original: 'bras bu la sogs pa dum bur lhags par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pa dum bur lhags par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fruits, etc., are destroyed in pieces.

original: tshul ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni go rims ma yin pas nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni go rims ma yin pas nyams pa yin te /
translated: “Improper” means degeneration in the wrong order,

original: rtsa ba la sogs pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the roots, etc., are destroyed.

original: bud med kyi yul yon tan gyi 'bru nyams par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ser ba'i 'khor lo mi bzad pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bud med kyi yul yon tan gyi 'bru nyams par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ser ba'i 'khor lo mi bzad pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: The object of women is like an unrelenting wheel of hail, because it destroys the grain of good qualities.

original: nad kyi rigs dmar po ni bu ram shing rdo gu la re ga dmar por 'gyur ba dang / de kho na 'jig par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: nad kyi rigs dmar po ni bu ram shing rdo gu la re ga dmar por 'gyur ba dang / de kho na 'jig par byed pa yin te /
translated: The disease of passion is like a red rash on the sugar cane plant, and it destroys the plant.

original: bud med kyi yul ni snyan pa'i nad med pa 'jig par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nad dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bud med kyi yul ni snyan pa'i nad med pa 'jig par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nad dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: The object of a woman is like a disease, because it destroys the man who is without the disease of passion.

original: lci ba'i chos zhes bya ba la lci ba yang de nyid yin la sdug bsngal gyis yongs su bskyang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyang yin pas na lci ba'i chos yin pa'am /
analyzed: lci ba'i chos zhes bya ba la lci ba yang de nyid yin la sdug bsngal gyis yongs su bskyang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyang yin pas na lci ba'i chos yin pa'am /
translated: The term heavy dharma is a bahuvrihi compound, meaning that it is heavy and it is a dharma, because it is to be sustained by suffering.

original: dge slong gi yul la gus pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir lci ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi yul la gus pa skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir lci ba'i chos yin no //
translated: Or, it is a heavy dharma, because it generates respect for the object of a bhikṣu.

original: dgag pa'i phyir @134b zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir @134b zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term for the purpose of restraint means for the purpose of turning away from misdeeds.

original: mi 'da' bar spyod phyir zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i mtshams las mi rgal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'da' bar spyod phyir zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i mtshams las mi rgal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term for the purpose of not transgressing means for the purpose of not exceeding the limit of training.

original: bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho ba'i bar du bslab par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bcos ma ma yin par 'bab pa dang rtag tu 'bab pa'i dang tshul can ni chu bo yin la /
analyzed: bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho ba'i bar du bslab par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bcos ma ma yin par 'bab pa dang rtag tu 'bab pa'i dang tshul can ni chu bo yin la /
translated: “One should train” means that one should train for as long as one lives; the meaning is that one should practice.🔽A river has the nature of flowing continuously and without fabrication.

original: bcos ma dang rtag tu 'bab pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa ni yur ba yin no //
analyzed: bcos ma dang rtag tu 'bab pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa ni yur ba yin no //
translated: A canal has the nature of flowing sometimes and not at other times, and with fabrication.

original: chu lon ni chu bzlog par bya ba'i thabs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: chu lon ni chu bzlog par bya ba'i thabs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: A dam is a means of obstructing the flow of water.

original: gdams ngag ni lam gyi tshogs bsgom par lung 'bogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gdams ngag ni lam gyi tshogs bsgom par lung 'bogs pa yin la /
translated: Instruction is the imparting of the path of meditation.

original: 'di ni bya ba yin la 'di ni bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba yin la 'di ni bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su bstan pa yin no //
translated: “This is to be done; this is not to be done” is advice.

original: dge slong med pa'i gnas su zhes bya ba ni mtshams po ches bskor ba'i tshul du gal te dge slong ma'i dbyar khang mtshams nang du zhugs par gyur pa de'i dge slong gi gnas dang bcas par mtshams gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir dge slong
analyzed: dge slong med pa'i gnas su zhes bya ba ni mtshams po ches bskor ba'i tshul du gal te dge slong ma'i dbyar khang mtshams nang du zhugs par gyur pa de'i dge slong gi gnas dang bcas par mtshams gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir dge slong
translated: In a place where there are no monks means that if the nun’s rainy season retreat house is within the boundary of a large boundary, it is included within a single boundary, and it is a place where there are monks.

original: ma'i dbyar khang ni dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas nyid yin no //🔽kha cig ni gal te mtshams kyis bskor ba ma byas su zin kyang de lta na yang ci ste dpag tshad kyi nang du yang dge slong gi gtsug lag khang yod par gyur na gnas skabs 'di la dge slong ma'i dbyar khang ni dge slong dang bcas pa
analyzed: ma'i dbyar khang ni dge slong dang bcas pa'i gnas nyid yin no // kha cig ni gal te mtshams kyis bskor ba ma byas su zin kyang de lta na yang ci ste dpag tshad kyi nang du yang dge slong gi gtsug lag khang yod par gyur na gnas skabs 'di la dge slong ma'i dbyar khang ni dge slong dang bcas pa
translated: The nun’s rainy season retreat house is a place where there are monks.

original: nyid du blta bar bya'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: nyid du blta bar bya'o snyam du sems so //
translated: Some think that even if a boundary is not made, if a monk’s temple exists within a distance of one krośa, in this case the nun’s rainy season retreat house should be regarded as a place where there are monks.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun la 'dun pa phul bas de dag gis gso spyong 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas gso sbyong brjod par gyur pas skabs 'byed pa 'ba' zhig ni dgag dbye yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun la 'dun pa phul bas de dag gis gso spyong 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas gso sbyong brjod par gyur pas skabs 'byed pa 'ba' zhig ni dgag dbye yin no //

analyzed: dgag cing zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa yin no // gshe ba ni 'jig rten du rab tu grags pa yin no //

translated: The saṃgha of the twenty-three assemblies is the saṃgha of the twenty-three assemblies.

analyzed: deng bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni nyi ma de nyid la bsnyen par rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The saṃgha of the twenty-four assemblies is the saṃgha of the twenty-four assemblies.

original: shes par 'dod kyi zhes bya ba ni shes pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes par 'dod kyi zhes bya ba ni shes pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The saṃgha of the twenty-five assemblies is the saṃgha of the twenty-five assemblies.🔽The saṃgha of the twenty-six assemblies is

analyzed: skra dang sen mo mdzes par bsgrubs pa ni sgra dang sen mo byi byad byas pa yin no //
translated: The phrase having his hair and nails well groomed means that he has trimmed his nails and hair.🔽The phrase he is delighted and his mind is pleased means that he is delighted and his mind is pleased.🔽The phrase he is not an individual who has an attribute that constitutes an obstruction means that he is not an individual who has an attribute that constitutes an obstruction to the arising of the morality that is being sought.

analyzed: 'dir sdom pa skye ba'i gegs su gyur pa gzung ngo //

analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i phyir nus pa ma ning dang / za ma dang / mtshan gnyis pa dang / dge slong ma sun phyung ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag dris nas gzung bar bya ste / yang dag par gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase he is not an individual who has an attribute that constitutes an obstruction means that he is not an individual who has an attribute that constitutes an obstruction to the arising of the morality that is being sought.

original: skyabs kyi don ni sdug bsngal las yongs su bsrung ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: skyabs kyi don ni sdug bsngal las yongs su bsrung ba'i don yin te /
translated: The phrase he is not an individual who has an attribute that constitutes an obstruction means that he is not an individual who has an attribute that constitutes an obstruction to the arising of the morality that is being sought.

original: ji skad du /🔽de dag la ni skyabs mi 'gro //
analyzed: ji skad du /🔽de dag la ni skyabs mi 'gro //
translated: The phrase he is not an individual who has an attribute that

original: sdug bsngal kun las 'grol mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las 'grol mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One is not freed from all suffering.

original: sangs rgyas ni sangs rgyas su byed pa mi slob pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni sangs rgyas su byed pa mi slob pa'i chos yin no //
translated: The Buddha is the Dharma, because it is the Dharma that is the Buddha.

original: chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma is nirvana.

original: dge 'dun ni dge 'dun du byed pa slob pa dang mi slob pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni dge 'dun du byed pa slob pa dang mi slob pa'i chos yin no //
translated: The Sangha is the community of learners and those with no more to learn, because it is the community that is the Sangha.

original: rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog sangs rgyas ni bcom ldan 'das yin te /
analyzed: rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog sangs rgyas ni bcom ldan 'das yin te /
translated: The Buddha is the Blessed One, the supreme human,

original: phan 'dogs par mdzad pa nyid dang / yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par mdzad pa nyid dang / yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is the one who benefits and possesses good qualities.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las zag pa med pa'i lam thob pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir mchog yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las zag pa med pa'i lam thob pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir mchog yin no //
translated: The one who is free from attachment through the mundane path and then becomes free from attachment through the uncontaminated path is supreme, because he does not regress.

original: tshogs dag las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dang dge 'dun mchog yin te /
analyzed: tshogs dag las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dang dge 'dun mchog yin te /
translated: The Sangha of the disciples of the Tathagata is supreme among communities.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang / phan 'dogs par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang / phan 'dogs par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they possess good qualities and they are benefactors.

original: phan 'dogs par mdzad pa nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston par mdzad pa dang / rgyu'i bsod nams kyi zhing nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par mdzad pa nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ston par mdzad pa dang / rgyu'i bsod nams kyi zhing nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are benefactors because they are the field of merit for the Tathagata's teaching and for the cause.

original: mchog ni gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: mchog ni gtso bo yin no //
translated: The best means the foremost.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la bsnyen te gnas pa'i phyir dge bsnyen yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la bsnyen te gnas pa'i phyir dge bsnyen yin no //
translated: They are called upasaka because they are near to nirvana and they abide in it.

original: slob par byed pas na bslab pa yin la /
analyzed: slob par byed pas na bslab pa yin la /
translated: They are called sila because they are trained in it.

original: de'i gzhi ni bslab par bya ba'i dngos po yin pas na bslab pa'i gzhi yin te /
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni bslab par bya ba'i dngos po yin pas na bslab pa'i gzhi yin te /
translated: The basis of that is the object of training, and that is the basis of training.

original: de yang srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa yin no //
translated: That is the avoidance of taking life and so on.

original: lnga zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang // brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang // brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa las ldog pa yin no //
translated: The five are the avoidance of taking life, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, false speech and so on.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa dgra bcom ba de dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa dgra bcom ba de dag ces bya ba la /
translated: How are they called arhats?

original: ji ltar sems can thams cad la rjes su brtse ba can gyi dgra bcom pa sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i @135b ldog pa'i bsam pa'i sgo nas ldog pa de bzhin du bdag kyang slar ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can thams cad la rjes su brtse ba can gyi dgra bcom pa sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i @135b ldog pa'i bsam pa'i sgo nas ldog pa de bzhin du bdag kyang slar ldog pa yin no //
translated: Just as the arhats who have compassion for all sentient beings turn away from all sentient beings by turning away from the thought of killing, so do I turn away.

original: srog gcod pa ni srog chags dag shin tu gsod par byed cing 'jig par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: srog gcod pa ni srog chags dag shin tu gsod par byed cing 'jig par byed pa yin no //
translated: Killing is the complete killing and destruction of living beings.

original: spangs te zhes bya ba ni yid kyis srog gcod par byed pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: spangs te zhes bya ba ni yid kyis srog gcod par byed pa spangs pa yin te /
translated: Abandoning is the abandonment of the mental act of killing.

original: lus dang ngag gis dor ba ni slar ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gis dor ba ni slar ldog pa yin te /
translated: The turning away by body and speech is the turning away from the mental act of killing.

original: yid kyis gang bya ba ma yin par dpyad nas dor ba na bsod nams skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyis gang bya ba ma yin par dpyad nas dor ba na bsod nams skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one examines and turns away from what should not be done mentally, merit arises.

original: dgra bcom pa de dag gi bslab pa la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa de dag gi bslab pa la zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the training of those arhats,

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa'i bslab pa thar pa'i bsam pa sngon du sog ba can yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang thar pa'i bsam pa sngon du song bas slob pa dang / thar pa'i bsam pas sems can gcig la yang 'tshe bar mi byed pa de bzhin du bdag kyang zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir rjes su bsgrub po zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa'i bslab pa thar pa'i bsam pa sngon du sog ba can yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang thar pa'i bsam pa sngon du song bas slob pa dang / thar pa'i bsam pas sems can gcig la yang 'tshe bar mi byed pa de bzhin du bdag kyang zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir rjes su bsgrub po zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Just as the training of the arhat is preceded by the thought of liberation, so also I, preceded by the thought of liberation, train in the precepts. Just as the arhat, with the thought of liberation, does not harm even a single sentient being, so also I.

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ston par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su bgyid do zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ston par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su bgyid do zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Just as the arhat is taught by the Blessed One, so also I am taught by the Blessed One.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i sgo nas nyes par spyod pa las slar ldog pa'i bsam pa dang / thar pa'i bsam pa'i sgo nas sdom pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i sgo nas nyes par spyod pa las slar ldog pa'i bsam pa dang / thar pa'i bsam pa'i sgo nas sdom pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, by this, the intention to turn away from misdeeds through focusing on all sentient beings, and the intention of liberation, is the vow.

original: thar pa'i bsam pa yang dkon mchog gsum skyabs su yongs su bzung ba las 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: thar pa'i bsam pa yang dkon mchog gsum skyabs su yongs su bzung ba las 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: The thought of liberation also arises from fully taking refuge in the Three Jewels.

original: thar pa'i bsam pa med par sdom pa mi thob la /
analyzed: thar pa'i bsam pa med par sdom pa mi thob la /
translated: One does not obtain the vow without the thought of liberation.

original: thar pa'i bsam pa yang dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'dzin pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i bsam pa yang dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'dzin pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: And the thought of liberation does not arise without taking refuge in the Three Jewels.

original: sbyar ba'i chang ni 'bru las byas pa yin la /
analyzed: sbyar ba'i chang ni 'bru las byas pa yin la /
translated: Liquor made from grain is called “mixed liquor.”

original: bcos pa'i chang ni me tog la sogs pa las bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcos pa'i chang ni me tog la sogs pa las bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Liquor made from flowers, etc. is called “manufactured liquor.”

original: de dag myos par byed pa yin pas na myos par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag myos par byed pa yin pas na myos par byed pa yin la /
translated: They are intoxicating because they intoxicate.

analyzed: bag med pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid bag med pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: They are the basis of heedlessness because they are the cause of heedlessness.

original: glu dang ga ra dang rol mo'i sgra zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: glu dang ga ra dang rol mo'i sgra zhes bya ba la /
translated: Singing, dancing, and music are

analyzed: lus dang ngag gi 'gyur ba rgod pas byas pa ni glu la sogs pa yin te //
translated: singing, etc. that are done with the frivolity of body and speech.

original: de las slar ldog pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gcig yin no //
analyzed: de las slar ldog pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gcig yin no //
translated: Refraining from those is one precept.

original: phreng ba dang spos nyug pa dang rgyan dang kha dog 'chang ba las slar log pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: phreng ba dang spos nyug pa dang rgyan dang kha dog 'chang ba las slar log pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second rule of training is to abstain from using garlands, perfumes, unguents, jewelry, and cosmetics.

original: lus dri bzang po'i tshon gyis dril phyis @136a * //
analyzed: lus dri bzang po'i tshon gyis dril phyis @136a * //
translated: The body is anointed with fragrant ointments and perfumed with incense.

original: byas pa la kha dog gi sgras brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa la kha dog gi sgras brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word “color” refers to the color of the body.

original: mal mthon po ni pus mo'i tshad las mthon por gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: mal mthon po ni pus mo'i tshad las mthon por gyur pa yin la /
translated: A high couch is one that is higher than a cubit.
