analyzed: mal chen po ni rin po ches spras pa chen po la 'os pa yin no // gser ni sa le sbram yin la /
translated: A large couch is one that is suitable for a person of great wealth.🔽Gold is pure gold.

original: dngul ni dngul nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngul ni dngul nyid yin te /
translated: Silver is silver.

original: de dag ni rin po che gzhan dag gi nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rin po che gzhan dag gi nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: These two are examples of other precious substances.

original: de len pa ni bdag gir byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de len pa ni bdag gir byed pa yin te /
translated: To accept them is to make them one’s own.

original: de las slar ldog pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gcig yin no //
analyzed: de las slar ldog pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi gcig yin no //
translated: To abstain from that is the third rule of training.

original: khyim so bzung ba lo bcu lon pa dang / gzhon nu ma lo bco brgyad lon pa la dge slob ma'i bslab pa sbyin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim so bzung ba lo bcu lon pa dang / gzhon nu ma lo bco brgyad lon pa la dge slob ma'i bslab pa sbyin par byed pa yin no //
translated: The training of a novice nun is given to a girl who is eighteen years old and who has been a novice nun for two years.

original: dang por zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dang por zhes bya ba la /
translated: First,

original: dge slong ma'i sdom pa sbyin pa la mtha' 'khob ma yin par bcu gnyis kyi tshogs nyid la dge slong ma'i tshogs kyi mtha' yin par rig par bya zhing /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i sdom pa sbyin pa la mtha' 'khob ma yin par bcu gnyis kyi tshogs nyid la dge slong ma'i tshogs kyi mtha' yin par rig par bya zhing /
translated: The assembly of twelve nuns is the minimum assembly of nuns for the purpose of giving the vows of a bhikshunI, except in a border region.

original: mtha' 'khob tu ni dge slong ma drug gi tshogs la yang dge slong ma'i bslab pa sbyin par dge slong ma dag gi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: mtha' 'khob tu ni dge slong ma drug gi tshogs la yang dge slong ma'i bslab pa sbyin par dge slong ma dag gi tshogs yin no //
translated: In a border region, the minimum assembly of nuns for the purpose of giving the training of a bhikshunI is an assembly of six bhikshunis.

original: gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi sgra drug po dang / gtso bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su byed pa'i chos kyi sgrar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi sgra drug po dang / gtso bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su byed pa'i chos kyi sgrar bstan pa yin te /
translated: The six terms of Dharma are taught to be the principal terms, because they are the principal terms. The terms of Dharma that are subsequent are taught to be the secondary terms, because they are not the principal terms.

original: chos kyi de ma thag tu bstan pa'i phyir rjes su byed pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi de ma thag tu bstan pa'i phyir rjes su byed pa'i chos yin no //
translated: They are the terms of Dharma that are subsequent because they are taught immediately after the terms of Dharma.🔽One should not stand or sit

original: skyes pa dang ni 'dug mi bya //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ni 'dug mi bya //
translated: with a man.

original: zhes bya ba ni steng g-yogs dang stan gcig la sogs pa'i bya ba skyes pa dang lhan cig bya ba ma yin no //🔽smyan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni steng g-yogs dang stan gcig la sogs pa'i bya ba skyes pa dang lhan cig bya ba ma yin no // smyan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not perform activities such as standing or sitting on the same roof or seat as a man.🔽One should not act as a matchmaker.

original: smyan byed pas na smyan te /
analyzed: smyan byed pas na smyan te /
translated: One should not act as a matchmaker.

original: de'i dngos po'am las ni smyan byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po'am las ni smyan byed pa yin te /
translated: The thing or action of a matchmaker is to make a match.

original: de yang pho nya yin te /
analyzed: de yang pho nya yin te /
translated: And that is a messenger.

original: skyes pa dang bud med sbyor ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi phrin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med sbyor ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi phrin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the term is a go-between who is the cause of the union of a man and a woman.

original: kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dag gi nyes par spyod pa mthong ba de la de blos bcab par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dag gi nyes par spyod pa mthong ba de la de blos bcab par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: “Sin” means that when a nun sees a fault committed by another nun, she should not conceal it in her mind.

original: mdoms ni gsang ba'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: mdoms ni gsang ba'i phyogs yin no //
translated: The groin is the private part.

original: gnas par gyur pa la zhes bya ba ni thag nye bar gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: gnas par gyur pa la zhes bya ba ni thag nye bar gyur pa la'o //
translated: “Having approached” means having come near.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The vow of one who abides in pure conduct.

original: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Brahma is nirvana.

original: de'i don gyi spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa ste bsnyen par rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i don gyi spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa ste bsnyen par rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Pure conduct is the practice that leads to that, i.e., full ordination.

original: de la nye bar gnas pa ni nye bar bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de la nye bar gnas pa ni nye bar bskyed pa ste /
translated: Abiding in that is generating it.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i ched gyi sdom pa ni /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i ched gyi sdom pa ni /
translated: The vow of one who abides in pure conduct is

original: tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sdom pa yin te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sdom pa yin te /
translated: It is the vow of pure conduct.

original: rten la bsnyen par rdzogs pa byung ba'i skal ba @136b dang ldan par nges par byas pa ni tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sdom pa de sbyin par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rten la bsnyen par rdzogs pa byung ba'i skal ba @136b dang ldan par nges par byas pa ni tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sdom pa de sbyin par bya ba yin no //
translated: Having ascertained that the candidate is suitable for the ceremony of full ordination, the vow of pure conduct is to be given to him.

original: chos gos gsum dang / rdul gzan dang / rdul gzan gyi gzan zhes bya ba ni lnga yin no //
analyzed: chos gos gsum dang / rdul gzan dang / rdul gzan gyi gzan zhes bya ba ni lnga yin no //
translated: The five are the three robes, the patch robe, and the waistband.

original: dkyil 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa'i las kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa'i las kyi gnas yin no //
translated: The mandala is the place where the ceremony of full ordination is performed.

original: drang srong gi snod ces bya ba la drang srong ste yang dag par rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dgra bcom pa dag ni snod ni drang srong gi snod yin pa de'i phyir bslab pa don du gnyer zhing drang srong gi rjes su 'gro ba bdag gi snod du byin gyis brlab cing yang dag par gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: drang srong gi snod ces bya ba la drang srong ste yang dag par rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dgra bcom pa dag ni snod ni drang srong gi snod yin pa de'i phyir bslab pa don du gnyer zhing drang srong gi rjes su 'gro ba bdag gi snod du byin gyis brlab cing yang dag par gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The vessel of the sages is the vessel of the sages, that is, the vessel of the perfect Buddha, the pratyekabuddha, and the arhat. Therefore, the one who seeks the training and follows the sages should be consecrated and upheld as my vessel.

original: bza' ba kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bza' ba kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The practice of eating is the practice of eating.

original: bza' ba'i bya ba nye bar longs spyod du rung ba yin la /
analyzed: bza' ba'i bya ba nye bar longs spyod du rung ba yin la /
translated: It is suitable for the enjoyment of the activity of eating.

original: slong ba la yang 'dis len par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: slong ba la yang 'dis len par byed pa yin te /
translated: And by this, one receives from a beggar.

original: bza' ba'i bya bas zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bza' ba'i bya bas zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the activity of eating.

original: gsol ba 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni las brjod pa med pa'i phyir gsol ba 'ba' zhig yin no //
analyzed: gsol ba 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni las brjod pa med pa'i phyir gsol ba 'ba' zhig yin no //
translated: Only the motion is the motion alone, because there is no declaration of the action.

original: bden pa'i dus zhes bya ba ni bden pa smra bar bya ba'i 'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i dus zhes bya ba ni bden pa smra bar bya ba'i 'o //
translated: The time of truth is the time for speaking the truth.

original: byung ba'i dus zhes bya ba ni gang byung ba ni 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: byung ba'i dus zhes bya ba ni gang byung ba ni 'das pa yin te /
translated: The time when it occurs is the past, because what has occurred has already passed.

original: de'i tshig gi dus yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshig gi dus yin no //
translated: That is the time of the statement.

original: go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be understood means it is to be known.

original: yang na dor bar bya ba ni byung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na dor bar bya ba ni byung ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Alternatively, what is to be discarded is called what occurs.

original: brjod par bya ba ni da ltar yin te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni da ltar yin te /
translated: What is to be stated is the present,

original: dor bar bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dor bar bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is to be discarded.

original: bran mo ni khyim du skyes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bran mo ni khyim du skyes pa nyid yin no //
translated: A slave is born into a household.

original: brkus pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni rkun ma la sogs pas 'ga' zhig nas khyer te 'ongs nas bdag gir byas pa yin no //
analyzed: brkus pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni rkun ma la sogs pas 'ga' zhig nas khyer te 'ongs nas bdag gir byas pa yin no //
translated: Is it stolen? It is not stolen, because it was not taken by thieves and so on.

original: btsongs pa ni gang 'ga' zhig gis rin las byin par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: btsongs pa ni gang 'ga' zhig gis rin las byin par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Is it bought? It is not bought, because it was not given a price.

original: rnyed btson ni de lta de ltar rnyed par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnyed btson ni de lta de ltar rnyed par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Is it found? It is not found, because it was not found in this way or that.

original: rtsod pa can ni skyin po la sogs pa bsrab pa nyid du mi nus pa'i phyir de bran mor byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa can ni skyin po la sogs pa bsrab pa nyid du mi nus pa'i phyir de bran mor byas pa yin no //
translated: Is it a slave due to a debt? It is not a slave due to a debt, because it is not unable to repay a debt and so on.

original: rgyal pos bkrabs pa ni blo'i grogs byed pa la gtso mor gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyal pos bkrabs pa ni blo'i grogs byed pa la gtso mor gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: The king's retinue is the principal means of assistance to the king's mind.

original: rgyal srid bskyang ba'i grogs su gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyal srid bskyang ba'i grogs su gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the means of assistance in governing the kingdom.

original: rgyal po la sdigs pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rgyal po'i dgra bo'i dngos por gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyal po la sdigs pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rgyal po'i dgra bo'i dngos por gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Is it not a threat to the king? means that it is the thing that is the enemy of the king.

original: 'on kyang gnod pa'i las byed pa nyid du rtsom pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnod pa'i las byed pa nyid du rtsom pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not the one who begins to do the act of harming.

original: gnod pa'i las byed pa ni gang zhig gnod pa'i las byed pa nyid du rtsom pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa'i las byed pa ni gang zhig gnod pa'i las byed pa nyid du rtsom pa yin no //
translated: The one who does the act of harming is the one who begins to do the act of harming.

analyzed: byas sam byed du bcug pa ni gang zhig gis sngon byas @137a * //
translated: The one who has done or caused to be done is the one who has done it in the past

original: pa'am ; da ltar byed pa las ldog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'am ; da ltar byed pa las ldog pa med pa yin no //
translated: or is not turning back from doing it in the present.

original: 'thab krol can zhes bya ba ni ngag gi spyod pa rtsub par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'thab krol can zhes bya ba ni ngag gi spyod pa rtsub par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The one who is quarrelsome is the one whose verbal conduct is harsh.

original: mya ngan gyis gzir ba ni bdag po la sogs pa'i mya ngan gyi las su rung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan gyis gzir ba ni bdag po la sogs pa'i mya ngan gyi las su rung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The one who is overcome by sorrow is the one who is not fit to be a lord, etc. because of the work of sorrow.

original: sbrum ma zhes bya ba ni sems can dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sbrum ma zhes bya ba ni sems can dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: A pregnant woman is one who is carrying a fetus.

original: mtshan gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni gang la bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po yod pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni gang la bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po yod pa yin no //
translated: A hermaphrodite is one who has both male and female faculties.

original: rtag tu zla mtshan 'dzag pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi skye gnas kyi sgo nas rtag tu zla mtshan 'dzag par gyur pa de la bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zla mtshan 'dzag pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi skye gnas kyi sgo nas rtag tu zla mtshan 'dzag par gyur pa de la bya'o //
translated: One who always has a discharge is one from whose vagina a discharge always flows.

original: zla mchan mi 'dzag pa ni skye ba'i chos can med pa yin no //
analyzed: zla mchan mi 'dzag pa ni skye ba'i chos can med pa yin no //
translated: One who does not have a discharge is one who is not subject to menstruation.

original: mtshan ma tsam yod pa ni mtshan ma tsam yod pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma tsam yod pa ni mtshan ma tsam yod pa yin no //
translated: One who has only the sign is one who has only the sign of a vagina.

original: dge slong pha sun phyung ba zhes bya ba ni gang gis mi tshangs par spyod pas dge slong pha sun phyung bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong pha sun phyung ba zhes bya ba ni gang gis mi tshangs par spyod pas dge slong pha sun phyung bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: One who has corrupted a monk is one who has corrupted a monk through sexual intercourse.

original: mu stegs can zhes bya ba ni lta ba gzhan dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can zhes bya ba ni lta ba gzhan dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: A heretic is one who has another view.

original: gang 'ga' zhig gis de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rab tu byung ba yang dag par blangs nas mu stegs can gyi lta bas 'di pa'i chos gos yongs su spangs nas mu stegs can gyi rtags blangs te /

translated: Some, having taken up the life of a monk as taught by the Tathagata, but having abandoned the Dharma robes because of the views of the tirthikas, take up the marks of the tirthikas.

original: mu stegs can gyi rtags des mu stegs byed kyi gnas der skya rengs dang po nyid du 'char bar byed na de ni mu stegs can zhugs pa yin bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi rtags des mu stegs byed kyi gnas der skya rengs dang po nyid du 'char bar byed na de ni mu stegs can zhugs pa yin bar rig par bya'o //
translated: If, by means of those marks of the tirthikas, they cause the first dawn to rise in the abode of the tirthikas, they should be known as having entered the tirthikas.

original: chom rkun par grags pa zhes bya ba ni chom rkun pa'i rgyal mtshan 'chang ba yin no //
analyzed: chom rkun par grags pa zhes bya ba ni chom rkun pa'i rgyal mtshan 'chang ba yin no //
translated: One who is known as a bandit is one who bears the banner of a bandit.

original: bdag nyid kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las ma chags pa kho nar shes bzhin du dge slong ma'i dge 'dun dang lhan cig las gnyis kyi bar du nyams su myong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni rku thabs su gnas pa yin no //

translated: One who, knowing that the act of full ordination is not complete, experiences the two acts together with the Sangha of nuns, is one who dwells by theft.

analyzed: tha dang du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun tha dad pa dag ni tha dad du gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: thugs brtse ba can zhes bya ba ni brtse bas dam pa'i yul la gzhug par bya ba yin no // snga na med pa'i sdom pa sbyin pa ni rjes su gzung bar bya ba yin no //

analyzed: mdze ni rab tu grags pa yin no //

analyzed: chad chen po'i 'brum bu ni 'bras yin no // sha bkra ni mdze'i rnam pa kho na yin te / lus kyi skabs skabs @137b su'o ;
translated: “They should be expelled” means that they should be expelled from the community.🔽“They should be expelled” means that they should be expelled from the community.🔽“They should be expelled” means that they should be expelled from the community.🔽“They should be expelled” means that they should be expelled from the community.🔽“They should be expelled” means that they should be expelled from the community.🔽“They should be expelled” means that they should be expelled from the community.

original: bkres dab ni bkres pa'i nad yin no //
analyzed: bkres dab ni bkres pa'i nad yin no //
translated: Hunger is a disease of hunger.

original: nyin mo 'am mtshan mo la len gcig cig 'ong ba'i rims gang yin pa de ni nyin gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: nyin mo 'am mtshan mo la len gcig cig 'ong ba'i rims gang yin pa de ni nyin gcig pa yin no //

original: gal te mtshan mo 'ong zhing nyin mo mi 'ong ba'am /🔽nyin mtshan du mi 'ong ba gang yin pa de ni nyin gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mtshan mo 'ong zhing nyin mo mi 'ong ba'am / nyin mtshan du mi 'ong ba gang yin pa de ni nyin gnyis pa yin no //
translated: If it comes at night and not during the day,

original: nyi ma gcig la 'ong zhing gnyis pa la mi 'ong la /
analyzed: nyi ma gcig la 'ong zhing gnyis pa la mi 'ong la /
translated: or if it comes every other day or night,🔽it is called every other day.🔽If it comes every third day,

original: yang gsum pa la 'ong ba de ni nyin gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gsum pa la 'ong ba de ni nyin gsum pa yin no //
translated: it is called every third day.

original: nyin bzhi pa ni rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: nyin bzhi pa ni rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: The every fourth day fever is well known.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan lhan cig 'khrugs par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan lhan cig 'khrugs par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus pa yin no //
translated: When wind, bile, and phlegm are disturbed together, it is called a combination.

original: rtag pa'i rims ni gang rtag tu 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i rims ni gang rtag tu 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: A chronic fever is one that is always present.

original: chos gsum gyis zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: chos gsum gyis zhes bya ba la ;
translated: By means of three qualities,

original: chos gsum po dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gsum po dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three qualities?

original: dus snga mar bya ba byas pa nyid ni chos gcig yin la /
analyzed: dus snga mar bya ba byas pa nyid ni chos gcig yin la /
translated: The first quality is having done what should be done in the past.

original: sems mnyes par byed pa ni gnyis pa yin zhing /
analyzed: sems mnyes par byed pa ni gnyis pa yin zhing /
translated: The second is pleasing the mind.

original: bar chad kyi chos yongs su dag pa ni gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos yongs su dag pa ni gsum pa yin te /
translated: The third is being free from obstacles.

original: rgyur gyur pa gsum po de dag gis tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sdom pa sbyin par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa gsum po de dag gis tshangs par spyod pa la nye bar gnas pa'i sdom pa sbyin par bya ba yin no //
translated: The vow of pure conduct should be given by these three causal qualities.

original: grib tshong gzhal bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grib tshong gzhal bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The shadow should be measured.

original: shing bu sor bzhi pa thur ma'i ming can ni skyes bu yin la /
analyzed: shing bu sor bzhi pa thur ma'i ming can ni skyes bu yin la /
translated: A four-finger-width stick is called a man.

original: de la skyes bu'i grangs kyis grib ma gzhal bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la skyes bu'i grangs kyis grib ma gzhal bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The shadow should be measured by the number of men.

original: thur ma ji tsam pa'i grib ma de tsam la skyes bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thur ma ji tsam pa'i grib ma de tsam la skyes bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The shadow of a man is the same length as the man.

original: dgun zla ra ba dang / 'bring po dang / tha chungs dang / dpyid za ra ba zhes bya ba'i zla ba bzhi ni dgun gyi dus yin no //
analyzed: dgun zla ra ba dang / 'bring po dang / tha chungs dang / dpyid za ra ba zhes bya ba'i zla ba bzhi ni dgun gyi dus yin no //
translated: The four months beginning with Phālguna, Caitra, Vaiśākha and Jyeṣṭha are the winter season.

original: dpyid zla 'bring po dang / tha chungs dang / dbyar zla ra ba dang / dbyar zla 'bring po ste bzhi po de dag ni dpyid kyi dus yin no //
analyzed: dpyid zla 'bring po dang / tha chungs dang / dbyar zla ra ba dang / dbyar zla 'bring po ste bzhi po de dag ni dpyid kyi dus yin no //
translated: The four months beginning with Āṣāḍha, Śravaṇa, Bhādrapada and Āśvina are the summer season.

original: dbyar zla tha chungs kyi zla ba ni dbyar yin no //
analyzed: dbyar zla tha chungs kyi zla ba ni dbyar yin no //
translated: The month of Kārttika is the rainy season.

original: dbyar zla tha chungs kyi tshes bcu drug ni dbyar thung ngu yin no //
analyzed: dbyar zla tha chungs kyi tshes bcu drug ni dbyar thung ngu yin no //
translated: The sixteenth day of the month of Kārttika is the beginning of the rainy season.

original: dbyar zla tha chungs kyi tshes bcu drug dor ba'i ston zla ra ba dang / ston zla 'bring po dang / ston zla tha chungs zhes bya ba'i zla ba gsum ni dbyar ring po yin no //
analyzed: dbyar zla tha chungs kyi tshes bcu drug dor ba'i ston zla ra ba dang / ston zla 'bring po dang / ston zla tha chungs zhes bya ba'i zla ba gsum ni dbyar ring po yin no //
translated: The three months beginning with Mārgaśīrṣa, Pauṣa and Māgha are the long rainy season.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i dus yin no //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i dus yin no //
translated: The time is the time of cyclic existence.

original: gnas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The place is the place of birth.

original: chos bzhi bsten pas nad @138a * //
analyzed: chos bzhi bsten pas nad @138a * //
translated: The four things to be relied upon are:

original: pa 'tsho bar byed pa dang / chos gsum bsten pas rang bzhin du gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: pa 'tsho bar byed pa dang / chos gsum bsten pas rang bzhin du gnas pa yin te /
translated: One who is living in a natural abode has three things:

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa'i ni bsod snyoms dang / gnas mal dang / bgo ba dag yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa'i ni bsod snyoms dang / gnas mal dang / bgo ba dag yin la /
translated: a natural abode, natural food, and natural clothing.

original: nad pa'i ni sman dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: nad pa'i ni sman dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: One who is sick has medicine.

original: 'tsho ba'i phyir don du gnyer bar bya ba dang / bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gnas yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i phyir don du gnyer bar bya ba dang / bstan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gnas yin no //
translated: These are the abodes because they are sought and taught for the sake of living.

original: mkhyen cing zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: mkhyen cing zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: “ Knowing” is by means of the knowledge of what is possessed of outflows.

original: gzigs te zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: gzigs te zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: “ Seeing” is by means of the knowledge of what is not possessed of outflows.

original: 'dir rlung gi mthar thug pa ni dogs yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rlung gi mthar thug pa ni dogs yin te /
translated: Here, the end of the wind is the sky,

original: der rdzogs pa'i phyir dang / gos kyi mthar thug pa ni phyag dar yin te ;
analyzed: der rdzogs pa'i phyir dang / gos kyi mthar thug pa ni phyag dar yin te ;
translated: because it is complete there. The end of clothing is dustheap,

original: der rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: der rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is complete there.

original: de la phyag dar dang ngogs gang yin pa de phyag dar khrod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la phyag dar dang ngogs gang yin pa de phyag dar khrod pa yin te /
translated: There, that which is the dustheap and the bank is the charnel ground.

original: shin tu rnyings pa nyid kyi phyir longs spyod du mi rung ba phyag dar du bor ba don du 'gyur ba nyid ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnyings pa nyid kyi phyir longs spyod du mi rung ba phyag dar du bor ba don du 'gyur ba nyid ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “worthless” because it is not fit to be used, since it is very old and is discarded as rubbish.

original: rung ba zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rung ba zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med par grub pa yin no //
translated: “Fit” means that it is established as being free of any offense.

original: rnyed sla ba zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol chung dus rnyed par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rnyed sla ba zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol chung dus rnyed par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: “Easy to obtain” means that it can be obtained with little effort.

original: dar ni srin bal gyi rigs kyi bye brag gi rgyu las btags pa yin no //
analyzed: dar ni srin bal gyi rigs kyi bye brag gi rgyu las btags pa yin no //
translated: “Silk” is a name for a type of cotton.

original: dar la ni rgyu dang spun thag ran ma zhag pa mthong ba la sgrib bar nus pa ma yin pa'i gos la bya'o //
analyzed: dar la ni rgyu dang spun thag ran ma zhag pa mthong ba la sgrib bar nus pa ma yin pa'i gos la bya'o //
translated: “Silk” should be understood as a cloth that is not able to obscure the seeing of the warp and weft threads.

original: sha na las byas pa ni sha na'i ras yin no //
analyzed: sha na las byas pa ni sha na'i ras yin no //
translated: “Cotton” is a cloth made from cotton.

original: mon dar zhes bya ba ni rtsva'i rigs kyi shun pa las byas pa'i gos yin no //🔽men gos zhes bya ba ni srin bu'i rnam pa can gyi srog chags kyis byas pa'i srin bal las yang dag par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mon dar zhes bya ba ni rtsva'i rigs kyi shun pa las byas pa'i gos yin no //🔽men gos zhes bya ba ni srin bu'i rnam pa can gyi srog chags kyis byas pa'i srin bal las yang dag par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “Wool” is a cloth made from the outer skin of grass.🔽“Kasha” is a cloth made from the down of a type of insect.

original: be'u ras yug chen dang / be'u ras ni gcig tu ngos gnyis ka nas spus khebs par 'jig rten du grags pa yin no //
analyzed: be'u ras yug chen dang / be'u ras ni gcig tu ngos gnyis ka nas spus khebs par 'jig rten du grags pa yin no //
translated: The cloth of the kshuhma animal and the cloth of the kshuhma animal are known in the world as cloth that is woven on both sides with the same quality of hair.

original: la mar zhes bya ba ni la ba'i rigs de dag srin bu'i kha dog dang 'dra bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: la mar zhes bya ba ni la ba'i rigs de dag srin bu'i kha dog dang 'dra bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: The cloth of the lava animal is the type of cloth that is the color of a worm.

original: yul ka shi ka'i ras phran ni ka shi ka'i gos su rnam par btags pa yul b'a r'a na s'i nyid du btags pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yul ka shi ka'i ras phran ni ka shi ka'i gos su rnam par btags pa yul b'a r'a na s'i nyid du btags pa la bya'o //
translated: The cloth of the kashmīra animal is the cloth of the kashmīra animal that is designated as cloth of the country of Kashmir, which is designated as the country of Varanasi.

original: zar ma'i ras phran ni zar ma rnam par btags pa yin no ;
analyzed: zar ma'i ras phran ni zar ma rnam par btags pa yin no ;
translated: The cloth of the shasha animal is designated as the cloth of the shasha animal.

original: / du gu la'i ras phran ni du gu lar rnam par btags pa yin no //
analyzed: / du gu la'i ras phran ni du gu lar rnam par btags pa yin no //
translated: The cloth of the dugūla animal is designated as the cloth of the dugūla animal.

original: zar ma dang du gu la dag kyang rtsva'i rigs las byas pa yin no //
analyzed: zar ma dang du gu la dag kyang rtsva'i rigs las byas pa yin no //
translated: The shasha and dugūla are also made from the type of grass.

original: ras bal gyi rgyu dang srin bal gyi spun las gang byas pa'i gos phra mo ni ko tam pa'i ras zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ras bal gyi rgyu dang srin bal gyi spun las gang byas pa'i gos phra mo ni ko tam pa'i ras zhes bya'o //
translated: The fine cloth made from cotton and silk thread is called the cloth of the koṭamba animal.

original: rung ba zhes bya ba ni de la rung ba ma yin ba blang bar @138b bya ba ma yin zhing longs spyad par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: rung ba zhes bya ba ni de la rung ba ma yin ba blang bar @138b bya ba ma yin zhing longs spyad par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: “Proper” means that which is proper to take up and consume, and not that which is improper to take up and consume.

original: gang blang zhing longs spyad par 'ongs pa de longs la tshod zin par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang blang zhing longs spyad par 'ongs pa de longs la tshod zin par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should take up and consume that which is proper to take up and consume, but one should do so in moderation.

original: de la lhag par rnyed par gyur na dus su blang zhing tshod de tshad zin par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la lhag par rnyed par gyur na dus su blang zhing tshod de tshad zin par bya ba yin no //
translated: If one obtains more than that, one should take up and consume it in moderation, but only at the proper time.

original: dam 'cha' 'am zhes bya ba ni khas len tam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dam 'cha' 'am zhes bya ba ni khas len tam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Promise” means to agree.

original: khyim dag las bsod snyoms len par byed pas na bsod snyoms yin no //
analyzed: khyim dag las bsod snyoms len par byed pas na bsod snyoms yin no //
translated: “Alms” means to take up alms from the homes of laypeople.

original: spro 'am zhes bya ba ni khas len tam zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: spro 'am zhes bya ba ni khas len tam zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “Can you bear it?” means “can you agree?”

original: 'bras chan ni 'bras khrol la sogs pa'i bza' ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras chan ni 'bras khrol la sogs pa'i bza' ba yin no //
translated: “Rice” means food made from rice, such as boiled rice.

original: skyo ma ni chu'i bsgral ma yin no //
analyzed: skyo ma ni chu'i bsgral ma yin no //
translated: “Soup” means food made from water.

original: thug pa kho na btung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir thug pa yin no //
analyzed: thug pa kho na btung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir thug pa yin no //
translated: “Congee” means food that is only to be drunk, because it is too thin to be eaten.

original: rtag res 'khor ni rtag tu 'byung ba'i ston mo yin no //
analyzed: rtag res 'khor ni rtag tu 'byung ba'i ston mo yin no //
translated: The permanent festival is the festival that occurs always.

original: mgron du bos pa ni nges par byas pa'i zas yin no //
analyzed: mgron du bos pa ni nges par byas pa'i zas yin no //
translated: The invited festival is the food that is prepared for a specific time.

original: tshes brgyad la nges par sbyor ba'i ston mo ni brgyad ston yin no //
analyzed: tshes brgyad la nges par sbyor ba'i ston mo ni brgyad ston yin no //
translated: The festival of the eighth is the festival that is prepared on the eighth day of every month.

original: de bzhin du bcu bzhi ston dang / nya ston yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcu bzhi ston dang / nya ston yang shes par bya'o //
translated: So too, one should understand the festival of the fourteenth and the festival of the fifteenth.

original: rung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rung ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The term “proper” means

original: rung ba ma yin pa yongs su longs spyad par mi bya zhing rung ba blangs la tshod zin par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa yongs su longs spyad par mi bya zhing rung ba blangs la tshod zin par bya ba yin no //
translated: one should not enjoy what is improper, but should take what is proper and be moderate.

original: bkus te bor ba zhes bya ba la bkus pa ni bskol ba yin la /
analyzed: bkus te bor ba zhes bya ba la bkus pa ni bskol ba yin la /
translated: The term “spilled” means boiled.

original: khu ba bkus shing btsir nas phyi rol du bor ba gang yin pa de ni bkus te bor ba yin no //
analyzed: khu ba bkus shing btsir nas phyi rol du bor ba gang yin pa de ni bkus te bor ba yin no //
translated: That which is boiled and squeezed and then spilled outside is “spilled.”

original: ltung ba ni sdom pa 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba ni sdom pa 'jig pa yin no //
translated: A downfall is the destruction of vows.

original: ltung ba dang rjes su mthun pas na pham par gyur pa'i chos brgyad po dag ni ltung bar 'gyur ba yin ni //
analyzed: ltung ba dang rjes su mthun pas na pham par gyur pa'i chos brgyad po dag ni ltung bar 'gyur ba yin ni //
translated: The eight defeating offenses are downfalls because they are in accord with downfalls.

original: dge slong mar mi rung zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma smad pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong mar mi rung zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma smad pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “he is not fit to be a bhikṣuṇī” means that he is not fit to be a nun.

analyzed: dge slong ma dang lhan cig gnas pa dang longs spyad pa'i skal ba med pa'i phyir ro // dge sbyong ma'i snod du ris mthun pa par 'gyur ba'i chos brgyad po dag gi nad nas ma nges pa'i chos gcig ni gang yang rung ba yin no //

original: dge slong mar mi rung zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma smad pa yin te /🔽dge slong ma dang lhan cig gnas pa dang longs spyad pa'i skal ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽dge sbyong ma'i snod du ris mthun pa las skal ba nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dge sbyong mar rung ba ma yin no //

original: sh'akya'i sras kyi 'brel pa med pas bstan pa de la nyams su len pa med pa'i phyir sh'akya'i sras mor mi rung ba yin no //
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras kyi 'brel pa med pas bstan pa de la nyams su len pa med pa'i phyir sh'akya'i sras mor mi rung ba yin no //
translated: He is not fit to be a lay practitioner of the Mahāyāna, the Śrāvakayāna, and the Pratyekabuddhayāna because he is not fit to be a lay practitioner of the three vehicles.🔽He is not fit to be a lay practitioner of the three vehicles because he is not fit to be a lay practitioner of the three vehicles and the bodhisattva vehicle.🔽He is not fit to be a lay practitioner of the three vehicles and the bodhisattva vehicle because he is not fit to be a lay practitioner of the four vehicles.🔽He is not fit to be a lay practitioner of the four vehicles because he is not fit to be a lay practitioner of the four vehicles and the vehicle of the solitary buddhas.🔽He is not fit to be a lay practitioner of the four vehicles and the vehicle of the solitary buddhas because he is not fit to be a lay practitioner of the five vehicles.🔽He is not fit to

original: 'ga' zhig tu phyir bcos pa byas nas kyang dge slong mar 'gyur ram zhe na /🔽dge slong ma'i @139a * //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu phyir bcos pa byas nas kyang dge slong mar 'gyur ram zhe na / dge slong ma'i @139a * //
translated: Some say, After amendment, one becomes a bhiksuni.

original: dngos po las nyams pa zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po las nyams pa zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: The text says, She falls from the status of a bhiksuni.

original: ji ltar phyir bcos pas kyang dge slong ma'i dngos po yang dag par skye ba'i nus pa med pa de ltar 'dir yang dge slong ma'i dngos po las nyams par 'gyur pa yin pas na dge slong mar mi rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //

translated: This refers to the case of a thief and to the case of someone who has the perception that the property belongs to another.

original: ci tsam zhes bya ba 'dis ni ma sha ka lnga nyid la sogs brdzas kyi tshad du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ci tsam zhes bya ba 'dis ni ma sha ka lnga nyid la sogs brdzas kyi tshad du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “to the extent that” indicates the amount of property that is involved.

original: rgyal po ni rgyal srid nyid kyi phyir cod pan btags par gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyal po ni rgyal srid nyid kyi phyir cod pan btags par gyur ba yin no //
translated: A king is one who has been anointed with the sacred water that is poured over his head in order to become a sovereign.

original: blon po chen po ni rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur ba yin no //
analyzed: blon po chen po ni rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur ba yin no //
translated: A minister is one who has been appointed as a regent.

original: rkun ma ni gzhan gyi rdzas 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽byis pa ni tshar gcod par snang ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkun ma ni gzhan gyi rdzas 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir ro // byis pa ni tshar gcod par snang ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: A thief is one who steals the property of others.🔽A child is one who has not yet reached the age of reason.

original: blun pa ni car bcad par snang ba mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blun pa ni car bcad par snang ba mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A fool is one who has reached the age of reason but is not capable of discerning what is proper.

original: rku ba ni rku sems mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rku ba ni rku sems mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A thief is one who is intent on stealing.

original: gsod pa ni gzhan pa nyid dang dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsod pa ni gzhan pa nyid dang dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Killing is due to the absence of faith in others.

original: bcings pa ni dad pa yod du zin kyang zhen pa nyid yin pa 'am /
analyzed: bcings pa ni dad pa yod du zin kyang zhen pa nyid yin pa 'am /
translated: Binding is due to attachment, even though there is faith.

original: rgya che ba yod du zin kyang dad pa med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rgya che ba yod du zin kyang dad pa med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Banishment is due to the absence of faith, even though there is faith.

original: spyug pa ni rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir dang / dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dge slong ma'i dngos po las nyams pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la nan tan du byed pa lhod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyug pa ni rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir dang / dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // dge slong ma'i dngos po las nyams pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la nan tan du byed pa lhod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Expulsion is due to the breadth of the offense and the presence of faith.🔽The degeneration of the state of a nun is due to the laxity of practice.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul 'jig par 'gyur ba ni bshags pa'i bsam pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul 'jig par 'gyur ba ni bshags pa'i bsam pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The destruction of the way of virtuous ones is due to the absence of the intention to confess.

original: nyams pa ni bshags pa'i bsam pa yod du zin kyang bshags pa'i nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams pa ni bshags pa'i bsam pa yod du zin kyang bshags pa'i nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Degeneration is due to the absence of the ability to confess, even though there is the intention to confess.

original: bcom pa ni skal ba mnyam zhing ris mthun pa des nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom pa ni skal ba mnyam zhing ris mthun pa des nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ruin is due to the absence of the ability to eliminate the afflictions of those of the same status and class.

original: ltung ba ni rgyud la de skyes pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltung ba ni rgyud la de skyes pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the potential for that downfall does not exist in the mindstream.

original: pham par 'gyur ba ni nyon mongs pa tshar gcad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba ni nyon mongs pa tshar gcad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The defeat is because the afflictions are eliminated.🔽The irremediable is because there is no other method.

original: phyir bslang du med par gyur pa ni thabs su gyur pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //🔽bsams bzhin du srog chags grog spur la sogs pa zhes bya ba la bsams bzhin du ste /
analyzed: phyir bslang du med par gyur pa ni thabs su gyur pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro // bsams bzhin du srog chags grog spur la sogs pa zhes bya ba la bsams bzhin du ste /
translated: Intentionally means deliberately.

original: phra mor lta bar byed pas na lta bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phra mor lta bar byed pas na lta bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Because it views the subtle, it is called a view.

original: srog chags grog spur gyi ming can srog gcad par mi bya zhing tha dad par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: srog chags grog spur gyi ming can srog gcad par mi bya zhing tha dad par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: One should not kill or destroy the creatures called ants.

original: mi ni dbang po'i grong tha dad pa grub pa yin no //🔽mir chags pa ni sgo ngar gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: mi ni dbang po'i grong tha dad pa grub pa yin no // mir chags pa ni sgo ngar gtogs pa'am /
translated: Humans are established as a separate class of beings because of their faculties.

original: mngal nas skyes par gtogs pa'i dbang po'i gnas skabs yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngal nas skyes par gtogs pa'i dbang po'i gnas skabs yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Attachment to being human refers to the incomplete stage of faculties of those who are attached to being human, whether they are in the womb or born from an egg.

original: rang gi lag dar te zhes bya ba ni rang gi lag gis de la mtshon cha byin @141a * //
analyzed: rang gi lag dar te zhes bya ba ni rang gi lag gis de la mtshon cha byin @141a * //
translated: With one’s own hand means that one gives a weapon to that being with one’s own hand.

original: pa ni dge slong ma bdag nyid kyis bstabs pa yin no //🔽de la mtshon thogs pa gnyer tam zhes bya ba ni des mtshon stobs par byed pa gnyer ba yin no //
analyzed: pa ni dge slong ma bdag nyid kyis bstabs pa yin no // de la mtshon thogs pa gnyer tam zhes bya ba ni des mtshon stobs par byed pa gnyer ba yin no //
translated: The nun herself is the one who serves.🔽To seek out someone to kill means to seek out someone to kill her.

original: de 'chir bcug pa ni sdig pa byed pa 'chi ba'i phyir yang dag par bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'chir bcug pa ni sdig pa byed pa 'chi ba'i phyir yang dag par bkod pa yin no //
translated: To put her in a prison means to put her in a prison in order to kill her.

original: sdug bsngal ba 'ga' zhig 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba 'ga' zhig 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod pa ste /
translated: To praise death means to praise death to someone who is suffering.

original: sdig byed pa ni las kyi rnam par smin par 'dod pa ma yin pa dang yang dag par ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig byed pa ni las kyi rnam par smin par 'dod pa ma yin pa dang yang dag par ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the one who commits evil does not desire the ripening of karma.

original: 'tsho ba ngan pa ni lhag par sdug bsngal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ngan pa ni lhag par sdug bsngal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a bad livelihood is especially painful.

original: mi gtsang ba ni 'jig rten pas smad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba ni 'jig rten pas smad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the impure is despised by the world.

original: sems kyi 'dod pa ni 'ching ba'i rgyu mtshan bdag nyid kyis rnyed par rtog par byed pa'i phyir thog mar 'chi bar kun du rtog par byed la 'chi ba'i 'og tu bdag nyid thob par rtog pa'i phyir sems kyi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi 'dod pa ni 'ching ba'i rgyu mtshan bdag nyid kyis rnyed par rtog par byed pa'i phyir thog mar 'chi bar kun du rtog par byed la 'chi ba'i 'og tu bdag nyid thob par rtog pa'i phyir sems kyi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The desire of the mind is the first conception of death, because one imagines that one will find the cause of bondage. The desire of the mind is the conception of death, because one imagines that one will obtain a self after death.

original: sems kyis pha rol po 'chi bar rtog pa'i phyir sems kyis kun du rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kyis pha rol po 'chi bar rtog pa'i phyir sems kyis kun du rtog pa yin no //
translated: The conception of the mind is the conception of death by the mind of another, because one imagines the death of another.

original: shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba ni shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba ni shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba yin no //
translated: Deliberate lying is lying with full awareness.

original: med pa ni thob pa yin la med bzhin pa ni mngon sum byed pa'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni thob pa yin la med bzhin pa ni mngon sum byed pa'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: The non-existent is the object obtained, and the non-existent is the object made evident.

original: mi'i chos kyi rang bzhin bla ma ste khyad par du 'phags pa smra bar 'dod pa ni bden pa ma yin pa smra bar 'dod pa la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi'i chos kyi rang bzhin bla ma ste khyad par du 'phags pa smra bar 'dod pa ni bden pa ma yin pa smra bar 'dod pa la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The desire to speak of what is not true is the desire to speak of what is superior, the nature of which is human.

original: mngon par mi shes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i sgo nas yin la /
analyzed: mngon par mi shes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i sgo nas yin la /
translated: The non-understanding is from the point of view of mundane knowledge.

original: yongs su mi shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: The non-cognizance of the world is from the point of view of the supramundane.

original: 'phags pa ni zag pa med pa'i bye brag khong du chud pa'i khyad par thob pa'am shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni zag pa med pa'i bye brag khong du chud pa'i khyad par thob pa'am shes pa yin no //
translated: The noble ones are those who have attained the distinction of penetrating the uncontaminated distinction, or who have knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa ni mthong ba ste bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa ni mthong ba ste bzod pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of suffering, etc., is seeing, i.e., acquiescence.

original: reg par spyod pa ni bsam gtan bzhi yin no //
analyzed: reg par spyod pa ni bsam gtan bzhi yin no //
translated: The four meditations are the practice of contact.

original: 'di shes so //
analyzed: 'di shes so //
translated: One knows this,

original: 'di mthong ngo zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni shes par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di mthong ngo zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni shes par bya ba yin la /
translated: one sees this. The four noble truths are to be known.

original: lha la sogs pa ni mthong bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa ni mthong bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Gods, etc., are to be seen.

original: klu ni klu phra mo dag yin no //
analyzed: klu ni klu phra mo dag yin no //
translated: The nāgas are the small nāgas.

original: lto 'phye chen po ni klu chen po yin no//
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po ni klu chen po yin no//
translated: The mahoragas are the great nāgas.

original: yang na lto 'phye chen po ni sbrul mi bzad pa la bya ste //
analyzed: yang na lto 'phye chen po ni sbrul mi bzad pa la bya ste //
translated: Or, the mahoragas are the terrible snakes.

original: mthu che ba gang yin pa de la 'dir gzung ngo //
analyzed: mthu che ba gang yin pa de la 'dir gzung ngo //
translated: Here, the powerful ones are meant.

original: gtam 'dre bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni gtam 'dre ba ni gtam la sogs pa 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: gtam 'dre bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni gtam 'dre ba ni gtam la sogs pa 'dri ba yin no //
translated: Conversation means asking about conversation, etc.

original: phebs par smra bar byed pa ni de rgyun gyi gtam 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: phebs par smra bar byed pa ni de rgyun gyi gtam 'dri ba yin no //
translated: The expression “he speaks in a way that is agreeable to others” means that he asks about the welfare of others.

original: so sor kun dga' bar byed pa ni pha rol po'i bde ba @141b thob par gyur pa na bdag ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor kun dga' bar byed pa ni pha rol po'i bde ba @141b thob par gyur pa na bdag ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The expression “he delights others” means that he delights others by his own happiness.

original: rtag tu yang lhan cig gnas par byed do zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa dang rtag tu lhan cig 'dug par byed ces bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: rtag tu yang lhan cig gnas par byed do zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa dang rtag tu lhan cig 'dug par byed ces bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: The expression “he always remains in the company of others” means that he always remains in the company of gods, etc.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa dag yin no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa dag yin no //
translated: The sphere of totality of form is the four fundamental meditations of the realm of form.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni mi rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ni mi rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The ideation of impermanence is the apprehension of impermanence.

original: mi rtag par lta ba ni sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag par lta ba ni sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes yin no //
translated: The ideation of suffering is the ideation of suffering, because the view of impermanence is not the counter-agent to suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la bdag med pa'i 'du shes ni ji ltar gang yang sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bdag med pa'i 'du shes ni ji ltar gang yang sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: The ideation of non-self with regard to suffering is the ideation of non-self, because, although suffering is non-self, it is not the case that everything that is suffering is non-self.

original: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni bdag med pa'i 'du shes kyis sun dbyung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la bdag med pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni bdag med pa'i 'du shes kyis sun dbyung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la bdag med pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The notion of selflessness in regard to suffering is mentioned because suffering is to be rejected by the notion of selflessness.

original: zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes ni ro la brkam pa las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes ni ro la brkam pa las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The notion of disgust in regard to food is mentioned because it is the antidote to craving for tastes.

original: 'jig rten thams cad la mngon bar mi dga' pa'i 'du shes ni chags pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la mngon bar mi dga' pa'i 'du shes ni chags pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The notion of non-delight in the entire world is mentioned because it is the antidote to attachment.

original: spong ba'i 'du shes ni lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bzlog pa la dmigs pa yin no //🔽'dod chags dang bral pa'i 'du shes ni gang dag de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir spangs pa de dag gis spangs pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du shes ni lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bzlog pa la dmigs pa yin no // 'dod chags dang bral pa'i 'du shes ni gang dag de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir spangs pa de dag gis spangs pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The notion of rejection is mentioned because it focuses on the cessation of the afflictions such as views.🔽The notion of freedom from desire is mentioned because it is the cessation of those afflictions that focus on those objects that are to be rejected by the notion of rejection.

original: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa ldog pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa ldog pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The notion of cessation is mentioned because it is the cessation of the afflictions that focus on those objects that are to be rejected by the notion of freedom from desire.🔽The notion of non-production is mentioned because it is the non-production of the afflictions that focus on those objects that are to be rejected by the notion of cessation.

original: spangs pa dag la yang kun du spyod pa'i 'gog pa'i kun du spyod pa ni 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: spangs pa dag la yang kun du spyod pa'i 'gog pa'i kun du spyod pa ni 'gog pa yin te /
translated: The cessation of the practice of the defilements is the practice of cessation.

original: de ni 'dir rang bzhin gyis 'gog pa dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gi kun du sbyor ba 'gog pa dang / dge ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'i kun du spyod pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya ba 'gog pa gsum du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir rang bzhin gyis 'gog pa dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gi kun du sbyor ba 'gog pa dang / dge ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'i kun du spyod pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya ba 'gog pa gsum du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, cessation is taught as three types: natural cessation, cessation of the bonds of the wholesome with-outflows and the defilements, and cessation of the practice of the unwholesome and the neutral.

original: rnam par bsngos pa'i 'du shes ni lus kyi kha dog gnag tu dmigs pa yin no /🔽rnam par rnags pa'i 'du shes ni rtsa ba'i gnas skabs 'drul bar gnas pa yin no //🔽rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes ni lus skrangs par dmigs pa yin no //🔽rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa'i 'du shes ni 'bus gang bar dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa'i 'du shes ni lus kyi kha dog gnag tu dmigs pa yin no / rnam par rnags pa'i 'du shes ni rtsa ba'i gnas skabs 'drul bar gnas pa yin no // rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes ni lus skrangs par dmigs pa yin no // rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa'i 'du shes ni 'bus gang bar dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The perception of the livid is the perception of the body's color as black.🔽The perception of the festering is the perception of the body's original condition as putrid.🔽The perception of the bloated is the perception of the body as swollen.🔽The perception of the worm-infested is the perception of the body as filled with worms.

original: rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes @142a * //
analyzed: rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes @142a * //
translated: The perception of the devoured is the perception of the body as devoured by carnivores.🔽The perception of the dismembered is the perception of the body as cut into pieces.🔽The perception of the dried up is the perception of the body as shrunken.

original: ni lus kyi sha dang pags pa zos par dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: ni lus kyi sha dang pags pa zos par dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The perception of flesh-eating is the perception of the flesh and skin of the body being eaten.

original: rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes ni lus kyi sha'i lhag ma nyung ba la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes ni lus kyi sha'i lhag ma nyung ba la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The perception of blood-drinking is the perception of the little that remains of the flesh of the body.

original: rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes ni yan lag dang nyid lag phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su gtor bar dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes ni yan lag dang nyid lag phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su gtor bar dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The perception of scattered is the perception of the limbs and members scattered in all directions.

original: rus gong gi 'du shes ni sha med pa'i rus pa tsam du dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rus gong gi 'du shes ni sha med pa'i rus pa tsam du dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The perception of bones is the perception of the bones alone, without flesh.

original: stong pa nyid la so sor rtog pa'i 'du shes ni bdag nyid la stong pa nyid du 'du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la so sor rtog pa'i 'du shes ni bdag nyid la stong pa nyid du 'du shes pa yin no //
translated: The perception of emptiness is the perception of emptiness in oneself.

original: bsam gtan dang po ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: The first meditation is with applied thought and with sustained thought.

original: gnyis pa ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa yin la /
translated: The second is without applied thought and with only sustained thought.

original: gsum pa ni dga' ba med pa'i bde ba yin la /
analyzed: gsum pa ni dga' ba med pa'i bde ba yin la /
translated: The third is with the pleasure of joy.

original: bzhi ba ni sdug bsngal med cing bde ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi ba ni sdug bsngal med cing bde ba med pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is with neither pleasure nor pain.

original: gzhan dag la phan 'dogs pa'i sems ni byams pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag la phan 'dogs pa'i sems ni byams pa yin la /
translated: Loving kindness is the thought of benefiting others.🔽Compassion is the thought of freeing others from suffering.

original: gzhan sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar 'dod pa ni snying rje yin no //🔽gzhan dag gi phan pa dang ma gu pa la dmigs pa dga' ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar 'dod pa ni snying rje yin no // gzhan dag gi phan pa dang ma gu pa la dmigs pa dga' ba yin la /
translated: Compassion is the desire that they be free from suffering.🔽Joy is the delight in others’ well-being.

original: gzhan dag gi bde sdug la btang snyoms su byed pa ni btang snyoms yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi bde sdug la btang snyoms su byed pa ni btang snyoms yin te /
translated: Equanimity is the state of mind that is impartial with regard to the well-being and suffering of others.

original: bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i tshad med pa bzhi po de dag thag nye bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i tshad med pa bzhi po de dag thag nye bar byas pa yin no //
translated: These four immeasurables are the proximate causes of the four formless states.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni nam mkha' mtha' yas pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni nam mkha' mtha' yas pa yin no //
translated: The base of infinite space is the state of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba dang / ci yang med pa zhes bya ba la sbyor ba'i sems kyis kun nas slong ba nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa'i skye mched dag yin no //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba dang / ci yang med pa zhes bya ba la sbyor ba'i sems kyis kun nas slong ba nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa'i skye mched dag yin no //
translated: The base of infinite consciousness and the base of nothingness are the states of mind that are applied to the states of infinite consciousness and nothingness.

original: 'du shes kyi che ba'i bdag nyid ni 'du shes med min skye mched yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi che ba'i bdag nyid ni 'du shes med min skye mched yin no //
translated: The base of neither perception nor nonperception is the state of subtle perception.

original: zag ba med pa'i lam gyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas tha dad pa'i dbye bas sems kyi skad cig bcu drug thob pa gang yin pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //🔽zag pa med pa'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa drug spangs pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi 'bras bu thob pa gang yin pa de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: zag ba med pa'i lam gyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas tha dad pa'i dbye bas sems kyi skad cig bcu drug thob pa gang yin pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yin no // zag pa med pa'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa drug spangs pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi 'bras bu thob pa gang yin pa de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The result of stream-enterer is the attainment of the sixteen thought-moments of the path of seeing, which are differentiated as conditioned and unconditioned, after the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing have been abandoned by the uncontaminated path.🔽The result of once-returner is the attainment of the conditioned and unconditioned results by abandoning the six types of afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation by the uncontaminated path.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa spangs pas thob pa gang yin pa @142b de ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa spangs pas thob pa gang yin pa @142b de ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The result of non-returner is the attainment of the ninth stage of the afflictions of the desire realm to be abandoned by the path of meditation by the uncontaminated path.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa dgu spangs pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi 'bras bu thob pa gang yin pa de ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa dgu spangs pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi 'bras bu thob pa gang yin pa de ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The fruit of arhatship is the attainment of the conditioned and unconditioned fruits by abandoning the nine categories of defilements that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the summit of existence.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Miraculous power is the ability to move through space.

original: de'i yul ni ting nge 'dzin gang las rdzu 'phrul 'grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul ni ting nge 'dzin gang las rdzu 'phrul 'grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Its object is the concentration from which miraculous power is achieved.

original: lha'i rna ba ni yul thag ring ba dang phra ba dang bar du chod pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba ni yul thag ring ba dang phra ba dang bar du chod pa yin no //
translated: Divine ear is the ability to hear sounds far and near, subtle and gross.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the categories of mind is the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: sngon gyi skye bar gnas dang der skyes pa'i phyir sngon gyi gnas yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi skye bar gnas dang der skyes pa'i phyir sngon gyi gnas yin te /
translated: The knowledge of former existences is the knowledge of former abodes and births.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang sngon gyi gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang sngon gyi gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Concentration that focuses on that is also called the knowledge of former existences.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba de la dmigs pa'i lha'i mig la yang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba de la dmigs pa'i lha'i mig la yang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of death and rebirth is the divine eye that focuses on death and rebirth. It is also called the knowledge of death and rebirth.

original: zag pa zad pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa nyid la yang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa nyid la yang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is also called the superknowledge of the destruction of the cankers.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni gzugs can gzugs la lta ba nas nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes kyis phyi rol gyi gzugs la lta ba dge ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni gzugs can gzugs la lta ba nas nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes kyis phyi rol gyi gzugs la lta ba dge ba'i rnam par thar pa dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The eight liberations are: 1) the liberation of the form realm being who sees external forms while having a concept of internal form; 2) the liberation of the form realm being who sees external forms while not having a concept of internal form; 3) the liberation of the formless realm being who has transcended the perception of forms and does not yet have the perception of infinite space; 4) the liberation of the formless realm being who has transcended the perception of infinite space and has the perception of infinite consciousness; 5) the liberation of the formless realm being who has transcended the perception of infinite consciousness and has the perception of nothingness; 6) the liberation of the formless realm being who has transcended the perception of nothingness and has the perception of neither conception nor non-conception; 7) the liberation of the formless realm being who has transcended the perception of neither conception nor non-conception and has the perception of the cessation of conception and sensation; and 8) the liberation of the formless realm being who has transcended the perception of the cessation of conception and sensation and has the perception of the cessation of conception and sensation.

original: gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i cha dag las rnam par grol bas na gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i cha dag las rnam par grol bas na gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: One who is liberated from both aspects is liberated from both the aspect of the afflictions and the aspect of the obscurations to meditative absorption.

original: dbang po rnon pos 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon pos 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has attained the meditative absorption of cessation through sharp faculties is called an arhat.

original: chags bzhin du zhes bya ba ni skyes pa de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi sgo nas chags par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: chags bzhin du zhes bya ba ni skyes pa de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi sgo nas chags par gyur pa yin no //
translated: As if attached means that one is attached to that person through desire-realm attachment.

original: chags nas zhes bya ba ni skyes bu kun nas chags par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: chags nas zhes bya ba ni skyes bu kun nas chags par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: “Having become attached” means having become attached through the door of the man’s desire.

original: cung zhig ni phyogs gcig yin la /
analyzed: cung zhig ni phyogs gcig yin la /
translated: “A little” means a part.

original: reg pa ni nyug par byed pa yin zhing kun nas reg pa ni yongs su nyug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa ni nyug par byed pa yin zhing kun nas reg pa ni yongs su nyug par byed pa yin no //
translated: “Touching” means touching a little. “Touching all over” means touching completely.

original: 'jo sgeg byed pa ni phan tshun rngod par byed pa'o //🔽'phyar g-yeng ni 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshig brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jo sgeg byed pa ni phan tshun rngod par byed pa'o // 'phyar g-yeng ni 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshig brjod pa'o //
translated: “Caressing” means caressing each other.🔽“Flirtatious talk” means speaking words that are agreeable to desire.

original: rtsab hral ni 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i skad gsang mtho la mi gsal bsgrog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtsab hral ni 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i skad gsang mtho la mi gsal bsgrog par byed pa'o //
translated: “Indecent talk” means speaking words that are agreeable to desire in a loud voice that is unclear.

analyzed: gang gi tshe kho bo snga dro la sogs pa mthong bar gyur @143a * //

analyzed: pa de'i tshe bdag grub pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yul phyogs ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: then you should know that I am available.” This shows the place.

original: gang gi tshe kho bo sbyar ma dmar ser bgos pa dang lhung bzed thogs par mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe kho bo sbyar ma dmar ser bgos pa dang lhung bzed thogs par mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan ma yin no //
translated: When he sees me dressed in a red and yellow robe and carrying a begging bowl, and so on, are the signs.

original: gnyi ga mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su 'gro ba ni brda yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su 'gro ba ni brda yin no //
translated: Going to a place that is desired by both is the signal.

original: dngos po brgyad ces bya ba ni yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i lus bkan pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po brgyad ces bya ba ni yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i lus bkan pa yin te /
translated: The eight things are the body with its eight limbs that is stretched out.

original: de yang kun nas chags pa nyid ni yan lag gcig yin la /
analyzed: de yang kun nas chags pa nyid ni yan lag gcig yin la /
translated: Moreover, the one who is completely attached is one limb.

original: 'jo sgeg byed pa ni gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jo sgeg byed pa ni gnyis pa yin no //

analyzed: 'phyar g-yeng byed pa ni gsum pa yin no //

translated: The one who is loose is the fourth.

original: yul phyogs ni lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: yul phyogs ni lnga pa yin no //

original: mtshan ma ni drug pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni drug pa yin no //
translated: The signs are the sixth.

original: brda ni bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: brda ni bdun pa yin no //
translated: The signal is the seventh.

analyzed: 'ong ba bdag gir byed pa ni brgyad pa yin no //

original: 'og tu bsnyal bas na nyal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'og tu bsnyal bas na nyal ba yin no //
translated: Lying down is lying on one's side.

original: shin tu 'og tu 'jug par byed pas na spu snyol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu 'og tu 'jug par byed pas na spu snyol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Shaving is cutting the hair.
