analyzed: nyes pa de las bzlog pa'i phyir 'jug pa ni 'byung ba'i phyir 'jug pa yin la /
translated: The opposite of that fault is entering, because one enters into the order.

original: dge 'dun dang lhan cig bya ba mtshungs par khas blangs pas na mtshungs pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun dang lhan cig bya ba mtshungs par khas blangs pas na mtshungs pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: One shows equality by promising to do the same things as the order.

original: dor ba ni bzlog par bya ba'i las dang bral ba'i phyir rang bzhin du gnas pa thob par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dor ba ni bzlog par bya ba'i las dang bral ba'i phyir rang bzhin du gnas pa thob par gyur pa ste /
translated: Abandoning is attaining the natural state by being free from the action of turning away.

original: shin tu dma' bar 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu dma' bar 'jug pa yin no //
translated: It is entering into a very low state.

original: de dang 'dra bar yid la byed pa sgom pa ni 'dir sbyor ba yin la mos pa yid la byed pa skom pa ni yid la byed pa yin no //🔽@143b yang dag par rjes su sbyor bar bya ba ni dge ba la 'jug par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar yid la byed pa sgom pa ni 'dir sbyor ba yin la mos pa yid la byed pa skom pa ni yid la byed pa yin no // @143b yang dag par rjes su sbyor bar bya ba ni dge ba la 'jug par bya ba yin la /
translated: Here, the meditation on the mental attention that is like that is the application, and the mental attention of aspiration is the mental attention.🔽Correct application is the engagement in virtue.

original: yang dag par rjes su bstan par bya ba ni mi dge ba las bzlog pa la'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su bstan par bya ba ni mi dge ba las bzlog pa la'o //
translated: Correct teaching is the turning away from non-virtue.

original: dge sbyong byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽dge sbyong byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dge sbyong byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / dge sbyong byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the passage beginning “The one who is a śramaṇa is a śramaṇa because of patience,”🔽in the passage beginning “The one who is a śramaṇa is a śramaṇa because of patience,”

original: dge sbyong ni dge sbyong byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong ni dge sbyong byed pa yin no //
translated: a śramaṇa is one who practices śramaṇya.

original: gang gi phyir bzod pas dge sbyong du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bzod pas dge sbyong du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Because of patience, one becomes a śramaṇa.

original: bzod pa'i rang bzhin dag kyang dge sbyong byed pa yin la /
analyzed: bzod pa'i rang bzhin dag kyang dge sbyong byed pa yin la /
translated: Those who have the nature of patience are the ones who practice śramaṇya.

original: khro ba dang gshe ba dang / brdeg pa dang mtshang 'dru ba bzod pa dag ni dge sbyong du byed pa'i chos dag yin pas slar mi khro ba dang / slar mtshang mi 'bru ba'i bzod pa dang ldan pa ni dge sbyong mar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: khro ba dang gshe ba dang / brdeg pa dang mtshang 'dru ba bzod pa dag ni dge sbyong du byed pa'i chos dag yin pas slar mi khro ba dang / slar mtshang mi 'bru ba'i bzod pa dang ldan pa ni dge sbyong mar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Those who are patient with anger, abuse, beating, and slander are the ones who practice śramaṇya. Therefore, those who are endowed with the patience of not getting angry and not slandering in return are śramaṇas.

original: gang khyod sngon zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis mngon par 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang khyod sngon zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis mngon par 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning “What you did before” teaches the excellence that is desired.

original: mi g-yo ba ni yang bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni yang bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Not moving” means not doing it again.

original: gzhag par mi 'os pa ni cho ga brtsams pa kho na 'jig pa med pa'i phyir gzhag par 'os pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhag par mi 'os pa ni cho ga brtsams pa kho na 'jig pa med pa'i phyir gzhag par 'os pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is not suitable to be set aside is called “not suitable to be set aside” because it is not destroyed by merely beginning the rite.

original: gang bsnyen par rdzogs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshul khrims kyis mnyam par gyur ba nyid du nges par sbyor ba ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gang bsnyen par rdzogs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshul khrims kyis mnyam par gyur ba nyid du nges par sbyor ba ston pa yin no //
translated: “Having gone forth” and so on teaches the certainty of being equal in morality.

original: tshul khrims kyis mnyam pa nyid ni bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo brgya lon pa dang / deng bsnyen par rdzogs pa dag tshul khrims nyid kyis mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis mnyam pa nyid ni bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo brgya lon pa dang / deng bsnyen par rdzogs pa dag tshul khrims nyid kyis mtshungs pa ste /
translated: Equality in morality is that those who have gone forth a hundred years ago and those who have gone forth today are equal in morality.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa nyid kyis mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa nyid kyis mnyam pa yin no //
translated: They are equal in the pratimokṣa vows.

original: bslab ba nyid kyis mnyam pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bslab ba nyid kyis mnyam pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Equality in training is that

original: kun kyang srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i bslab par bya bas mnyam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: kun kyang srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i bslab par bya bas mnyam pa dag yin no //
translated: all are equal in the training to refrain from killing and so on.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa nyid kyis mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni kun kyang rjes su bstan pa'i mchog la rag las par mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa nyid kyis mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni kun kyang rjes su bstan pa'i mchog la rag las par mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase they are equal in terms of the recitation of the Sutra of Individual Liberation means that all of them are equal in that they depend upon the same supreme instruction.

original: kun kyang mthar tshul khrims rnam par dag pas mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //🔽pha dang ma'i 'du shes zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i pha ma la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis sgro 'dogs pa la nges par sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kun kyang mthar tshul khrims rnam par dag pas mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro // pha dang ma'i 'du shes zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i pha ma la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis sgro 'dogs pa la nges par sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase they are equal in terms of the purity of morality means that all of them are equal in the end.🔽The phrase the perception of father and mother refers to the conventional designation of father and mother in the world.

original: des par sbyor ba'i 'bras bu yang nad g-yog la sogs pa yin par bstan pa yin no //🔽gus pa ni yon tan don du gnyer ba sngon du song ba can gyi yon tan dang ldan pa dag la gus pa yin te /
analyzed: des par sbyor ba'i 'bras bu yang nad g-yog la sogs pa yin par bstan pa yin no // gus pa ni yon tan don du gnyer ba sngon du song ba can gyi yon tan dang ldan pa dag la gus pa yin te /
translated: The phrase the result of that practice refers to the result of the practice of the perception of father and mother, which is the result of nursing, etc.🔽The phrase respect means the respect that one has for those who possess good qualities, preceded by the desire for good qualities.

original: de dag ni yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin pa de'i phyir gus pa dang bcas pas 'jug par bya ba yin no zhes ni gtso @144a * //
analyzed: de dag ni yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin pa de'i phyir gus pa dang bcas pas 'jug par bya ba yin no zhes ni gtso @144a * //
translated: The phrase they are the source of all good qualities means that they are the source of all good qualities. The phrase one should practice with respect means that one should practice with respect.

original: bo gnyis pa la bya ste bdag nyid gtso bo gnyis pa mthong bas bya ba ma yin pa las slar log par 'gyur ro //🔽gnyi ga'i dbang la rag lus pa nyid kyis gnas pa ni 'jigs pa'i dbang gi sems gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: bo gnyis pa la bya ste bdag nyid gtso bo gnyis pa mthong bas bya ba ma yin pa las slar log par 'gyur ro // gnyi ga'i dbang la rag lus pa nyid kyis gnas pa ni 'jigs pa'i dbang gi sems gnas pa yin la /
translated: The second is the second master, and seeing him one turns away from what should not be done.🔽The mind is said to be under the control of fear when it is controlled by both, because it is controlled by the fear of the two.

original: sems 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang gis 'jug cing gnas pa'i phyir 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang du gyur par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sems 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang gis 'jug cing gnas pa'i phyir 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang du gyur par bya ba yin te /
translated: The mind is said to be under the control of fear because it engages and abides under the control of fear.

original: rgan rabs rnams la yang yon tan don du gnyer bas gus par bya ba dang gtso bor bya ba dang sems mnyes pa med pas 'jigs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgan rabs rnams la yang yon tan don du gnyer bas gus par bya ba dang gtso bor bya ba dang sems mnyes pa med pas 'jigs par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should fear the elders because of the desire for their good qualities, and because of the desire to please them.

original: ji ltar gnas brtan dang bar ma dang gsar bu rnams la de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas brtan dang bar ma dang gsar bu rnams la de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: One should act in the same way toward the elders, the middling, and the new students.

original: lung mnod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bya ba la nges par sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: lung mnod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bya ba la nges par sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “one should study the scriptures” and so on shows that one should be engaged in activity.

original: ma thob pa thob par bya ba ni rnyed pa 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: ma thob pa thob par bya ba ni rnyed pa 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Obtaining what has not been obtained is acquisition.

original: ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba ni khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba ni khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: The understanding is the realization of what has not been realized.

original: mngon du ma byas pa mngon sum du byas pa ni mngon du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon du ma byas pa mngon sum du byas pa ni mngon du byas pa yin no //
translated: The actualization is the actualization of what has not been actualized.

original: brtson pa mi dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba la nges par sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: brtson pa mi dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba la nges par sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The endeavor is the application to the undertaking of vigor.

original: gtam 'dres pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par mdza' ba yin no //🔽phebs par smra ba ni 'bring du mdza' ba yin no //
analyzed: gtam 'dres pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par mdza' ba yin no // phebs par smra ba ni 'bring du mdza' ba yin no //
translated: The familiarization is the uninterrupted friendship.🔽The openness is the friendship of the middle type.

original: smos 'drin ni bshes par gyur pa yin la ;
analyzed: smos 'drin ni bshes par gyur pa yin la ;
translated: The association is the friendship of the intimate.

original: 'grogs bshes ni lam gcig tu zhugs pa la sogs pas kun nas bskyed pa sdug pa g-yo ba can yin no /🔽shes rab mchog ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de'i bstan pa la khyod bsnyen par rdzogs par gyur pas ji ltar dal 'byor te /
analyzed: 'grogs bshes ni lam gcig tu zhugs pa la sogs pas kun nas bskyed pa sdug pa g-yo ba can yin no / shes rab mchog ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de'i bstan pa la khyod bsnyen par rdzogs par gyur pas ji ltar dal 'byor te /
translated: The companionship is the fickle friendship of those who have gone the same way, etc.🔽The wisdom is the highest.

original: dge ba'i las kyi gnas skabs 'byor bar gyur pa ldog pa med par 'gyur ba de ltar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi gnas skabs 'byor bar gyur pa ldog pa med par 'gyur ba de ltar bya ba yin no //
translated: Having gone forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One, the Buddha, you should act in such a way that you will not lose the opportunity of the favorable existence, i.e., the opportunity of the state of virtuous karma.

original: mdzes pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus dag pa dang / yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni las dag pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdzes pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni lus dag pa dang / yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni las dag pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The term beautiful indicates the purity of the body, and the term pure indicates the purity of action.

original: lus yongs su dag pa dang las yongs su dag pas rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par gyur te mdzes pa dang yongs su dag pa gnyi ga la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa gnyi ga sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: lus yongs su dag pa dang las yongs su dag pas rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par gyur te mdzes pa dang yongs su dag pa gnyi ga la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa gnyi ga sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: The term beautiful is applied to both the going forth and the full ordination because of the purity of the body, and the term pure is applied to both the going forth and the full ordination because of the purity of action.

original: go // bag yod par sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni bag yod pa la nges par sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: go // bag yod par sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni bag yod pa la nges par sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The phrase you should practice heedfulness indicates the application of heedfulness.

original: skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo rab tu byung bas 'phel ba yin la /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo rab tu byung bas 'phel ba yin la /
translated: The going forth of Mahāprajāpatī was the increase of the going forth.

original: @144b gzhan dag rab tu byung bas rgyas pa yin zhing phyogs phyogs su rab tu rgyu ba'i phyir yangs par gyur pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: @144b gzhan dag rab tu byung bas rgyas pa yin zhing phyogs phyogs su rab tu rgyu ba'i phyir yangs par gyur pa nyid yin no //
translated: The going forth of others was the expansion of the going forth, because it spread in all directions.

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The phrase how wonderful! indicates the engagement of those who are interested.

original: gsar du 'ongs pas bstan pa'i bya ba la goms pa med pa'i phyir gsar bu yin no //🔽gsar bu bsnyen par rdzogs pas na bar ma yin no //
analyzed: gsar du 'ongs pas bstan pa'i bya ba la goms pa med pa'i phyir gsar bu yin no // gsar bu bsnyen par rdzogs pas na bar ma yin no //
translated: They are called “new” because they are not accustomed to the activities of the teaching.🔽They are called “middling” because they are fully ordained.

original: na chod chung ba nyid kyi phyir gzhon rabs yin no //
analyzed: na chod chung ba nyid kyi phyir gzhon rabs yin no //
translated: They are called “young” because they are young in age.

original: dus nyung ba nyid kyi phyir rab tu byung nas ring po ma lon pa yin no //
analyzed: dus nyung ba nyid kyi phyir rab tu byung nas ring po ma lon pa yin no //
translated: They are called “newly ordained” because they have been ordained for a short time.

original: dra ba bkang ste zhes bya ba ni dra bar ba cug pa yin te de ni dge slong dag bsod snyoms la rgyu bas du ba ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir rang gi khyim nas 'bras chan la sogs pa'i bsod snyoms 'dzin par byed pa'i dra ba dag
analyzed: dra ba bkang ste zhes bya ba ni dra bar ba cug pa yin te de ni dge slong dag bsod snyoms la rgyu bas du ba ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir rang gi khyim nas 'bras chan la sogs pa'i bsod snyoms 'dzin par byed pa'i dra ba dag
translated: “Having filled a net” means having put it in a net. This means that because the monks were going for alms, they put the alms of boiled rice, etc. in a net in their own house in order to avoid confusion.

original: tu bsod snyoms bcug nas bdag nyid kho na gtsug lag khang du 'ongs nas bsod snyoms stobs par 'gyur ba de bud med rab tu byung ba las rnyed pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tu bsod snyoms bcug nas bdag nyid kho na gtsug lag khang du 'ongs nas bsod snyoms stobs par 'gyur ba de bud med rab tu byung ba las rnyed pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: Having put the alms in the net, they themselves came to the monastery and would distribute the alms. This is the meaning of the passage: “It would be an obstacle for a woman to obtain ordination.”

original: nyi ma gcig kyang longs spyod par ma gyur pa ni ma bgos pa yin la /
analyzed: nyi ma gcig kyang longs spyod par ma gyur pa ni ma bgos pa yin la /
translated: He has not used it even for a single day, so it is unused.

original: thag pas btags ma thag pa ni sar pa yin no //
analyzed: thag pas btags ma thag pa ni sar pa yin no //
translated: It is new because it has just been woven and is not yet cut.

original: 'di'i steng du gshegs shig pa ni rkang pa dag gis gnon par reg ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i steng du gshegs shig pa ni rkang pa dag gis gnon par reg ces bya ba yin te /
translated: He should step on it with his feet, that is, he should tread on it.

original: 'dis ni bsnyen bkur ba nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsnyen bkur ba nyams pa yin no //
translated: This shows the degeneration of service.

original: yan lag gi mchog las skyes pa ni mgo las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: yan lag gi mchog las skyes pa ni mgo las skyes pa yin te /
translated: It is born from the best of limbs, that is, from the head.

original: 'dis ni shin tu gus par phyag byed pa nyams pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni shin tu gus par phyag byed pa nyams pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the degeneration of the most respectful form of worship.

original: gzi brjid kyi 'od kyis zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi gzi brjid kyi'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid kyi 'od kyis zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi gzi brjid kyi'o //
translated: By the light of his splendor means by the splendor of his morality.

original: zil gyis gnon pa ni khyab par gyur pa'am yongs su zad pa sgrub par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa ni khyab par gyur pa'am yongs su zad pa sgrub par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: He is overcome means that he is pervaded or destroyed.

original: 'dis ni tshul khrims yongs su nyams par bstan pa yin no //🔽ro zhes bya ba ni shi ba dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni tshul khrims yongs su nyams par bstan pa yin no // ro zhes bya ba ni shi ba dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: This shows the degeneration of morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi 'tsho ba dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi 'tsho ba dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is like a corpse, because he is devoid of the life of morality.

original: nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ltung bas bral ba'i nyes pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ltung bas bral ba'i nyes pa med pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “without degeneration” means that there is no fault of falling away.

original: nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa dang 'brel ba'i kha na ma tho pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa dang 'brel ba'i kha na ma tho pa med pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “without degeneration” means that there is no offense of engaging in sexual intercourse.

original: bstan pa 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad rgyas pa'i rgyun yod par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan pa 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad rgyas pa'i rgyun yod par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The eight types of noble persons who are present in the world would not exist.

original: 'dis ni bud med kyi yul rab tu byung ba yon tan 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bud med kyi yul rab tu byung ba yon tan 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This passage shows that women are the cause for the destruction of the qualities of those who have gone forth.

original: dge slong pha ma rnams kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i lam ni dgag dbye la sogs pa yin no /
analyzed: dge slong pha ma rnams kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i lam ni dgag dbye la sogs pa yin no /
translated: The path that is common to both monks and nuns is the observance of the rainy season retreat and so on.

original: @145a * // gzir ba ni gnod bar gyur ba yin no //🔽lan cig bcags pa ni dge slong ma'i dngos po yang lan cig btang nas yang nod pa'i mthu med pa zhes bya ba ni sdom pa skye ba'i nus pa med pa ste /
analyzed: @145a * // gzir ba ni gnod bar gyur ba yin no // lan cig bcags pa ni dge slong ma'i dngos po yang lan cig btang nas yang nod pa'i mthu med pa zhes bya ba ni sdom pa skye ba'i nus pa med pa ste /
translated: The phrase “they would be oppressed” means that they would be harmed.🔽The phrase “they would be destroyed” means that they would be unable to take up the state of a nun again after they have once given it up.

original: skye ba'i chos can med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The phrase “they would not be reborn” means that they would be unable to generate the restraint of a nun.

original: mdza' ba las mdza' ba skyas par gyur to zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyi sgo nas 'phel bar gyur pa yin no //🔽'das shing dus 'das pa zhes bya ba la dus ma yin pa'i 'chi bas 'chi ba ni 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: mdza' ba las mdza' ba skyas par gyur to zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyi sgo nas 'phel bar gyur pa yin no // 'das shing dus 'das pa zhes bya ba la dus ma yin pa'i 'chi bas 'chi ba ni 'das pa yin la /
translated: The phrase from friend to friend means that the increase is by way of a continuum.🔽Death is death by untimely death.

original: dus su 'chi ba ni dus las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: dus su 'chi ba ni dus las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Death at the proper time is death at the end of a life span.

original: mdza' bo'i 'brel pa sngon du songs ba can ni 'dir grogs po yin no ;
analyzed: mdza' bo'i 'brel pa sngon du songs ba can ni 'dir grogs po yin no ;
translated: Here, friend is one who has a prior relationship of friendship.

original: / bu dang tsha bo'i 'brel pa ni bu dang tsha bo'i 'brel pas so //🔽bu mo'i bu ni snag gi tsha bo yin la /
analyzed: / bu dang tsha bo'i 'brel pa ni bu dang tsha bo'i 'brel pas so // bu mo'i bu ni snag gi tsha bo yin la /
translated: The phrase through the relationship of father and son means through the relationship of father and son.🔽The son of a daughter is a sister's son.

original: de'i yang bu ni yang tsha yin te /
analyzed: de'i yang bu ni yang tsha yin te /
translated: The son of a sister's son is a sister's grandson.

original: snag gi tsha bo dang yang tsha dag gi 'brel pas so //
analyzed: snag gi tsha bo dang yang tsha dag gi 'brel pas so //
translated: The phrase through the relationship of sister's son and sister's grandson means through the relationship of sister's son and sister's grandson.

original: rnyed par smon pa zhes bya ba ni bu mo la 'bab cing gzhol ba'i sems yin no //🔽rid cing zhes bya ba ni sha chung bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnyed par smon pa zhes bya ba ni bu mo la 'bab cing gzhol ba'i sems yin no // rid cing zhes bya ba ni sha chung bar gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase the desire for acquisition means the desire for a daughter-in-law.🔽The phrase emaciated and weak means having little flesh.

original: nyam chung ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bya ba'i nus pa dman pa'o //
analyzed: nyam chung ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bya ba'i nus pa dman pa'o //
translated: The phrase weak in body means having little strength.

original: tshogs chen ma ni smad 'tshong ba yin te /
analyzed: tshogs chen ma ni smad 'tshong ba yin te /
translated: The great assembly is a prostitute,

original: tshogs kyis yongs su longs spyod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs kyis yongs su longs spyod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is enjoyed by the assembly.

original: bkren pa ni 'dir yongs su shes pa dang bral ba yin par shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: bkren pa ni 'dir yongs su shes pa dang bral ba yin par shes par bya'o ;
translated: The poor are those who are devoid of complete knowledge.

original: / steng g-yogs ni khyim gyi steng du khyim gzhan byas pa yin no //
analyzed: / steng g-yogs ni khyim gyi steng du khyim gzhan byas pa yin no //
translated: The roof is the house built on top of the house.

original: shes pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: The ignorant are those who are not wise.

original: snod ni zangs dang bum pa la sogs pa yin la spyad ni kha phor dang nal ze la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: snod ni zangs dang bum pa la sogs pa yin la spyad ni kha phor dang nal ze la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The vessels are copper pots, water pots, and so on. The dishes are plates, bowls, and so on.

original: rlung gi shugs dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni rlung mgyogs pa dang mtshungs par ro //
analyzed: rlung gi shugs dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni rlung mgyogs pa dang mtshungs par ro //
translated: Like the speed of the wind means like the swiftness of the wind.

original: mna' ma blangs ma thag bshes pa mi brtan pa ni 'dris pa mi brtan pa'o //
analyzed: mna' ma blangs ma thag bshes pa mi brtan pa ni 'dris pa mi brtan pa'o //
translated: The newlywed wife is the unstable friend.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba nang du bsdus te zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba rnam pa du mas bsrungs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu ba nang du bsdus te zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba rnam pa du mas bsrungs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The inner withdrawal of the mind and mental factors means being guarded by many kinds of mental unhappiness.

original: rab tu gzhon zhing zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu gzhan dag las shin tu gzhon nur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gzhon zhing zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu gzhan dag las shin tu gzhon nur gyur pa'o //
translated: Very young means that he is younger than other young people.

original: bral ba ni yongs su dor ba'o //
analyzed: bral ba ni yongs su dor ba'o //
translated: Separation means abandonment.

original: byag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'drim par byed pas blangs pa'i dri'i mchog byug pa la sogs pa dang / gus pa'i tshig dang / dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i tshig gis ngal bsos nas khyim du 'jug pa yin no//
analyzed: byag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'drim par byed pas blangs pa'i dri'i mchog byug pa la sogs pa dang / gus pa'i tshig dang / dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i tshig gis ngal bsos nas khyim du 'jug pa yin no//
translated: With regard to anointing, etc., he anoints himself with the best perfumes, etc., that are brought to him, and he rests with words of respect and words that generate joy, and then he enters the house.

original: @145b sbrul gdug pas zin pa zhes bya ba ni sbrul gyis snying gnas bzung ba'am /
analyzed: @145b sbrul gdug pas zin pa zhes bya ba ni sbrul gyis snying gnas bzung ba'am /
translated: With regard to bitten by a poisonous snake, the snake has seized him by the heart.

original: sor mo gnyis pa la reg pa'i sgo nas bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: sor mo gnyis pa la reg pa'i sgo nas bzung ba yin no //
translated: Or he has been seized by the bite of a two-toed animal.

original: lag pas bsgul te zhes bya ba ni lag pas bsgyur te'o //
analyzed: lag pas bsgul te zhes bya ba ni lag pas bsgyur te'o //
translated: With regard to shaking with his hand, he is turned around with his hand.

original: chu ngogs chad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyi ga yangs yin no //
analyzed: chu ngogs chad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyi ga yangs yin no //
translated: With regard to the river bank has collapsed, etc., all of these are synonyms.

original: phyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni smre sngas 'don pa'i tshig gi sgo nas kyi hud ces 'bod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni smre sngas 'don pa'i tshig gi sgo nas kyi hud ces 'bod pa'o //
translated: With regard to again and again, this is a word of lamentation, Alas!

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang rnam pa ni rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang rnam pa ni rnam pa ste /
translated: The term “aspect” means a mode of activity.

original: rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The term “many” means many modes of activity.

original: rnam pa chen po'i sgo nas 'bras bu 'byin pa la mngon du phyogs pa 'phel zhing yongs su rgyas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa chen po'i sgo nas 'bras bu 'byin pa la mngon du phyogs pa 'phel zhing yongs su rgyas par gyur pa'o //
translated: The term “great” means that the fruit is produced through a great mode of activity.

original: de'i pha dang ma la sogs pa 'chi ba ni pha dang ma la sogs pa'i las kho na las grub pa yin te /🔽de'i sdig pa'i las kyang pha dang ma la sogs pa de dag gi las kyi lhan cig byed pa yin pa de'i phyir 'ga' zhig kyang gzhan gyi las kyis 'chi bar mi 'gyur zhing gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur
analyzed: de'i pha dang ma la sogs pa 'chi ba ni pha dang ma la sogs pa'i las kho na las grub pa yin te / de'i sdig pa'i las kyang pha dang ma la sogs pa de dag gi las kyi lhan cig byed pa yin pa de'i phyir 'ga' zhig kyang gzhan gyi las kyis 'chi bar mi 'gyur zhing gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur
translated: The death of his parents, etc. is established from the karma of his parents, etc.

original: ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ba ma yin no //
translated: His sinful karma is the cooperative condition of his parents, etc. Therefore, no one dies through the karma of another, nor does anyone experience the ripening of karma committed by another.

original: cig car zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu'o //
analyzed: cig car zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu'o //
translated: “Simultaneously” means at the same time.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo rgyu ba dang bral ba'am gtsang ba dag yin no //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo rgyu ba dang bral ba'am gtsang ba dag yin no //
translated: “Isolated” means free from the movement of people or clean.

original: bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rag lus pa med par bde bar gnas pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rag lus pa med par bde bar gnas pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “He will live happily” means that he will be in a state of living happily without depending on others.

original: glags bltas par zhes bya ba ni ci ltar 'dod par yongs su longs spyod pa'i sgo nas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: glags bltas par zhes bya ba ni ci ltar 'dod par yongs su longs spyod pa'i sgo nas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “He will be overcome” means that he will be overcome by the enjoyment of his desires.

original: gnod sems kyis kun nas dkris par gyur te zhes bya ba ni gsod sems 'jug par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod sems kyis kun nas dkris par gyur te zhes bya ba ni gsod sems 'jug par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa yin no //
translated: “He will be overcome by malice” means that he will be overcome by the defilement that causes the intention to kill.

original: thab ni me 'bud pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: thab ni me 'bud pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: “A hearth” is a place where a fire is lit.

original: gang 'jig rten pas me thab ces tha snyad du btags pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pas me thab ces tha snyad du btags pa yin no //
translated: It is called a “hearth” in the world.

original: zangs ni snod kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: zangs ni snod kyi bye brag go //
translated: “A copper vessel” is a kind of container.

original: byis pa ni na tshod dang po la bab pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa ni na tshod dang po la bab pa'o //
translated: “A child” is a person in the first stage of life.

original: 'dod chags kyi kha na ma tho ba chung mod kyi zhes bya ba la ni gsod pa la sogs pa srid pa de'i phyir sdig pa chung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi kha na ma tho ba chung mod kyi zhes bya ba la ni gsod pa la sogs pa srid pa de'i phyir sdig pa chung ba yin no //
translated: “The sin is small” means that killing and so on are possible, so the sin is small.

original: 'bral bar ni dka'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags rdo rjes lta bus shin tu spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bral bar ni dka'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags rdo rjes lta bus shin tu spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to be separated from it means that it is very difficult to abandon it, because it is like a diamond.

original: zhe sdang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa che la zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las ngan pa srid pa'i phyir zhe sdang ni sdig pa nyid che ba yin no //🔽bral bar sla ba zhes bya @146a * //
analyzed: zhe sdang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa che la zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las ngan pa srid pa'i phyir zhe sdang ni sdig pa nyid che ba yin no // bral bar sla ba zhes bya @146a * //
translated: Hatred is a great sin means that hatred is a great sin, because evil actions such as killing arise from hatred.

analyzed: ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is easy to be separated from it means that it is completely abandoned by being separated from the attachment of the desire realm.

original: ro 'jog par byed pa'i khyim rku bar byed pa la byang phyogs pa'i mi dur rku ba zhes tha snyad du btags pa yin no //
analyzed: ro 'jog par byed pa'i khyim rku bar byed pa la byang phyogs pa'i mi dur rku ba zhes tha snyad du btags pa yin no //
translated: A house that is a receptacle for corpses is called a charnel ground.

original: smyos pa'i nad kyis non par gyur pas na smyos par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: smyos pa'i nad kyis non par gyur pas na smyos par gyur pa ste /
translated: One who is possessed by the disease of insanity is insane.

original: bar bar du rang gi sems rnyed par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bar bar du rang gi sems rnyed par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes he regains his mind.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par sems par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sems g-yengs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par sems par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sems g-yengs pa yin no //
translated: The mind that is distracted is the mind that is not continuously focused on an object.

original: lag pa dang rkang pa gas shing rtsub pa stegs shing rtsub la skra ring par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa gas shing rtsub pa stegs shing rtsub la skra ring par gyur pa'o //
translated: The body is rough and hard, with long hair and nails.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa yin te /
translated: The inconceivable is beyond the scope of thought.

original: ji ltar las 'di las 'bras bu 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar bsam par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar las 'di las 'bras bu 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar bsam par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: shin tu ngo tsha ba dang ldan pas na ngo tsha ba'i tshul du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu ngo tsha ba dang ldan pas na ngo tsha ba'i tshul du gyur pa yin no //

original: phan tshun du rna ba'i nang du smra bar byed pa'i phying gcig la gcig rna bar bshub pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun du rna ba'i nang du smra bar byed pa'i phying gcig la gcig rna bar bshub pa'o //

analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyud ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyun yin no //
translated: The continuum of the ripening of karma is the continuum of ripening.

original: bdag nyid thar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid nyes pa las grol bar bya bar ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid nyes pa las grol bar bya bar ro //
translated: “I will liberate myself” means I will free myself from faults.

original: phyes btul ba'i btung ba ni chu grang mo'i skyo ma yin no //
analyzed: phyes btul ba'i btung ba ni chu grang mo'i skyo ma yin no //
translated: The drink that is served is a cold gruel.

analyzed: phan tshun gnod par byed pa ni 'khrug pa yin no //

analyzed: skye gnas dag par gyur te zhes bya ba ni skye gnas tshil gyis g-yogs pa nyid las phrag dog gis de rid par gyur par ro //🔽tshil dang bral bar gyur pa de'i phyir 'di'i mang la yongs su dag par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The conduct of a person who is spiteful is the conduct of a person who is spiteful.🔽The conduct of a person who is spiteful

original: mngal rlugs ba ni mngal med pa'i thabs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: mngal rlugs ba ni mngal med pa'i thabs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The abortion is the means of preventing the conception.

original: gtad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcol ba'i tshul gyis sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gtad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcol ba'i tshul gyis sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should entrust it, that is, give it, in the manner of a deposit.

original: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes te zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i ma rab tu 'bar bar gyur te'o //
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes te zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i ma rab tu 'bar bar gyur te'o //
translated: The perverse conception is the burning of the mind by the conception of lust.

original: bsnun te zhes bya ba ni shin tu brtsugs kyis bsnun pa'o //
analyzed: bsnun te zhes bya ba ni shin tu brtsugs kyis bsnun pa'o //
translated: The stabbing is the stabbing with a sharp knife.

original: dga' bar bya ba ste mgu bar byed par ro //
analyzed: dga' bar bya ba ste mgu bar byed par ro //
translated: The pleasing is the pleasing, the delighting.

original: ngan par smod pas zhes bya ba ni smod pa'i tshig @146b gis kun nas khyab par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ngan par smod pas zhes bya ba ni smod pa'i tshig @146b gis kun nas khyab par gyur pa'o //
translated: The censure is the censure with words of contempt.

original: brang rdung ba ni brang dang bcas pa la rdeg cing bsnun pa yin no //
analyzed: brang rdung ba ni brang dang bcas pa la rdeg cing bsnun pa yin no //
translated: The beating the breast is the beating of the breast with the hands.

original: bdag gi khyo sbrul gyis zos nas dus byed par shog shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis mna' 'dor bar byed pa gang yin pa de mna' 'dor tshig des de don med pa 'dir gyur pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag gi khyo sbrul gyis zos nas dus byed par shog shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis mna' 'dor bar byed pa gang yin pa de mna' 'dor tshig des de don med pa 'dir gyur pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The oath is the swearing with words such as, May my husband die after being bitten by a snake! etc.

original: 'on kyang gang des de'i bu nyes pa med par bsad pa dang bsam pa drag pos brdzun du smras pa de'i phyir des don med pa du ma nyams su myong bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang des de'i bu nyes pa med par bsad pa dang bsam pa drag pos brdzun du smras pa de'i phyir des don med pa du ma nyams su myong bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: But because of the lie he told with such a strong intention, he experienced many meaningless sufferings.

original: mna'i tshig ni nyes par spyod pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yongs su gyur pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: mna'i tshig ni nyes par spyod pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yongs su gyur pa tsam yin te /
translated: The word “merchandise” refers to the mere transformation of the result of the action of misconduct.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig gis bsod nams byas nas bdag 'di las 'di lta bu'i 'bras bu 'byor par gyur to zhes smras ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig gis bsod nams byas nas bdag 'di las 'di lta bu'i 'bras bu 'byor par gyur to zhes smras ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like someone who has done meritorious actions saying, “I have obtained such and such a result from this.”

original: zong ni zong du tha snyad du bya ba'o //
analyzed: zong ni zong du tha snyad du bya ba'o //
translated: “Merchandise” refers to what is conventionally called merchandise.

original: cung zad kyang mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni cung zhig tsam yang byed pa'i nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni cung zhig tsam yang byed pa'i nus pa med pa'o //
translated: “Not able to do anything at all” means not having the ability to do anything.

original: dril bu'i sbra dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dper na dril bu'i sgra thog mar drag la phyis go rims bzhin du dal gyis ches dal ba'i rim bzhin du skye gnas thams cad kyi thams cad du nyams par gyur pa de dang 'dra bar tshor ba dag🔽kyang yin no //
analyzed: dril bu'i sbra dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dper na dril bu'i sgra thog mar drag la phyis go rims bzhin du dal gyis ches dal ba'i rim bzhin du skye gnas thams cad kyi thams cad du nyams par gyur pa de dang 'dra bar tshor ba dag kyang yin no //
translated: Like a drum, it is like the sound of a drum, which is initially loud and then gradually becomes quieter, in the same way, all feelings are destroyed.

original: gzung bar dka' ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dag las bdag nyid rnyog pa med par gzung ba nyid du dka' bas nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung bar dka' ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dag las bdag nyid rnyog pa med par gzung ba nyid du dka' bas nus pa yin no //
translated: It is difficult to grasp, because it is difficult to grasp the self as being free from afflictions.

original: slu bar bgyid na zhes bya ba ni bgrod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: slu bar bgyid na zhes bya ba ni bgrod par byed pa yin no //
translated: It deceives, because it causes one to proceed.

original: 'phyon ma pa ni byi po par rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phyon ma pa ni byi po par rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: A paramour is well known as a lover.

original: nal gyi bu ni byi bo pa'i bur grags pa yin no //
analyzed: nal gyi bu ni byi bo pa'i bur grags pa yin no //
translated: A paramour’s son is known as the son of a paramour.

original: yang na thams cad du byi po ba la dva'i sgra dang 'jug pa yongs su mi shes pa la nal gyi bur brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na thams cad du byi po ba la dva'i sgra dang 'jug pa yongs su mi shes pa la nal gyi bur brjod pa yin no //
translated: Or, in all cases, the term “paramour” is used for a lover, and the term “paramour’s son” is used for one who is not fully known.

original: bde ba chud la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bde ba chud la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the line “it destroys happiness,”

original: bde ba ni 'dir yid bde ba'i bde ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba ni 'dir yid bde ba'i bde ba yin no //
translated: Happiness here is the happiness of mental satisfaction.

original: sdug bsngal ni tshe 'di nyid kyi yid mi bde ba'i sdug bsngal yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni tshe 'di nyid kyi yid mi bde ba'i sdug bsngal yin no //
translated: Suffering is the suffering of mental dissatisfaction in this very life.

original: nyes dmigs ni dmyal pa la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: nyes dmigs ni dmyal pa la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: Misery is the experience of suffering in the realms of hell and so on.

original: mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not right means it is not reasonable.

original: 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga bsten par 'dod pa dang longs spyod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga bsten par 'dod pa dang longs spyod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is the desire to enjoy and the desire to rely on the five sense objects.

original: kun du sbyor ba dag 'phel bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba dag 'phel bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The fetters increase means they expand.

original: gtong ba ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba ni ldog pa'o //
translated: Giving up means turning away from them.

original: ngoms pa ni yid mgu bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ngoms pa ni yid mgu bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Satisfaction means being pleased with them.

original: mthar thug par 'gro bas na chog pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro bas na chog pa'o //
translated: Enough means going to the end of them.

original: sdig pa'i las ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa la @147a * //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa la @147a * //
translated: Evil actions are the misdeeds of body and so on.

original: sogs pa'o // nyan thos pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad po'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'o // nyan thos pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad po'o //
translated: The Hearers are the eight noble persons.

original: dam pa dag ces bya ba ni drang srong chen po'o //
analyzed: dam pa dag ces bya ba ni drang srong chen po'o //
translated: The holy ones are the great sages.

original: yang dag par song ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dag go //
analyzed: yang dag par song ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dag go //
translated: “Those who have gone correctly” are the bodhisattvas.

original: skyes bu dam pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo dge ba dag go //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo dge ba dag go //
translated: “The holy men” are the ordinary persons who are virtuous.

original: dad pa'i shugs kyis lus kyi spu gyen du ldang bar gyur pas na ba spu ldang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i shugs kyis lus kyi spu gyen du ldang bar gyur pas na ba spu ldang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Their body hair stands on end” means that their body hair stands on end through the force of their faith.

original: chu 'gram gyi gad pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe klung gi ngogs go rims bzhin du dum bu dum bur chad cing rdib par gyur pa de bzhin du de dag gis bstan pa nyams par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chu 'gram gyi gad pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe klung gi ngogs go rims bzhin du dum bu dum bur chad cing rdib par gyur pa de bzhin du de dag gis bstan pa nyams par byed pa yin te /
translated: “Like the bank of a river” means that just as the bank of a river is gradually cut away and collapses, in the same way, they cause the teaching to collapse.

original: bstan pa dang 'gal bar bya ba ma yin pa yang lhag par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa dang 'gal bar bya ba ma yin pa yang lhag par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they act in a way that is contrary to the teaching, and they do not act in a way that is in accordance with it.

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni mi tshangs par spyod pa'i pham par gyur pa gcod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni mi tshangs par spyod pa'i pham par gyur pa gcod par byed pa yin no //
translated: “They commit a serious offense” means that they commit a pārājika offense of sexual misconduct.

original: bsod snyoms spyod pa'i gnas la 'dir spyod yul du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms spyod pa'i gnas la 'dir spyod yul du shes par bya'o //
translated: “The practice of going for alms” should be understood here as the domain of activity.

original: bstan bcos gyi don yongs su shes pa'i nus pa med pas na glen pa yin la /
analyzed: bstan bcos gyi don yongs su shes pa'i nus pa med pas na glen pa yin la /
translated: They are fools because they are incapable of understanding the meaning of the treatise.

original: lhag par che bas na rab tu glen pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag par che bas na rab tu glen pa yin no //
translated: They are great fools because they are the worst.

original: yi ge'i sgo nas 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pas na rmongs pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge'i sgo nas 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pas na rmongs pa yin no //
translated: They are confused because they are incapable of grasping the words.

original: lhag par che ba ni mchog tu rmongs pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag par che ba ni mchog tu rmongs pa yin no //
translated: They are greatly confused because they are the worst.

original: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni ched ma dag pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni ched ma dag pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Reasoning is the pursuit of the pure meaning.

original: grol ba zhes bya ba ni chags pa med pa dang nyams pa med pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: grol ba zhes bya ba ni chags pa med pa dang nyams pa med pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Liberation is a term for nonattachment and nondeficiency.

original: bshad par brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar bkod pa'am /
analyzed: bshad par brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar bkod pa'am /
translated: The phrase “I will explain” is a statement of intent.

original: skabs kyis rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs kyis rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “in due course” is an explanation of the context.

original: lus 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pa skyed pa ni brgyal ba yin no //
analyzed: lus 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pa skyed pa ni brgyal ba yin no //
translated: Fainting is the loss of the ability to hold up one’s body.

original: dge slong dag nyi ma ni shar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽shar bar byed pa'i phyir shar ba ste //
analyzed: dge slong dag nyi ma ni shar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / shar bar byed pa'i phyir shar ba ste //
translated: “Bhikṣus, the sun has risen” and so on.🔽It is rising because it causes the rising of the sun.

original: mtshan mos byas pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan mos byas pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is rising because it causes the rising of the sun.🔽It is rising because it causes the rising of the sun.

original: bya rog ni zer zhes bya ba ni sgra 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya rog ni zer zhes bya ba ni sgra 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: “Cawing” means making a sound.

original: zhing rmod pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon 'debs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhing rmod pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon 'debs par byed pa'o //
translated: “Plowing” means planting seeds.

original: du ba zhes bya ba ni smre sngags 'don pa 'am du bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: du ba zhes bya ba ni smre sngags 'don pa 'am du bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Smoke” means lamenting or smoking.

original: ma lus par 'phrog par byed pa gang dag yin pa de ni mi rgod pa yin no //
analyzed: ma lus par 'phrog par byed pa gang dag yin pa de ni mi rgod pa yin no //
translated: “Robbers” are those who steal everything.

original: nye ma zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lhag pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: nye ma zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lhag pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: “Sun” is a synonym for the Tathāgata.

original: nyi ma'i dpes de bzhin gshegs pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dpes de bzhin gshegs pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the Tathāgata is indicated by the example of the sun.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi snang bas mi shes pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir yang 'dir @147b mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi snang bas mi shes pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir yang 'dir @147b mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the light of the Tathāgata’s wisdom dispels the darkness of nescience, he is like the sun.

original: bya rog zer ba zhes bya bas ni chos kyi snod can bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bya rog zer ba zhes bya bas ni chos kyi snod can bstan pa yin te /
translated: “Cawing” indicates a vessel of the Dharma.

original: dper na nyi ma shar bar gyur pa na bya rog zer ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma shar bar gyur ba na bcom ldan 'das kyis thog mar chos bstan nas zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas chos kyi snod can chos smra bar 'gyur
analyzed: dper na nyi ma shar bar gyur pa na bya rog zer ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma shar bar gyur ba na bcom ldan 'das kyis thog mar chos bstan nas zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas chos kyi snod can chos smra bar 'gyur
translated: For example, when the sun rises, crows caw. In the same way, when the sun of the Tathagata rises, the Blessed One first teaches the Dharma to those who are vessels of the Dharma and become Dharma teachers.

original: ro // zhing pa smos pas ni gtong ba po dang sbyin bdag bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ro // zhing pa smos pas ni gtong ba po dang sbyin bdag bstan pa yin te /
translated: By mentioning farmers, those who give and benefactors are indicated.

original: dper na zhing pas ni zhing bsgrubs nas sa bon 'debs par byed pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas byung bar gyur pa na gtong ba po dang sbyin bdag dag gis sbyin gnas kyi zhing bsgrubs nas sbyin ba'i sa bon gyi char 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na zhing pas ni zhing bsgrubs nas sa bon 'debs par byed pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas byung bar gyur pa na gtong ba po dang sbyin bdag dag gis sbyin gnas kyi zhing bsgrubs nas sbyin ba'i sa bon gyi char 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, farmers cultivate fields and plant seeds. In the same way, when a Buddha appears, those who give and benefactors cultivate the field of those worthy of gifts and plant the seeds of giving.

original: mi rgod smos pas ni bdud dang bdud kyi 'khor bstan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi rgod smos pas ni bdud dang bdud kyi 'khor bstan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: By mentioning bandits, the demons and the retinue of demons should be understood.

original: dper na nyin par mi rgod dag mngon par 'dod pa'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir du bar byed pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung bar gyur pa na bdud kyi spyod yul skye bo chen po mngon par 'das pa'i phyir bdud dang bdud kyi 'khor🔽kun nas du bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na nyin par mi rgod dag mngon par 'dod pa'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir du bar byed pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung bar gyur pa na bdud kyi spyod yul skye bo chen po mngon par 'das pa'i phyir bdud dang bdud kyi 'khor kun nas du bar byed pa yin no //
translated: For example, just as bandits make a fire in order to accomplish their desired goal of killing people during the day, in the same way, when the Bhagavān appears in the world, he makes Māra and his retinue🔽burn with remorse because he causes the great multitude of Māra’s domain to transcend.

original: phyin ci ma log par rjes su ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir ston pa yin la /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par rjes su ston par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir ston pa yin la /

original: ston pa des bya ba gang yin pa gdon mi za bar mdzad pa bya ba de ni bya ba yin zhing /
analyzed: ston pa des bya ba gang yin pa gdon mi za bar mdzad pa bya ba de ni bya ba yin zhing /

original: byas pa yang bden ba bzhi bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: byas pa yang bden ba bzhi bstan pa yin te /
translated: He has done that action, and he has also taught the four noble truths.

original: ngas khyed rnams te khyed cag la bya ba de byas pa pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ngas khyed rnams te khyed cag la bya ba de byas pa pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: ston pa khyad par ji lta bus she na rjes su brtse ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ston pa khyad par ji lta bus she na rjes su brtse ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /

analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong ba na rjes su ste phyis brtse bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su brtse ba can te /

analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bzod par mi spyod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: da ni khyed cag gis zhes bya ba 'dis @148a * //
translated: Now, you should🔽

analyzed: ni 'di skad du 'di ltar ngas 'ga' zhig la mchog gsal ba'i sgo nas phan gdags par mdzad pa'i nus pa mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: This indicates the following: “In this way, I do not have the ability to benefit anyone by revealing the supreme.

translated: Just as I do not have the ability, so also the world with its gods does not have the ability to bestow the supreme. Therefore, you should abandon your own faults and cultivate good qualities.

original: ri'i phrag ni lung pa'o //
analyzed: ri'i phrag ni lung pa'o //
translated: A mountain pass is a valley.

original: phug ni khyim gyi rnam pa can skyes bu'i 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med par grub pa'o //
analyzed: phug ni khyim gyi rnam pa can skyes bu'i 'bad rtsol la ltos pa med par grub pa'o //
translated: A cave is a structure that resembles a house and is established without regard to human effort.

original: sog ma'i tshogs ni sog ma'i phung po yin no //
analyzed: sog ma'i tshogs ni sog ma'i phung po yin no //
translated: A bundle of straw is a pile of straw.

original: bag med pa zhes bya ba ni bag med par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa zhes bya ba ni bag med par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: “Do not be heedless” means do not be heedless.

original: phyis zhes bya ba ni nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: phyis zhes bya ba ni nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
translated: “Later” means after I have passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: bzhugs gdan gyi tha ma brnyes par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: bzhugs gdan gyi tha ma brnyes par gyur pa na'o //
translated: when he has attained the last of the seats.

original: 'di ni nga'i rjes su bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni nga'i gdams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i rjes su bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni nga'i gdams pa'o //
translated: This is my instruction, my advice.

original: mtsho ni klung yin la skyed mos tshal ni me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing dang ldan pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: mtsho ni klung yin la skyed mos tshal ni me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing dang ldan pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: A lake is a river, and a park is a place with flowering and fruit-bearing trees.

original: 'bab chu ni 'brug pa'i chu'o //
analyzed: 'bab chu ni 'brug pa'i chu'o //
translated: A waterfall is a cascading stream.

original: chu bo dang shing la sogs pa de dag gis brgyan pa'i sa'i steng ste sa phyogs so //
analyzed: chu bo dang shing la sogs pa de dag gis brgyan pa'i sa'i steng ste sa phyogs so //
translated: The ground, the place, is adorned with those rivers, trees, etc.

original: dga' ba'i zhes bya ba ni dga' ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i zhes bya ba ni dga' ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Delightful means producing delight.

original: bud med dang mthun pa ni bud med kyi yid la byed pa skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bud med dang mthun pa ni bud med kyi yid la byed pa skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: In conformity with women means in conformity with the arising of the mental orientation of a woman.

original: bud med du ston par byed pa ni bud med kyi dbang pos byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
analyzed: bud med du ston par byed pa ni bud med kyi dbang pos byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
translated: The display of a woman is the consecration by the female organ.

original: des bud med kyi dngos por rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bud med kyi dngos por rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, the state of a woman is made manifest.

original: longs spyod zad pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba la sogs pa nye bar longs spyad par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su zad pa'am /
analyzed: longs spyod zad pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba la sogs pa nye bar longs spyad par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su zad pa'am /
translated: The exhaustion of resources is the complete exhaustion of things to be used, such as food.

original: grong la sogs pa yongs su zad pa'o //
analyzed: grong la sogs pa yongs su zad pa'o //
translated: The phrase “exhaustion of resources” means the exhaustion of things to be used, such as food, or the exhaustion of a village, etc.

original: skye bo kun gyis yongs su shes par gyur pa ni grags par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo kun gyis yongs su shes par gyur pa ni grags par gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase “known to all” means well known.

original: 'bad pa med par gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa rnyed pa'i phyir bsod snyoms chen po'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa med par gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa rnyed pa'i phyir bsod snyoms chen po'o //
translated: The phrase “great alms” means that robes, alms, bedding, seats, medicine for curing the ill, and other personal belongings are obtained without difficulty.

original: bza' ba dka' bas rnyed pa'i phyir mu ge'i dus yin no //
analyzed: bza' ba dka' bas rnyed pa'i phyir mu ge'i dus yin no //
translated: The phrase “time of famine” means that food is difficult to obtain.

original: glo bur pa zhes bya ba ni ma bsams par 'phral la 'byung ba yin no ;🔽/ bzhag pa zhes bya ba ni snga dro'i dus su zas tsam byin len byas nas nyi ma phyed las 'das pa'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: glo bur pa zhes bya ba ni ma bsams par 'phral la 'byung ba yin no ; / bzhag pa zhes bya ba ni snga dro'i dus su zas tsam byin len byas nas nyi ma phyed las 'das pa'i phyir yin te /
translated: The phrase “unexpected” means that it occurs suddenly, without prior thought.🔽The phrase “set aside” means that one has accepted food at the proper time, but it is past noon.

original: de la byin len byas nas dro las 'das par gyur pa ni bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la byin len byas nas dro las 'das par gyur pa ni bzhag pa yin no //
translated: The food that has been accepted is set aside because it is past noon.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i bar chad ni gle 'dams pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i bar chad ni gle 'dams pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “uncommon obstacles” refers to indigestion, etc.

original: dge slong ma bar du zhog la @148b zhes bya ba ni las byed pas dge slong ma la dri bar byas shing /
analyzed: dge slong ma bar du zhog la @148b zhes bya ba ni las byed pas dge slong ma la dri bar byas shing /
translated: The phrase up to the point of being a fully ordained nun means that the one who is performing the rite should ask the questions of the fully ordained nun.

original: dge slong mas bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa la dri bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong mas bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa la dri bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The fully ordained nun should ask the questions of the one who desires full ordination.

original: khrag ni zla mtshan gyi dus kyi khrag yin no //
analyzed: khrag ni zla mtshan gyi dus kyi khrag yin no //
translated: Blood refers to menstrual blood.

original: ji lta bu'am de lta bus zhes bya ba ni thabs gang gis sam de yis so //
analyzed: ji lta bu'am de lta bus zhes bya ba ni thabs gang gis sam de yis so //
translated: The phrase in whatever way means by whatever means.

original: dge slong gi mal stan gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba ni gang dge slong las bstabs pa de dag las lhag mar gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi mal stan gyi lhag ma zhes bya ba ni gang dge slong las bstabs pa de dag las lhag mar gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase the remainder of the bedding of the fully ordained monks refers to what remains of the bedding that was assigned to the fully ordained monks.

original: rim bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis gzhol ba dang / 'gro ba med par ro //
analyzed: rim bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis gzhol ba dang / 'gro ba med par ro //
translated: The phrase in the proper order means in a gradual manner, without skipping any.

original: the tshom dgrol ba tsam du zhes bya ba ni the tshom zlog pa la 'jug pa'am yang na khong du chud pa tsam gyi phyir te /
analyzed: the tshom dgrol ba tsam du zhes bya ba ni the tshom zlog pa la 'jug pa'am yang na khong du chud pa tsam gyi phyir te /
translated: The phrase merely to resolve doubts means to engage in the process of resolving doubts or to gain understanding.

original: khong du chung pa ni go ba yin te /
analyzed: khong du chung pa ni go ba yin te /
translated: The term understanding means to comprehend.

original: yongs su shes pa'i rgyus 'dri bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i rgyus 'dri bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to “because of the cause of complete knowledge, one asks.

original: rked chings zhes bya ba ni thams cad du glo bcing bar bya ba'i don gyi gos la sogs pa kho na la rked chings su bstan pa yin no //🔽brang chings zhes bya ba ni nu ma la lhod pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur bar sgrub par byed pa nu ma bcing ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i chings ma thams cad la brang chings nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rked chings zhes bya ba ni thams cad du glo bcing bar bya ba'i don gyi gos la sogs pa kho na la rked chings su bstan pa yin no // brang chings zhes bya ba ni nu ma la lhod pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur bar sgrub par byed pa nu ma bcing ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i chings ma thams cad la brang chings nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: A belt is a cloth, etc. that is taught as a belt for the purpose of binding all around.🔽A breast-band is a cloth that is called a breast-band for the purpose of binding the breasts so that they do not become loose.

original: mdzes gyur gyi bar chad ces bya ba ni nu ma phan tshun mi 'byar bar bya ba'i don du gos las byas pa'i bar chad ni mdzes gyur gyi bar chad yin te /
analyzed: mdzes gyur gyi bar chad ces bya ba ni nu ma phan tshun mi 'byar bar bya ba'i don du gos las byas pa'i bar chad ni mdzes gyur gyi bar chad yin te /
translated: A breast-protector is a cloth that is called a breast-protector for the purpose of preventing the breasts from touching each other.

original: de'i nu ma dag mdzes pa'i gnas skabs sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i nu ma dag mdzes pa'i gnas skabs sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, they achieve a beautiful condition.

original: mi gtsang ba 'dzag cing 'byung ba'i sa phyogs ni ljan ljin no //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba 'dzag cing 'byung ba'i sa phyogs ni ljan ljin no //
translated: Filth is a place where impure substances flow out and appear.

original: mi dga' bar gyur pa ni 'dir co 'dri ba'am /
analyzed: mi dga' bar gyur pa ni 'dir co 'dri ba'am /
translated: Disgusting is a place where one is disgusted, or

original: gdung ba skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gdung ba skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is what causes distress.

original: mtshan bzangs ma zhes bya ba ni bud med dag la snyan pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: mtshan bzangs ma zhes bya ba ni bud med dag la snyan pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The term beautiful woman is a term of endearment for women.

original: dpal gyis mtshan pa'i mdzes pa'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de ni 'dir mtshan bzangs ma'o //
analyzed: dpal gyis mtshan pa'i mdzes pa'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de ni 'dir mtshan bzangs ma'o //
translated: One who has the characteristics of a beautiful woman who is marked with glory is a beautiful woman in this context.

original: kye mtshan bzangs ma zhes bya ba de ni bod pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: kye mtshan bzangs ma zhes bya ba de ni bod pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The term O beautiful woman is a term of endearment.

original: bdag mi dga' bas gzir ba zhes bya ba de ni kho mo sems skyo bas gzir bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bdag mi dga' bas gzir ba zhes bya ba de ni kho mo sems skyo bas gzir bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase I am afflicted by sorrow means I am afflicted by mental distress.

original: lhung bzed chen po ni lhung bzed tshad chen po'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed chen po ni lhung bzed tshad chen po'o //
translated: A large begging bowl is a begging bowl of a large size.

original: brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du bsdigs pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du bsdigs pa'o //
translated: The term eighth means in the presence of.

original: smad pa zhes bya ba ni smod pa yin no //
analyzed: smad pa zhes bya ba ni smod pa yin no //
translated: The term blame means blameworthy.

original: dge slong ma mi srun pa khyed kyi zhes bya ba ni khyed cag las gzhan dag gis tshul ma yin pa'i las byas pa de'i phyir khyed cag kun gyi mthong ba kho na zhes bya ba de lta bu yid la byas nas tshig rjod pa yin no //🔽bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rnam pa 'ga' @149a * //
analyzed: dge slong ma mi srun pa khyed kyi zhes bya ba ni khyed cag las gzhan dag gis tshul ma yin pa'i las byas pa de'i phyir khyed cag kun gyi mthong ba kho na zhes bya ba de lta bu yid la byas nas tshig rjod pa yin no // bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rnam pa 'ga' @149a * //
translated: The phrase you who are unruly nuns means that you have done this improper act, and therefore, you are all seen in this way.

original: zhig gis de skyed par gyur ces bya ba'i dngos po de bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: zhig gis de skyed par gyur ces bya ba'i dngos po de bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
translated: The phrase inconceivable means that the entity that is produced in some way is inconceivable.

original: las kyi nus pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi nus pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the power of karma is various.

original: slob dpon tshul khrims bskyangs kyis nye bar sbyar ba phran tshegs kyi tshig gi rnam par bshad pa ste sgo drug pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon tshul khrims bskyangs kyis nye bar sbyar ba phran tshegs kyi tshig gi rnam par bshad pa ste sgo drug pa rdzogs so /
