original: reg pa bdag gir byed pa ni ji ltar lus kyi kun nas reg pa'i bya ba bstan pa de ni 'dir yang bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa bdag gir byed pa ni ji ltar lus kyi kun nas reg pa'i bya ba bstan pa de ni 'dir yang bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Taking possession of the touch means that here also the act of physical contact should be understood as the act that was explained.

original: gnod par gyur pa la sbyin pa rjes su gnang ba'i gos ni sham thabs kyi gzan yin no //
analyzed: gnod par gyur pa la sbyin pa rjes su gnang ba'i gos ni sham thabs kyi gzan yin no //
translated: The cloth that is permitted to be given to those who are afflicted is the cloth for the sick.

original: dran pa nye bar zhog la zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gtso bor gyur pa'i dran pa mngon sum du byas pas so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar zhog la zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gtso bor gyur pa'i dran pa mngon sum du byas pas so //
translated: The phrase being mindful means that one should be mindful of the present moment, which is to say, one should be mindful of the present moment in a manner that is governed by proper attention.

original: bud med sdug pa dang bral ba dag lag pa gnyis kyis rang gi dpung pa'i rtsa ba la snun par byed pa ni brang rdung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bud med sdug pa dang bral ba dag lag pa gnyis kyis rang gi dpung pa'i rtsa ba la snun par byed pa ni brang rdung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase beating one's breast means that one beats the root of one's arm with both hands.

original: skyed mos tshal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase a pleasure grove, and so on, is as follows.

original: me tog la sogs pa'i shing gis nye bar mtshan pa ni skyed mos tshal yin no //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa'i shing gis nye bar mtshan pa ni skyed mos tshal yin no //
translated: A pleasure grove is a place that is marked by trees that bear flowers and fruit.

original: drang srong gi gnas ni dka' thub kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: drang srong gi gnas ni dka' thub kyi gnas yin no //
translated: A hermitage is a place where ascetics practice their austerities.

original: grong khyer las phyi rol gyi nyen kor gyis ni nyen kor yin no //
analyzed: grong khyer las phyi rol gyi nyen kor gyis ni nyen kor yin no //
translated: A park is a place that is located outside of a city and is used for recreation.

original: ston zla 'bring po nya'i dus ston chen po ni dga' ston du rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: ston zla 'bring po nya'i dus ston chen po ni dga' ston du rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: The great festival of the full moon of the month of Kārttika is well known as the Festival of Lights.

original: de dang 'dra pa'i dus ni dus ma yin pa'i dus ston no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra pa'i dus ni dus ma yin pa'i dus ston no //
translated: A time like that is an untimely festival.

original: sngon gyi legs par spyad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sngon gyi legs par spyad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the verse beginning “Your good conduct in the past,”

original: khyed kyi skye ba snga ma la legs par spyad pa ste /
analyzed: khyed kyi skye ba snga ma la legs par spyad pa ste /
translated: your good conduct in previous lives

original: las byas shing bsags pa gang yin pa de nyid bsod nams kyi las kyi tshogs sdug par byed cing dga' ston 'di'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: las byas shing bsags pa gang yin pa de nyid bsod nams kyi las kyi tshogs sdug par byed cing dga' ston 'di'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //
translated: is the accumulation of meritorious karma that is the cause of this festival of joy.

original: gnas ma @151a * //
analyzed: gnas ma @151a * //
translated: It is not a place

original: yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is not here.

original: 'dod pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of the enjoyment of desire because it is the abandonment of the afflictions.🔽It is the enjoyment of what is near

original: nye bar yongs su longs spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byas nas yongs su longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar yongs su longs spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byas nas yongs su longs spyod pa'o //
translated: because it is the enjoyment of what is made one’s own.🔽It is the accomplishment of miracles

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po rno ba de nyid kyi phyir de'i rdzu 'phrul bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po rno ba de nyid kyi phyir de'i rdzu 'phrul bskyed pa yin te /
translated: because it is the generation of miracles by those with sharp faculties.

original: des ni 'di skad du thams cad du phyir mi 'ong ba'i rdzu 'phrul bskyed pa nyid du rung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du thams cad du phyir mi 'ong ba'i rdzu 'phrul bskyed pa nyid du rung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows that it is suitable for him to generate the supernormal powers of a non-returner everywhere.

original: yang dag par byung ba zhes bya ba ni shugs kyis rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas khams gsum las byung ba yin no ;
analyzed: yang dag par byung ba zhes bya ba ni shugs kyis rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas khams gsum las byung ba yin no ;
translated: “Having emerged” means that by the force of attaining the vajra-like concentration, he has emerged from the three realms.

original: / rnyed pa ni nges khams gsum po'i gnyen po thob pa'o //
analyzed: / rnyed pa ni nges khams gsum po'i gnyen po thob pa'o //
translated: “Having attained” means that he has attained the antidote to the three realms.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir brnyes pa yin no //
translated: He has attained his own aim.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir rnyed pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir rnyed pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: He has attained the attainment of the aim of others.

original: rus pa'i 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du 'brel pa'i rus pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: rus pa'i 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du 'brel pa'i rus pa'i tshogs so //
translated: “The machine of bones” is the collection of bones that are connected to each other.

original: rgyan med pa zhes bya ba ni nang ga mdzes pa'i dngos po dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan med pa zhes bya ba ni nang ga mdzes pa'i dngos po dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Without adornment” means that he is devoid of the things that beautify the inside.

original: sems zlogs shig ces bya ba ni 'dod chags dang kun nas 'brel pa'i sems yongs su spongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: sems zlogs shig ces bya ba ni 'dod chags dang kun nas 'brel pa'i sems yongs su spongs shig pa'o //
translated: “Turn back the mind” means to completely abandon the mind that is connected with desire.

original: sems can dmyal bar ltung bar gyur ta re zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i yul la zhe sdang gi sems bskyed pa las sems can dmyal ba zhig tu ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar ltung bar gyur ta re zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i yul la zhe sdang gi sems bskyed pa las sems can dmyal ba zhig tu ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: You will fall into the hells means that by giving rise to an attitude of hatred towards the objects of the ordained, one will fall into a certain hell.

original: khyim pa'i las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: khyim pa'i las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the work of householders, etc.,

original: khyim pa'i las khyod kyis thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su spangs nas so //
analyzed: khyim pa'i las khyod kyis thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su spangs nas so //
translated: it means that you have completely abandoned all the work of householders.

original: khyod kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang khas blangs pa 'di ltar kun nas chags pa'i sems kyis skyed pa la lta ba la sogs pa soms shig pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang khas blangs pa 'di ltar kun nas chags pa'i sems kyis skyed pa la lta ba la sogs pa soms shig pa'o //
translated: You have taken up the full ordination and made the vow, I will give rise to the view, etc., with an attitude of complete attachment.

original: cung zad 'bab pa ni char 'phral du 'bab par 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: cung zad 'bab pa ni char 'phral du 'bab par 'dod pa'am /
translated: A little rain is rain that falls suddenly, or it is called a little rain because it falls a little at a time.🔽A storm is a wind that blows with a great roar.🔽 A rough wind is a wind that blows with a rough sound.🔽 A violent wind is a wind that blows violently.🔽 A wind that blows in all directions is a wind that blows in all directions.

original: cung zad cung zad bab pa'i phyir cung zad 'bab pa'o //🔽mi bsrun pa zhes bya ba ni nor byed pa med pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //🔽g-yul 'gyed pa la brtson pa ni gyad yin la /
analyzed: cung zad cung zad bab pa'i phyir cung zad 'bab pa'o // mi bsrun pa zhes bya ba ni nor byed pa med pa'i ngang tshul can yin no // g-yul 'gyed pa la brtson pa ni gyad yin la /
translated: A wind that blows in one direction is a wind that blows in one direction.🔽 A wind that blows in all directions and in one direction is a wind that blows in all directions and in one direction.🔽 A wind that blows in all directions and in one direction is a wind that blows in all directions and in one direction.🔽 A wind that blows in all directions and in one direction is a wind that blows in all directions and in one direction.🔽 A wind that blows in all directions and in one direction is a wind that blows in all directions and in one direction.🔽 A wind that blows in all directions and in one direction is a wind that blows in all directions and in one direction.🔽 A wind that blows in all directions and in one direction is a wind that blows in all directions and in one direction.🔽 A wind that blows in all directions and in one direction is a wind that blows in all directions and in one direction.🔽 A wind that blows in all directions and in one direction is a wind that blows in all directions and in one direction.🔽 A wind that blows in all directions and in one direction is a wind that blows in all directions and in one direction.

original: ras gcig bcings pas na gyad par go cha bgos pa'o //
analyzed: ras gcig bcings pas na gyad par go cha bgos pa'o //
translated: A wind that blows in all directions and in one direction is a wind that blows in all directions and in one direction.🔽 A

original: gyad chen po zhes bya ba ni gzhung gzhan yin te /
analyzed: gyad chen po zhes bya ba ni gzhung gzhan yin te /
translated: The great wrestler is another text.

original: chen po ni yan lag shin tu rgyas pa dang / lus che ba yin no //
analyzed: chen po ni yan lag shin tu rgyas pa dang / lus che ba yin no //
translated: The great one has very extensive limbs and a large body.

original: rdo leb kyis zhes bya ba ni rdo'i dum bus so //
analyzed: rdo leb kyis zhes bya ba ni rdo'i dum bus so //
translated: The stone slab is a piece of stone.

original: gos gcus pas zhes bya ba ni gos bsgril bas so //
analyzed: gos gcus pas zhes bya ba ni gos bsgril bas so //
translated: The folded cloth is a rolled up cloth.

original: slob dpon tshul khrims bskyangs kyis nye bar sbyar ba phran @151b tshegs kyi tshig gi rnam par bshad pa ste sgo bdun pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon tshul khrims bskyangs kyis nye bar sbyar ba phran @151b tshegs kyi tshig gi rnam par bshad pa ste sgo bdun pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the seven door commentary on the Kṣudraka Collection composed by Master Śīlapālita.

original: // / mchod rten ni rus pa bzhag pa'i don gyis 'jim pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: // / mchod rten ni rus pa bzhag pa'i don gyis 'jim pa'i phung po'o //
translated: A stūpa is a heap of clay for the purpose of placing relics.

original: rang bzhin yongs su nyams pas zhes bya ba ni skye bo dam pa'i rang bzhin las lhung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su nyams pas zhes bya ba ni skye bo dam pa'i rang bzhin las lhung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: By the degeneration of their nature means they have fallen from the nature of holy beings.

original: sbyar ma byin gyis brlabs par zhes bya ba ni mtshon gyis kun nas bsnun du mi rung bar snyoms par 'jug par byas pa'o //
analyzed: sbyar ma byin gyis brlabs par zhes bya ba ni mtshon gyis kun nas bsnun du mi rung bar snyoms par 'jug par byas pa'o //
translated: By consecrating the weapon means they enter meditative absorption so that they cannot be struck by weapons.

original: nang dang bcas par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni 'khon par gyur pas so //
analyzed: nang dang bcas par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni 'khon par gyur pas so //
translated: By becoming internal means they become hostile.

original: de la ma bltas par zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma lus 'dud pa'i lus bor nas so //
analyzed: de la ma bltas par zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma lus 'dud pa'i lus bor nas so //
translated: As for without looking at her, it means after the monk has abandoned the body of the nun who bows down.

original: gzu bo byed pa zhes bya ba ni drang por byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzu bo byed pa zhes bya ba ni drang por byed pa'o //
translated: As for acting straightforwardly, it means acting honestly.

original: dgag dbye la gso sbyong yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dgag dbye byas nas gso sbyong bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgag dbye la gso sbyong yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dgag dbye byas nas gso sbyong bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: As for there is no poṣadha in the pravāraṇa, it means that after the pravāraṇa has been performed, poṣadha should not be performed.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ltung ba'i dri ma rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ltung ba'i dri ma rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As for because of being pure, it means because of purifying the stains of downfalls.

original: sems gtong ba zhes bya ba la gtod pa ni 'dir kho na yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems gtong ba zhes bya ba la gtod pa ni 'dir kho na yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: As for giving up the mind, giving up here means completely abandoning.

original: glags pa ni glags sam dral ba'am phug par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: glags pa ni glags sam dral ba'am phug par gyur pa'o //
translated: As for opening, it means opening, or splitting, or piercing.

original: shad kyis sbyong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni dbang du byed pa la 'jug par byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: shad kyis sbyong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni dbang du byed pa la 'jug par byed pa po yin no //
translated: As for applying with a knife, it means engaging in bringing under one's power.

original: kho bo phyogs de nyan par yang mi 'dod na zhes bya ba ni kho bo phyogs de sngar mthong ba nyid kyi sgo nas mthong ba nyid myong bar yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo phyogs de nyan par yang mi 'dod na zhes bya ba ni kho bo phyogs de sngar mthong ba nyid kyi sgo nas mthong ba nyid myong bar yang mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not even want to hear about that position.

original: mthar thug pa zhes bya ba la tha mar gyur pa'am mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: mthar thug pa zhes bya ba la tha mar gyur pa'am mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The final stage is the last stage or the final stage.

original: tha mar gdon mi za bar 'di ltar 'gyur ro zhes nges pa'i sgo nas shes par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba mang du byas pa'i phyir ma chags pa la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: tha mar gdon mi za bar 'di ltar 'gyur ro zhes nges pa'i sgo nas shes par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba mang du byas pa'i phyir ma chags pa la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa yin la /
translated: The meaning is that it is known through the certainty that it will definitely be like this in the end.🔽Because nonvirtuous roots such as attachment are frequently engaged, nonattachment and so on are abandoned.

original: chags pa med pa la sogs pa mang du byas pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa med pa la sogs pa mang du byas pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: Because nonattachment and so on are frequently engaged, attachment and so on are abandoned.

original: phan tshun dga' zhes bya ba ni mdza' ba'i tshig brjod pa sngon du song ba'i sgo nas sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun dga' zhes bya ba ni mdza' ba'i tshig brjod pa sngon du song ba'i sgo nas sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Mutual delight is the establishment of a relationship through the prior expression of endearment.

original: gtsug phud 'breg pa'i dus ston zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyi ma gang la byang chub sems dpas dbu skra bregs te steng gi nam mkha' la bor ba dang / brgya byin gyis blangs nas mtho ris kyi gnas su bzhag par gyur pa'i nyi ma de la dad pa dang bram ze dang khyim bdag gis dus ston byas pa de la gtsug phud bregs pa'i dus ston du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gtsug phud 'breg pa'i dus ston zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyi ma gang la byang chub sems dpas dbu skra bregs te steng gi nam mkha' la bor ba dang / brgya byin gyis blangs nas mtho ris kyi gnas su bzhag par gyur pa'i nyi ma de la dad pa dang bram ze dang khyim bdag gis dus ston byas pa de la gtsug phud bregs pa'i dus ston du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: On the day when the Bodhisattva had his hair cut, and when it was thrown into the sky and taken up by Indra, who placed it in his celestial abode, the faithful, the Brahmins and the householders celebrated a festival which was called the festival of the tonsure.

original: @152a * // byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas lo lnga pa las byung ba'i lnga ston no //
analyzed: @152a * // byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas lo lnga pa las byung ba'i lnga ston no //
translated: The Bodhisattva left his home at the age of twenty-nine years.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes par gyur pa ni dus ston chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes par gyur pa ni dus ston chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of the knowledge of the Omniscient One is called the Great Festival.

original: sred pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sred pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The festival of craving.

original: sred pa ni sems kyi zhen pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa ni sems kyi zhen pa'o //
translated: Craving is the attachment of the mind.

original: gnyis sam gsum zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i gnas brtan dag go //
analyzed: gnyis sam gsum zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i gnas brtan dag go //
translated: Two or three, i.e., the elders of the Bhikshunis.

original: 'khor dang mdza' po ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la 'khor gyi rnam par dbyed pa dang / smos 'drin la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor dang mdza' po ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la 'khor gyi rnam par dbyed pa dang / smos 'drin la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: The analysis of the retinue and the analysis of the acquaintances, etc.

original: gang gi 'khor yin pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa des phyogs gcig tu 'khor cing 'khor med na ni smos 'drin la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang gi 'khor yin pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa des phyogs gcig tu 'khor cing 'khor med na ni smos 'drin la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: If one has a retinue, then one is together with the retinue. If one does not have a retinue, then one is together with the acquaintances, etc.🔽Just as in the analysis of the downfalls, the third of the ten is begun, and the agreement with the teacher of the nuns is just like that.

original: ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa las ltung byed rnams kyi bcu tshun gsum pa brtsams pa na dge slong ma'i ston pa'i blo mthun byas pa de kho na bzhin 'dir yang yin pas 'dir gzhung mngas pa'i 'jigs pas spros nas ma bris so //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa las ltung byed rnams kyi bcu tshun gsum pa brtsams pa na dge slong ma'i ston pa'i blo mthun byas pa de kho na bzhin 'dir yang yin pas 'dir gzhung mngas pa'i 'jigs pas spros nas ma bris so //
translated: Here, fearing too many words, I will not elaborate.🔽The purification should be stated.

original: yongs su dag pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i dge 'dun ma'i gso sbyong gi bar du gcod par byed pa nyes pa'i dri ma dang bral lo zhes bya ba de ltar brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i dge 'dun ma'i gso sbyong gi bar du gcod par byed pa nyes pa'i dri ma dang bral lo zhes bya ba de ltar brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: The purification of the community of nuns is stated as being free from the stain of the fault that interrupts the poṣadha.

original: phyi bzhin 'brangs te zhes bya ba ni rjes bzhin du song ba'o //
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brangs te zhes bya ba ni rjes bzhin du song ba'o //
translated: Following after means going after.

original: dum bu lnga pa zhes bya ba la sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba lnga dang ldan pa 'khor lo dang 'dra bas na 'khor pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: dum bu lnga pa zhes bya ba la sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba lnga dang ldan pa 'khor lo dang 'dra bas na 'khor pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: The five-part wheel means the wheel of cyclic existence, which is like a wheel in that it has five parts, such as the hell realm.

original: gso sbyong ni dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong ni dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: The purification ceremony is that of the community of nuns.

original: de mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni brda la mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni brda la mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: Not clear means not skilled in the symbolic language.

original: de dag gis dge slong gzhan la ma gsol bar zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas lung ston pa'i sgo nas blo mthun med par ro //
analyzed: de dag gis dge slong gzhan la ma gsol bar zhes bya ba ni dge slong mas lung ston pa'i sgo nas blo mthun med par ro //
translated: Without asking another monk means without the consent of a nun who is a teacher.

original: ma spobs te zhes bya ba ni zil gyis non par sla ba'o //
analyzed: ma spobs te zhes bya ba ni zil gyis non par sla ba'o //
translated: Not eloquent means easily overwhelmed.

original: skyes bu tha mal pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa dman par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu tha mal pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa dman par gyur pa'o //
translated: Ordinary person means one who has inferior conduct.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bsod nams ma yin pa nyid du rung ba mang du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bsod nams ma yin pa nyid du rung ba mang du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Much non-meritoriousness will increase means one will become fit for much non-meritoriousness.

original: mtshan bzangs mo zhes bya ba ni mtshan mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan bzangs mo zhes bya ba ni mtshan mdzes pa yin no //
translated: The term beautiful woman means a woman with a beautiful face.

analyzed: yang na byi ba'o //

original: tshig skyel la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig skyel la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: gseb lam gyis 'tsho ba ni rkun po la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: brdegs pa la sogs pas gang @153b las 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du skrag pa med pa'o //
translated: “Fearless because of being beaten, etc.” means that they are not afraid in any way.

analyzed: dge slong gi spyod yul can zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi tha snyad la mkhas pa'am bka' la mkhas pa'o //
translated: One who is skilled in the domain of a monk is skilled in the terminology of a monk or skilled in the scriptures.

original: slu bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rngod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: slu bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rngod par byed pa yin te /

original: rnam pa gzhan nyid du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan nyid du ston pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'phel nas zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'i tshig yin no //

analyzed: rigs pa smra ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pas lan ldon pa la mkhas pa'o //

original: rgyud 'jam pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni sems brtse bas 'jam por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'jam pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni sems brtse bas 'jam por gyur pa'o //
translated: One who is skilled in being gentle is gentle due to his compassionate mind.

original: grong khyer ai tsa aa nang ka la de dang thag nye ba na gnas pa na aud ka ta zhes bya ba'i grong rdal te /
analyzed: grong khyer ai tsa aa nang ka la de dang thag nye ba na gnas pa na aud ka ta zhes bya ba'i grong rdal te /

analyzed: aud ka ta de kun nas longs spyod par byed pa'o //

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: rgyas pa zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa'i yo byad dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: gla skyed dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gla skyed dang bcas pas 'jug pa'i phyir gla skyed dang bcas pa nyid do //

analyzed: 'don pa dang ldan pas na bram ze'i bu'o //

original: bstan bcos du ma thos pa'i phyir mang du thos pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos du ma thos pa'i phyir mang du thos pa'o //

analyzed: thams cad du rung ba'i tshig la 'jug pa'i phyir rigs pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The word reasoned means that it is a word that is suitable in all circumstances.

analyzed: lan ldon pa'i dus su rab tu rigs pa'i tshig 'di la yod pas na zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: At the time of answering, it is a word that is very suitable. It exists in this. It is governed by this.

analyzed: skabs dang ldan pa 'brel pa'i tshig snyan pa'i ngang tshul gyi rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni snyan par smra ba can te /

analyzed: smrang zhes bya ba ni rig byed rnam par 'brel pa'i ngang la 'dir smang du bzhed do //
translated: Here, speech is accepted as the connection with the Vedas.

original: phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi'o //

original: mtshams zhes bya ba ni phyogs mtshams bzhi'o //
analyzed: mtshams zhes bya ba ni phyogs mtshams bzhi'o //

original: dge ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du nyes pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du nyes pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: snyan pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba na tshig gsum po de dag ni don gcig yin te /

analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang gi tshe cig car gcig la rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe tshig gsum po 'di dag tha dad pa'i bye brag ston par byed pa yin par rig par @154a * //
translated: When they are applied simultaneously to one thing, then these three terms should be understood to indicate a specific difference.

original: bya'o ; / de'i khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bya'o ; / de'i khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference is as follows:

original: mchog tu phan 'dogs par byed pa chos bstan pa la sogs pa yon tan gtso bor gyur pa dag gi grags pa rnam par rgyas pa ni snyan pa'i sgras brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: mchog tu phan 'dogs par byed pa chos bstan pa la sogs pa yon tan gtso bor gyur pa dag gi grags pa rnam par rgyas pa ni snyan pa'i sgras brjod pa yin te /
translated: The fame of those who are preeminent in benefiting others, such as through teaching the Dharma, is expressed by the term “good report.”

original: de ltar yang de chos ston pa ni thog mar dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang de chos ston pa ni thog mar dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that “his teaching of the Dharma is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end.”

original: rang gi don gtso bor gyur pa'i yon tan dag gi snyan pa rnam par rgyas pa ni sgra smos pas bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gi don gtso bor gyur pa'i yon tan dag gi snyan pa rnam par rgyas pa ni sgra smos pas bzung ba yin te /
translated: The fame of those who are preeminent in benefiting themselves is expressed by the term “renown.”

original: de ltar yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that “the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One...” and so on.

original: 'brel pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i grags pa rjod par byed pa ni tshigs su bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i grags pa rjod par byed pa ni tshigs su bcad pa yin no //
translated: A verse is a composition of words that is related to and in harmony with what is well known.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par gsung ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par gsung ba ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is one who speaks without error.

original: dngos po ji lta ba de bzhin du byon pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba de bzhin du byon pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is so called because he has come just as things are.

original: 'dir gang phyin ci ma log pa ston par mdzad pa zhes bya ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de ni ston pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gang phyin ci ma log pa ston par mdzad pa zhes bya ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de ni ston pa nyid yin no //
translated: Here, the Blessed One, the Buddha, is the teacher, because he teaches without error.

original: gang las de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang las de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From what does one become a Tathāgata?

original: dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.”

original: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mchod par 'os pa dang / nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir dgra bcom pa yin la /
analyzed: lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mchod par 'os pa dang / nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir dgra bcom pa yin la /
translated: He is an Arhat because he is worthy of worship by the world with its gods, and because he has abandoned the afflictions.

original: 'gro ba ma lus par yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus par yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin te /
translated: He is the Perfectly Enlightened One because he has fully realized the whole course of events.

original: 'dis ni bden pa rtogs par mdzad pa'i rgyu nyid brten pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bden pa rtogs par mdzad pa'i rgyu nyid brten pa yin no //
translated: This is the cause for the realization of the truth.

original: nyon mongs pas zil gyis gnon pa dang / mi shes pas zil gyis gnon pa ni log par smra ba yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas zil gyis gnon pa dang / mi shes pas zil gyis gnon pa ni log par smra ba yin te /
translated: The subjugation by the afflictions and the subjugation by ignorance are the false speech.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thugs su chud pa de'i phyir 'dis mi bden pa ma yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thugs su chud pa de'i phyir 'dis mi bden pa ma yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because of the abandonment of the afflictions and the realization of perfect enlightenment, he is not a liar.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang gang las she na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang gang las she na /
translated: From what is the abandonment of the afflictions and the realization of perfect enlightenment?

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase “endowed with knowledge and good conduct” is stated.

original: rig pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba yin la /
analyzed: rig pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba yin la /
translated: Knowledge is right view.

original: zhabs ni lam gyi yan lag bdun yin pa de'i phyir 'dis ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu yin par bstan to //
analyzed: zhabs ni lam gyi yan lag bdun yin pa de'i phyir 'dis ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu yin par bstan to //
translated: Good conduct is the seven limbs of enlightenment. Therefore, this teaches that the eightfold noble path is the cause for the abandonment of the afflictions and the realization of perfect enlightenment.

original: bde bar gshegs pa ni mdzes par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni mdzes par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Sugata is the one who goes well, i.e., beautifully.

original: yang phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir 'dis ni ldog pa med pa'i ston pa nyid brnyes @154b par bstan to //
analyzed: yang phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir 'dis ni ldog pa med pa'i ston pa nyid brnyes @154b par bstan to //
translated: This shows that he has attained the state of being a teacher who is irreversible.

original: 'jig rten skal ba dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa mkhyen pa'i phyir 'jig rten rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten skal ba dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa mkhyen pa'i phyir 'jig rten rig pa'o //
translated: He is the knower of the world because he knows the world with its good fortune and misfortune.

original: 'dis ni ston pa'i mdzad pa dang po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ston pa'i mdzad pa dang po bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the first deed of a teacher.

original: ston pa'i mdzad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ston pa'i mdzad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The deeds of a teacher are of two kinds:

original: skal ba dang ldan pa dang skal ba dang mi ldan pa so sor rtog pa ni dang po yin la /🔽skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa dang skal ba dang mi ldan pa so sor rtog pa ni dang po yin la / skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: the first is the discernment of those who have good fortune and those who do not;🔽the second is the teaching of the Dharma to those who have good fortune.

original: 'don par mdzad pa gnyis pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'don par mdzad pa gnyis pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dang po bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dang po bstan to //
translated: this shows the first deed.

original: gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to show the second deed, he says, “the charioteer who tames beings.”

original: skyes bu kho na 'dul bar bya ba dang 'dul bar 'os pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skyes bu 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: skyes bu kho na 'dul bar bya ba dang 'dul bar 'os pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skyes bu 'dul ba ste /
translated: It is the discipline of beings, because only beings are to be disciplined and are worthy of being disciplined.

original: de dag gi kha lo sgyur ba ni 'dul bar mdzad pa po yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi kha lo sgyur ba ni 'dul bar mdzad pa po yin no //
translated: The one who disciplines them is the one who tames them.

original: skyes bu 'dul ba khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The discipline of beings is preeminent, which is to say, it is unsurpassed.

original: sor phreng can la sogs pa gdul dka' ba rnams 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i bsod nyams la rjes su sbyor ba dang / bdag nyid kyi snyom las la rjes su sbyor ba yongs su spangs pa'i sgo nas bde bar 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: sor phreng can la sogs pa gdul dka' ba rnams 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i bsod nyams la rjes su sbyor ba dang / bdag nyid kyi snyom las la rjes su sbyor ba yongs su spangs pa'i sgo nas bde bar 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because he disciplines those who are difficult to discipline, such as Aṅgulimāla, and because he disciplines them comfortably, having completely abandoned attachment to sensual pleasures and to his own comfort,

original: phyir ldog pa med par 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir kha lo sgyur ba blan med pa yin te /
analyzed: phyir ldog pa med par 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir kha lo sgyur ba blan med pa yin te /
translated: and because he disciplines them without turning back, he is the unsurpassed guide.

original: 'dis ni skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'don par mdzad pa ston pa'i phrin las gnyis pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'don par mdzad pa ston pa'i phrin las gnyis pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the second kind of action of the buddhas, which is to lead beings according to their spiritual gene.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i mdzad pa'i snod yin te /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i mdzad pa'i snod yin te /
translated: The expression “teacher of gods and men” indicates that he is the vessel for the deeds of a teacher.

original: 'dis ni ston pa'i mdzad pa'i snod lha dang mi rnams yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni ston pa'i mdzad pa'i snod lha dang mi rnams yin gyi /
translated: This indicates that gods and men are the vessels for the deeds of a teacher,

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la /🔽sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su rab tu grags pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la / sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su rab tu grags pa yin pa ste /
translated: but that no one else is.🔽The expression “Buddha Bhagavat” indicates that he is the one who has attained the highest excellence.

original: de la sangs rgyas zhes rab tu grags pa gang yin pa de ni ston pa ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas zhes rab tu grags pa gang yin pa de ni ston pa ste /
translated: The word “Buddha” indicates that he is the Bhagavat Buddha, who is well known.

original: gong du smos pa'i yon tan de dag dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //🔽'jig rten lha dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni lha gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i yon tan de dag dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro // 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni lha gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the word “Buddha” is “he who has attained the highest excellence,” because he is endowed with the qualities mentioned above.

original: bdud dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdud dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The expression “the world with its gods” indicates that the gods are the most important beings in the world.🔽The expression “with Mara and with Brahma” indicates that

original: 'dod pa'i khams ma lus pa'i bdud gtso bor gyur pa de'i phyir bdud dang bcas pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ma lus pa'i bdud gtso bor gyur pa de'i phyir bdud dang bcas pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Mara is the most important being in the entire realm of desire.

original: tshangs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang 'brel pa rnams kyi tshangs pa gtso bor gyur pa de'i phyir tshangs pa dang bcas pa zhes bstan to //🔽bram ze dang @155a * //🔽dge sbyong du bcas zhes bya ba ni mi rnams las dge sbyong dang bram ze gtso bor gyur pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang 'brel pa rnams kyi tshangs pa gtso bor gyur pa de'i phyir tshangs pa dang bcas pa zhes bstan to // bram ze dang @155a * // dge sbyong du bcas zhes bya ba ni mi rnams las dge sbyong dang bram ze gtso bor gyur pa de'i phyir /
translated: The phrase along with Brahma indicates that Brahma is the chief of those who are associated with a retinue.🔽The phrase along with Brahmins indicates that Brahmins are the chief of humans.

original: dge sbyong dang bram zar bcas pa'i skye dgu zhes smos so //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram zar bcas pa'i skye dgu zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase along with ascetics and Brahmins indicates that ascetics and Brahmins are the chief of those who are devoted to the practice of religion.

original: lha dang mir bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni rgyud lngar skyes pa'i sems can dag las lha dang mi rnams kho na bden pa bzhi'i snod du gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lha dang mir bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni rgyud lngar skyes pa'i sems can dag las lha dang mi rnams kho na bden pa bzhi'i snod du gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase along with gods and humans indicates that gods and humans are the only ones among the five types of rebirths who are vessels for the four noble truths.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin pa de'i phyir lha dang mir bcas pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin pa de'i phyir lha dang mir bcas pa zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase along with gods and humans is stated because the others are not.

original: mthong ba'i chos nyid la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i skye ba la'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos nyid la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i skye ba la'o //
translated: The phrase in this very life means in the present rebirth.

original: bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis lung phog pa med par ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis lung phog pa med par ro //
translated: The phrase by his own superknowledge and spiritual power means without the assistance of others.

original: mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: The term “superknowledge” refers to the knowledge of an omniscient being.

original: mngon sum du byas shing zhes bya ba ni the tshom med par shes pas so //🔽thob pas na zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyis kun nas 'gengs pa'am /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas shing zhes bya ba ni the tshom med par shes pas so // thob pas na zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyis kun nas 'gengs pa'am /
translated: The phrase “having realized” refers to the knowledge that is free of doubt.

original: chen po nyid du yongs su gcod pa'o //🔽rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni shes par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: chen po nyid du yongs su gcod pa'o // rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni shes par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The phrase “having attained” refers to the knowledge that is filled with joy or the knowledge that is fully ascertained as being great.

original: gzhan dag la btsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la btsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “he knows” refers to the knowledge that is gained or the knowledge that is sought from others.

original: ci zhig rab tu shes pa yin zhe na /🔽nga'i skye ba ni zad do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci zhig rab tu shes pa yin zhe na / nga'i skye ba ni zad do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is that knowledge?🔽The passage states, “My births have been exhausted.”

original: kho bo'i skye ba'i srid pa rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kho bo'i skye ba'i srid pa rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: This means that my births have come to an end.

original: skye ba'i srid pa zad pa yang gang las she na /
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa zad pa yang gang las she na /
translated: From what births have they come to an end?

original: tshangs par spyod pa spyad do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa spyad do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The passage states, “I have practiced pure conduct.”

original: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Brahma is nirvana.

original: gang gis de la spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa ste lam yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gis de la spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa ste lam yin zhing /
translated: The path is called “pure conduct” because it is practiced in order to attain that.

original: de la spyad pa ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyad pa ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: Practice is the state of abiding in all of the self.

original: gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'phags pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one abides in the perfection of the noble path,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: all counteragents are eliminated.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par ldog par rung ba'i tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa de'i phyir skye bo'i srid pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par ldog par rung ba'i tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa de'i phyir skye bo'i srid pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Since one abides in the pure life in which all counteragents are eliminated, one completes the existence of a living being.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skye ba zad par byas pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skye ba zad par byas pa ni ma yin la /
translated: For that very reason, one does not eliminate birth,

original: byas pa ni skyes bu'i don yin no //
analyzed: byas pa ni skyes bu'i don yin no //
translated: but one accomplishes the purpose of a person.

original: skye ba zad par gyur kyang bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i srid pa bar ma do'i bya ba nyon mongs pa zad pa yang yong pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba zad par gyur kyang bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i srid pa bar ma do'i bya ba nyon mongs pa zad pa yang yong pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Even though birth is not eliminated, is it not the case that the existence of the intermediate state, which is the activity of the intermediate state, is not eliminated?

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “There is no other existence after this one.”

original: yod na srid pa bar ma do'i bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod na srid pa bar ma do'i bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it did, it would be the activity of the intermediate existence.

original: de nyid kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: But that does not exist.

original: gang la bya ba yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la bya ba yod par 'gyur /
translated: So how could there be activity?

original: des chos bstan pa ni bstan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: des chos bstan pa ni bstan pa'i chos so //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is the Dharma that is taught.

original: thog @155b mar dge ba zhes ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yongs su bcad pa'i dus su bde ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽bar du dge ba zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas yongs su bde ba skyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thog @155b mar dge ba zhes ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yongs su bcad pa'i dus su bde ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro // bar du dge ba zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas yongs su bde ba skyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is virtuous in the beginning because it generates happiness at the time of being ascertained by the knowledge derived from hearing.🔽It is virtuous in the middle because it generates happiness at the time of being ascertained by the knowledge derived from contemplation.

original: tha mar dge ba zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i dus su bde ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: tha mar dge ba zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i dus su bde ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is virtuous in the end because it generates happiness at the time of being ascertained by the knowledge derived from meditation.

original: / dag par byed pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir don bzang po'o //
analyzed: / dag par byed pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir don bzang po'o //
translated: It has good meaning because it has the meaning of purification.

original: tshig 'bru kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir tshig 'bru bzang po'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir tshig 'bru bzang po'o //
translated: It has good words because it has words that are irreproachable.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa'i chos bshad pa na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa'i chos bshad pa na /
translated: When the Dharma is explained with such aspects,

original: don ci zhig ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: don ci zhig ston par byed ce na /
translated: what meaning does it teach?

original: smras pa / tshangs par spyod pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / tshangs par spyod pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: He replied: “It teaches pure conduct.”

original: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i tshangs par spyod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i tshangs par spyod pa yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of pure conduct is it?

original: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to be “perfect,”

original: dum bur ma gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dum bur ma gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because it is not incomplete.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa dang / skyes bu'i don skyed par byed pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa dang / skyes bu'i don skyed par byed pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is perfect because it generates the purpose of beings.

original: nyes pa yongs su spong ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa yongs su spong ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure because it is the cause for abandoning faults.

original: rtag pa'i gnas thob par byed pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su byang ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i gnas thob par byed pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su byang ba'o //
translated: It is purified because it causes one to attain a state of permanence.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob pa phyed kyi grogs la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob pa phyed kyi grogs la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir 'ba' zhig go //
translated: It is alone because it does not depend on the assistance of a companion in attaining the desired goal.

original: tshangs par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i la ma mo //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i la ma mo //
translated: Pure conduct is the path of the noble ones.

original: ljongs rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ljongs rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Wandering in the country” means

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'gro zhing 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'gro zhing 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: going and engaging due to the power of necessity.

original: rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyud gnyis su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyud gnyis su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Two lineages would result means two continua would result.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor los rgyal srid la 'jug pa'i ngang tshul gyi rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni 'khor los sgyur ba'o //🔽ri rab la ltos pa'i mtha' bzhi gang la yod pa de na mtha' bzhi ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor los rgyal srid la 'jug pa'i ngang tshul gyi rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni 'khor los sgyur ba'o // ri rab la ltos pa'i mtha' bzhi gang la yod pa de na mtha' bzhi ba ste /
translated: A universal monarch is one who has the nature of engaging in ruling a kingdom with a wheel.🔽One who has the four continents in dependence on Mount Meru is a ruler of the four continents.

original: gling bzhi pa'i bdag po byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa'i bdag po byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is the lord of the four continents.

original: rnam par btul nas zhes bya ba ni rnam par rgyal ba'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: rnam par btul nas zhes bya ba ni rnam par rgyal ba'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: Having conquered means having the nature of being victorious.

original: 'di la mi rgyal ba'i yul yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //🔽chos spyod pa'i phyir chos dang ldan pa'o //🔽chos kyi rgyal ba can ni chos kyi rgyal po ste /
analyzed: 'di la mi rgyal ba'i yul yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o // chos spyod pa'i phyir chos dang ldan pa'o // chos kyi rgyal ba can ni chos kyi rgyal po ste /
translated: There is no country that is not subject to him.🔽He is righteous because he practices the Dharma.🔽He is a Dharma king because he is a king of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi rgyal srid byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal srid byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is a Dharma king because he rules through the Dharma.

original: rnyed dka' ba dang / 'dod pa'i don gyi 'bras bu can yin bas na rin po che zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnyed dka' ba dang / 'dod pa'i don gyi 'bras bu can yin bas na rin po che zhes bstan to //
translated: Since it is difficult to obtain and is the result of the desired aim, it is called a jewel.

original: bang mdzod la dbang byed pa na khyim bdag rin po che yin no //
analyzed: bang mdzod la dbang byed pa na khyim bdag rin po che yin no //
translated: When he has control over the treasury, it is the jewel of the householder.

original: dmag dpon rin po che ni /
analyzed: dmag dpon rin po che ni /
translated: The jewel of the general

original: sgrub par byed pa'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i bdag po'o //
translated: is the lord of the army.

original: mchog tu spro ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir dpa' bo'o //🔽lus kyi bya bas pha rol gyi stobs zil gyis gnon pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa nyid @156a * //
analyzed: mchog tu spro ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir dpa' bo'o // lus kyi bya bas pha rol gyi stobs zil gyis gnon pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa nyid @156a * //
translated: He is a hero because he is extremely courageous.

original: kyi phyir brtan pa'o //
analyzed: kyi phyir brtan pa'o //
translated: He is steadfast because he has the ability to overcome the strength of others through physical action.

original: yan lag dang nyid lag mdzes pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gzugs kha dog bzang ba nyid kyi phyir yan lag mchog gi gzugs so //
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag mdzes pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gzugs kha dog bzang ba nyid kyi phyir yan lag mchog gi gzugs so //
translated: He has the form of the best of limbs because his limbs and digits are beautiful and his bodily form has an excellent color.

original: kha cig ni de yan lag gi mchog gi stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya bar 'dod do //🔽pha rol gyi dpung gi tshogs rnam par 'joms pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig ni de yan lag gi mchog gi stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya bar 'dod do // pha rol gyi dpung gi tshogs rnam par 'joms pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Some say that he has the strength of the best of limbs.

original: pha rol gyi sde rab tu 'dul bar byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sde rab tu 'dul bar byed pa rnams so //
translated: He is the one who subdues the armies of others because he completely destroys the armies of others.🔽He is the one who completely subdues the armies of others.

original: sa chen po smos pas ni gling bzhi pa yongs su bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: sa chen po smos pas ni gling bzhi pa yongs su bzung ba yin no //
translated: By mentioning the great earth, the four continents are included.

original: sa chen po de mngon par bkug nas zhes bya ba ni dbang du byas nas te /
analyzed: sa chen po de mngon par bkug nas zhes bya ba ni dbang du byas nas te /
translated: Having drawn the great earth to himself, he has brought it under his control.

original: kun nas gnon ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun nas gnon ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by “having overcome.”

original: gnas par byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas par byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: He remains in it.

original: bdag po byed pa'i sgo nas gnas par byed pa'am /
analyzed: bdag po byed pa'i sgo nas gnas par byed pa'am /
translated: He remains in it by being its master,

original: longs spyod par byed pa'am /
analyzed: longs spyod par byed pa'am /
translated: by enjoying it,

original: srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: and by protecting it.

original: khyad par ci lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: khyad par ci lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What is its special quality?

original: ma lus pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma lus pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He mentions “in its entirety” and so on.

original: ljongs thams cad las rgyal ba'i phyir ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: ljongs thams cad las rgyal ba'i phyir ma lus pa'o //
translated: It is in its entirety because it is victorious over all the lands.

original: rgyal srid kyi dgra tsher ma med pa'i phyir dgra med pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal srid kyi dgra tsher ma med pa'i phyir dgra med pa ste /
translated: It is without enemies because it is free from the thorns of enemies to the kingdom.

original: gnod pa'i rtsom pa dang ldan pa'i rgyal phrug la sogs pa ni rgyal srid kyi dgrar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa'i rtsom pa dang ldan pa'i rgyal phrug la sogs pa ni rgyal srid kyi dgrar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Princes and so on who are engaged in harming it are enemies to the kingdom.

original: ngag rtsub mo'i sgo nas gnod pa med pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ngag rtsub mo'i sgo nas gnod pa med pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without violence because there is no harm from harsh speech.

original: rnam pa gang gis mngon par bkug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mngon par bkug pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what aspect does he draw it to himself?

original: chad pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chad pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Without cessation” and so on.

original: gser la sogs pa'i chad pas gcod pa la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir chad pa med pas so //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa'i chad pas gcod pa la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir chad pa med pas so //
translated: Because there is no engagement in cutting off gold and so on, there is no cessation.
